story:
UPDATE

GREAT NEWS!

Because of YOU we have reached over $15,000 in donations and we are going to begin our adventure.

Here is a list of cities that we will be visiting:

August 10-11th, Chicago / Illinois

August 13th, Milwaukee / Wisconsin

August 14th, Madison / Wisconsin

August 15th, Minneapolis / Minnesota

August 16th, Des Moines  / Iowa

August 17th, Kansas City / Missouri

August 18th, St. Louis / Missouri

For more information, or to let us know that you want to come take your THE NEW F WORD photo, please follow this link and fill out the form!!

http://www.friendmovement.com/fword.html

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for believing in this vision and for helping this dream come to life! We know that you will continue to share our campaign and donate as you can ...

Sample Tweet/Facebook Post
GO DONATE: The New F Word is FRIEND
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-the-new-f-word-an-anti-bully-photo-campaign

Your friends,

Ronnie & Elliot
co-founders
Friend Movement
http://www.friendmovement.com

Donations are Tax Deductible  

After nearly a year of passion, dedication, and development coupled with the unwavering support of our family, friends, and some of our favorite celebs ...

Friend Movement proudly presents: 

"THE NEW F WORD - GIVING BULLYING THE BIRD"

An edgy anti-bully campaign and brainchild of producers Ronnie Kroell & Elliot London, photographer Ryan Forbes, and branding guru Bianca Kosoy. The New F Word aims to keep the conversation about bullying alive, but more importantly it was designed to empower individuals and inspire all of us to take ACTION.

Our goal is to shoot ...

10,000 Photos in 90 Days, across 40 Cities

Fresno, Sacramento, Reno, Eugene, Seattle, Portland, Spokane, Billings, Fargo, Minneapolis, Madison, Rockford, Chicago, Detroit, Cleveland, Rochester, Boston, Provincetown, Philadelphia, DC, Raleigh, NYC, Savannah, Jacksonville, Tampa, Orlando, Tallahassee, Mobile, Montgomery, Atlanta, Chattanooga, Nashville  Birmingham, Jackson, Little Rock, Kansas City, Omaha, Denver, Salt Lake City, Las Vegas.

When someone is being bullied, we want them to have an inner monologue of "F-U  I'm amazing ... I don't need your approval." By doing so, they can reclaim their power and rise above the fear that can prevent them from being the diverse, confident, and beautiful individuals they were meant to be.

Bullying doesn't discriminate. It effects people of all ages, genders, sizes, races, religions, sexual orientations, and so much more. Studies have shown that the long term effects of being bullied can be devastating, often times leading to severe depression and even suicide. One solution, according to Dr. Jaana Juvonen at UCLA, is to have at least one friend to confide in and to help alleviate everyday stress.

Lizzie Velasquez was called the ugliest woman in the world by cyber-bullies. She's now an author, a motivational speaker, and an amazing FRIEND. 

Here are some facts!

  • 1 in 4 kids in the United States is being bullied
  • 160,000 kids stay home from school every day out of fear of being bullied.
  • 75% of all school shootings have been directly related to harassment/bullying.
Bullied teen, Joseph Sears, meets his idol Adam Lambert on set of THE NEW F WORD. 

It's OK to be angry about this information. In fact, we must get angry, but It is how we channel that anger towards finding positive solutions that makes all the difference. The opposite of bullying is FRIENDSHIP. As long as we can lean on our friends, in good times and challenging ones, we are never alone. Please join us in this journey by adding your voice, sharing your story, and dedicating your dollars.

While we may not be able to fully eradicate bullying, we can commit to being better friends to one another - to ourselves. So, get those middle fingers ready because THE NEW F WORD is FRIEND.

Thank you for your time and support!!

Ronnie & Elliot

P.S. Go FRIEND yourself! Change your middle name on Facebook & Twitter to "FRIEND" and join our growing family around the world. :)

While we are currently working on sharing Friend Movement with the United States, we realize that Bullying is a global issue and hope people all over the world will join our cause.
Join us on Monday July 1, 2013 in Los Angeles for our Friend Movement Benefit Concert featuring LeAnn Rimes! Get your tickets by clicking this photo.
We are so thankful to have partnered with GLAAD Organization and appreciate their friendship!

story:
I Need To See You...

Life is empty without the people in it..

Since 2006 I've been taking portraits of friends, strangers, musicians, painters, shooters, dancers, rebels, actors, farmers, beekeepers - and anyone else that caught my attention.  There was a story to be had in every face, and the friendships made with a camera have become more valuable to me than the pictures themselves.  

After 7 years I've decided to make a book called, "I Need To See You". 

Why should this book be made?

We have grown accustom to the digital experience, but I still need to touch the photos I love.  As a result I have produced a library of archival quality prints,

made hundreds of zines...

and even more art journals...

This book has been on my mind for a long time and will contain my strongest work to date. 

While mainly focused on portraiture it will also be spliced with the odd summit,

abandoned structure,

aerial,

and more.. 

I love Vancouver - my aim is to bring more attention to its art/music scenes, and make a tangible memoir available for the people in them.

While the beauty of the west is nearly inescapable, I am still attached to my creative roots out east, and this book would not be complete without them...

As this project runs I will be on a road trip to shoot talent that I've had my eye on in NY, Toronto, Windsor/Detroit and a bunch of places in between. 

This will be the last stint of portraits before putting the book together.

About me

My name is Jonathan Dy, I went to school for painting and became a self-taught pro photographer over the last few years. 

While the principles of composition, colour and light are present in both mediums, the processes couldn't be more different... As a painter I thrived on intuition and isolation, with the camera I need to connect and take quick measurements of my surroundings.  Although methods have changed, one thing that has remained consistent throughout my work is people - our emotions, gestures and motives are an endless source of exploration.  

Book Details

Full Colour
Over 100 high quality pages
Perfect bound
8"x8.25"
Soft Cover (hard cover if I raise enough money)
No more than one picture per page
Limited Edition
Signed and numbered


What I need to make it happen

I've set my goal at $3500. That will just barely cover the cost of printing and shipping for a limited edition of 100.  The bigger the edition the lower the printing price goes per book. IF I can make it past that mark then I can consider a hard cover and possibly adding more pages.  The more I raise the better the end product will be for everyone.

I also need money to shoot while I'm on the road until the end of June.  When this campaign ends it will take a month to put the book together, and the more funds I have, the more time I can spend on detail.

I've set no limit to any of the perks, so the quality and quantity of this book is, to a great extent, in your hands.

I'm going to make this the best thing I've ever done.  I'm going to pour so much love into each page it will make your eyes swell.

But I need all the help I can get.

Please contribute in any way that you can, post, tweet, and email it to anyone that might be interested - everything counts.  

If you have any questions contact me at jdformed@gmail.com

Thanks for your support!

Follow this project on facebook

Links to more of my work

Website

Flickr

Behance

tumblr

story:
Short Summary

The children of Haiti have almost no tools to take part in the modern world. I have a program that helps them take a first step, and we do it with cameras.

I'm asking for your help to provide critical training and empower 50 of my photography students ages 10-18 during a 10-day Photo Camp this July in Jacmel, Haiti, called Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto. Jouk Li Jou is a Haitian saying that means working hard to see a better life, and we'll keep fighting to the end.

I am Jennifer Cheek Pantaléon, a photographer, and executive director and co-founder along with my Haitian husband of Zanmi Lakay, a nonprofit working in Haiti supporting children through education, outreach, and community arts programs. We have been teaching Photography Workshops to street children in Haiti for 15 years.

I will be leading the second annual Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto/Youth Photo Camp where children from Cité Soleil and Jacmel work together learning vital skills to help them shape their future. This project furnishes the resources for them to photograph local daily assignments, and then edit and process their digital images with the help of a volunteer team of professional photojournalists. Our base camp for Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto will be the headquarters of one of our partners, Art Creation Foundation for Children, in Jacmel, a poor yet beautiful historical seaside town known for its artisans. The images will be printed and hung for an exhibition at the Fosaj Gallery, and the month long show will open with a public reception Friday July 27, 2012, where dancers, drummers, Kanaval devils, artists, subjects, students, family and friends come together to celebrate their community and the student's work.

Why We Need Your Support

Your funding will go toward sponsoring children from Cité Soleil, one of Haiti's most impoverished shantytowns located in Port-au-Prince, to attend the Jacmel Photo Camp, transportation with local drivers, lodging and food for the kids and team, photography and computer equipment and supplies, and production of the exhibition opening reception including performances by local artists and dancers.

These students are photo ambassadors learning how to share and inform people about Haiti from a Haitian point of view. With the simple addition of a camera, and the technical training, children become more a part of their own society to make it better. 

Your support will have a positive and direct impact improving and uplifting the lives of poor children, as well as empowering them to promote progress within their own community.

The Impact

At last year's first Photo Camp, 43 students made over 12,100 digital images in three days (http://www.zanmilakayblog.org/jouk-li-jou-kan-foto-2011-project-overview-and-exhibition-slideshow/). They shot multiple assignments, collected caption information, and had one on one editing sessions with a professional photographer. Every student had at least one large print in the main exhibition collection of 70, and an additional 216 images were chosen from extra daily assignments to create four collages. The mayor of Jacmel, the US ambassador to Haiti, photo subjects, and others visited the exhibit. 

The photographic and computer technical skills, group dynamics, and community involvement are accomplished because of resources we can provide and organize along with the experience of volunteer professionals - simple tools otherwise unattainable that can completely change the path of a child's life with new possibilities giving them more options for their future.

Haiti is often depicted as violent and dangerous in the foreign press. During the Photography Workshops held after the earthquake of January 2010, my students challenged themselves to take better photographs than the non-Haitian journalists as well as to reflect their country in a more honest way. In February 2010, some of their work was published on the New York Times Lens Blog (http://lens.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/02/17/behind-33/ ), and they were invited by galleries to have exhibitions in four cities throughout the United States. In return these street kids who are usually ignored built confidence, learned practical skills, their minds opened to new possibilities and options, and they produced beautiful photos shared in public spaces. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the extra funds to support our project, but it would help us so much if you would please share this link and information about Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto, Zanmi Lakay, and the kids in Haiti with your friends. We are also collecting working digital cameras for our students along with other items on our Wish List (http://www.zanmilakayblog.org/zanmi-lakays-jouk-li-jou-kan-foto-2012-our-second-annual-photo-camp-for-haitian-youth/).

On behalf of 50 young budding Haitian photographers, my deepest thanks for your support!

story:
MY STORY

I, Kellis Nobles, am a aspiring professional photographer residing in Greensboro, North Carolina. I am seeking a bit of help in procuring the means to acquire a professional SLR camera (a Canon 5D Mark III). Knoblesphotography simply wants to get down to business! But that's only possible with a professional SLR camera. In order to be competitive, to be able to shoot in all conditions, and to offer the highest quality images and products (nothing but the best results), I must shoot with a full frame high end camera (in addition to various professional lenses and lighting units) - that's the bottom line! This level of equipment is expensive but it will be reflected in the quality of results I deliver.

YOUR LOVE

My beloved family and friends, your help (even a pledge of $5) will help enable my dream of a highly creative and sought-after headshot photography business become a reality. I have the vision and the passion and I'm ready (boy, am I ready) to get started, but I just need the right tool. You may see my work at knoblesphotography.virb.com.

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

I need $3,500, which will go entirely to the acquisition of a Canon 5D Mark III. If I don't reach my goal March 15 2013, I will continue saving all my pennies in order to meet the goal. What You Will Get in return for even the smallest donations are rewards! I am offering gifts in return for your generous donations! Anything will help and I will greatly appreciate your donation.

 

Disclaimer: These perks are only limited to Greensboro NC and surrounding areas.

story:
South America: Chile, Argentina, Peru, Ecuador

I am on a continuous journey, learning to interpret the map of life. I have been on my path for quite a long time.  At the age of 30, I am learning the importance of strengthening my personal compass to continue this journey of realizing my full creative potential.  

My goal with this campaign is simple; raise funds for needed photography equipment (and equipment contingency fund) while I pursue a culturally rich, three-month trip through Chile, Argentina, Peru, and Ecuador.

Helping fund my campaign is not paying for a 'vacation'. This once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to travel through South America was gifted to me by an amazing (very amazing) friend. I will use this travel opportunity for professional development of my Photography and writing. 
People often ask me, 'what would your ideal job be?'. To which I usually respond - 'travel photography'. I realize this is not a profession that you just get hired for, and BOOM! You're a travel photographer! Being a travel photographer is a long-term journey, full of trials and tests of commitment. It's a profession you work TOWARDS, slowly building up your experience and travel portfolio. It is in recognizing these facts that I enthusiastically said YES to this amazing trip.

As I said, one of my biggest goals in traveling through South America is the development of my photography. Having the correct equipment will ensure that I can take full advantage of my time abroad. Having some emergency funds for unforeseen expenses will also allow me to make the most of this amazing opportunity. I will fully immerse myself in the culture of South America, shooting photo/video and writing about the experience.

What are your funds being used for?

Here are the details...

        


My goal is to raise $6000 US, this will help purchase:
  • 2nd Body - Canon 5D Markiii (approx. $2499). Currently my primary camera is a Canon 6D - it has performed perfectly, producing amazing photos. Having a second body is a NECESSITY, especially on a trip of this length and magnitude. If my primary camera fails, I need a second camera body ready to go (warranty and insurance claims take too long to expect replacement gear while in the field - this would lead to missed opportunities for shooting.)
  • Tamron 15-30mm f/2.8 wide angle zoom lens (approx. $1199). This lens is superbly built, very favorably reviewed, and much more affordable then the Canon equivalent. A wide-angle lens is a must for capturing amazing landscapes and dramatic action.
  • Canon 600EX-RT Speedlight (approx. $499). I strive to shoot using natural light but every now and again a speedlight is an essential tool. Having a powerful speedlight will open up opportunities for creative shooting as well as shooting in low-light situations when ambient light is not bright enough.
  • Contingency equipment fund (remaining $1800). The remaining $1800 will be reserved as a contingency equipment fund to pay for field repair or additional equipment that I may need (i.e. additional lens,filters, lighting, or audio equipment).
What if I don't reach my goal of $6000? Never fear - I understand the reality of NOT reaching my funding goal, in which case I will have to prioritize use of available funds. My biggest initial priority is a second camera body. If I do not raise enough funds for a 5D Markiii body I will explore less expensive options. If I don't raise enough funds for any of the listed equipment, all funds will be put in my contingency equipment fund, use TBD based on the needs of the trip.

The Impact of your Contribution

With a trip of this nature, exploring and experiencing the real South America, the last thing I want to concern myself with is photo equipment. However, it is a necessary component of documenting the amazing places I am about to visit. Your contribution will allowing me to bring a broad range of equipment, allowing me to capture the true essence of my travels in any circumstance.


Why support MY opportunity to travel?

As a World citizen, I view myself as a part of the spectrum that makes up our culturally diverse world. I have a diverse work background, ample experience traveling in the United States, and a desire to foster cross-cultural understanding and tolerance. Helping me acquire the tools I need to document and share my journey supports positive change in this world in a multitude of ways:

  • I am a sensitive and understanding American ambassador who sees and wants to understand the differences and qualities that makes all cultures valuable additions to our world community.
  • I want to help others on my journey and plan to seek out volunteer opportunities when appropriate.
  • I want to photograph, shoot video, and capture audio to create captivating content, documenting my experience immersing myself in foreign cultures. This content will motivate individuals to seek value in travel, foster cultural sensitivity, and encourage them to see the value of functioning as 'world citizens'.

Risks & Challenges

I realize there is risk in my endeavor. My concern, first and foremost is my personal safety. We will be in a foreign country in a time when the US is often not thought of favorably. Second to my safety is the safety of my equipment, without which I cannot document my experience or create compelling content (which is a major goal for me and the reason I am asking for your money!).


Traveling together (with my amazing travel companion) will inherently be safer then traveling alone and we intend to be fully aware of our surroundings and knowledgable about locations we travel to. A big part of this will rely on prior research and information gathering from friends, acquaintances, and other travelers who have been to the places we intend to visit. A third and possibly one of the most viable and potent means of  creating a safe travel experience is our network of contacts in the countries we plan on visiting. We will have 'insider' info from established friends and locals who we befriend though couch-surfing opportunities, work-stay programs, volunteering, and organic interactions. Trust us, we want to come back in once piece!


Money is not the only way to help!

I recognize that you may see value in my endeavor but don't have the financial freedom to contribute in the form of dollars. THIS IS OK! The following are some ways you can help me in achieving my goals:

  • First and foremost, help share this campaign with people who CAN contribute financially. Have a wealthy Uncle? Have a financially capable Aunt? Pass my information along to them, and more importantly, help make the case for my cause.
  • Help me realize partnership opportunities. I know a lot of people want 'something for nothing'. I am NOT one of those people. I would love to explore opportunities that may exist to offer my creative services in return for help with my goals.
  • Share connections you may have in Argentina, Chile, Peru, or Ecuador. Have family or friends who we could stay with for a day or two...or a week? Have a business partner who can offer a unique cultural experience? Know someone who can help us get involved in a rewarding volunteer opportunity? You get the idea.
  • Donate gear. Do you have any photography/videography/sound gear you would be willing to donate? Do you have a travel solar panel so we can recharge our electronics when we are trekking through the Andes? If you have something you think we might find useful, let's talk about it.
story_txt:
South America: Chile, Argentina, Peru, Ecuador

I am on a continuous journey, learning to interpret the map of life. I have been on my path for quite a long time.  At the age of 30, I am learning the importance of strengthening my personal compass to continue this journey of realizing my full creative potential.  
My goal with this campaign is simple; raise funds for needed photography equipment (and equipment contingency fund) while I pursue a culturally rich, three-month trip through Chile, Argentina, Peru, and Ecuador.
Helping fund my campaign is not paying for a 'vacation'. This once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to travel through South America was gifted to me by an amazing (very amazing) friend. I will use this travel opportunity for professional development of my Photography and writing. 
People often ask me, 'what would your ideal job be?'. To which I usually respond - 'travel photography'. I realize this is not a profession that you just get hired for, and BOOM! You're a travel photographer! Being a travel photographer is a long-term journey, full of trials and tests of commitment. It's a profession you work TOWARDS, slowly building up your experience and travel portfolio. It is in recognizing these facts that I enthusiastically said YES to this amazing trip.
As I said, one of my biggest goals in traveling through South America is the development of my photography. Having the correct equipment will ensure that I can take full advantage of my time abroad. Having some emergency funds for unforeseen expenses will also allow me to make the most of this amazing opportunity. I will fully immerse myself in the culture of South America, shooting photo/video and writing about the experience.
  What are your funds being used for? Here are the details...

        
 My goal is to raise $6000 US, this will help purchase:


2nd Body - Canon 5D Markiii (approx. $2499). Currently my primary camera is a Canon 6D - it has performed perfectly, producing amazing photos. Having a second body is a NECESSITY, especially on a trip of this length and magnitude. If my primary camera fails, I need a second camera body ready to go (warranty and insurance claims take too long to expect replacement gear while in the field - this would lead to missed opportunities for shooting.) 
Tamron 15-30mm f/2.8 wide angle zoom lens (approx. $1199). This lens is superbly built, very favorably reviewed, and much more affordable then the Canon equivalent. A wide-angle lens is a must for capturing amazing landscapes and dramatic action. 
Canon 600EX-RT Speedlight (approx. $499). I strive to shoot using natural light but every now and again a speedlight is an essential tool. Having a powerful speedlight will open up opportunities for creative shooting as well as shooting in low-light situations when ambient light is not bright enough.

Contingency equipment fund (remaining $1800). The remaining $1800 will be reserved as a contingency equipment fund to pay for field repair or additional equipment that I may need (i.e. additional lens,filters, lighting, or audio equipment). 
What if I don't reach my goal of $6000? Never fear - I understand the reality of NOT reaching my funding goal, in which case I will have to prioritize use of available funds. My biggest initial priority is a second camera body. If I do not raise enough funds for a 5D Markiii body I will explore less expensive options. If I don't raise enough funds for any of the listed equipment, all funds will be put in my contingency equipment fund, use TBD based on the needs of the trip.
   The Impact of your Contribution With a trip of this nature, exploring and experiencing the real South America, the last thing I want to concern myself with is photo equipment. However, it is a necessary component of documenting the amazing places I am about to visit. Your contribution will allowing me to bring a broad range of equipment, allowing me to capture the true essence of my travels in any circumstance.

Why support MY opportunity to travel?
As a World citizen, I view myself as a part of the spectrum that makes up our culturally diverse world. I have a diverse work background, ample experience traveling in the United States, and a desire to foster cross-cultural understanding and tolerance. Helping me acquire the tools I need to document and share my journey supports positive change in this world in a multitude of ways:
 I am a sensitive and understanding American ambassador who sees and wants to understand the differences and qualities that makes all cultures valuable additions to our world community. I want to help others on my journey and plan to seek out volunteer opportunities when appropriate.
I want to photograph, shoot video, and capture audio to create captivating content, documenting my experience immersing myself in foreign cultures. This content will motivate individuals to seek value in travel, foster cultural sensitivity, and encourage them to see the value of functioning as 'world citizens'.

    Risks & Challenges
I realize there is risk in my endeavor. My concern, first and foremost is my personal safety. We will be in a foreign country in a time when the US is often not thought of favorably. Second to my safety is the safety of my equipment, without which I cannot document my experience or create compelling content (which is a major goal for me and the reason I am asking for your money!).

Traveling together (with my amazing travel companion) will inherently be safer then traveling alone and we intend to be fully aware of our surroundings and knowledgable about locations we travel to. A big part of this will rely on prior research and information gathering from friends, acquaintances, and other travelers who have been to the places we intend to visit. A third and possibly one of the most viable and potent means of  creating a safe travel experience is our network of contacts in the countries we plan on visiting. We will have 'insider' info from established friends and locals who we befriend though couch-surfing opportunities, work-stay programs, volunteering, and organic interactions. Trust us, we want to come back in once piece!
   Money is not the only way to help! I recognize that you may see value in my endeavor but don't have the financial freedom to contribute in the form of dollars. THIS IS OK! The following are some ways you can help me in achieving my goals:  First and foremost, help share this campaign with people who CAN contribute financially. Have a wealthy Uncle? Have a financially capable Aunt? Pass my information along to them, and more importantly, help make the case for my cause.
Help me realize partnership opportunities. I know a lot of people want 'something for nothing'. I am NOT one of those people. I would love to explore opportunities that may exist to offer my creative services in return for help with my goals.

Share connections you may have in Argentina, Chile, Peru, or Ecuador. Have family or friends who we could stay with for a day or two...or a week? Have a business partner who can offer a unique cultural experience? Know someone who can help us get involved in a rewarding volunteer opportunity? You get the idea.

Donate gear. Do you have any photography/videography/sound gear you would be willing to donate? Do you have a travel solar panel so we can recharge our electronics when we are trekking through the Andes? If you have something you think we might find useful, let's talk about it.

story:
Below you can find listed all the prints I'm selling!

Why am I here?

Everything starts out from a period of unexpected expenses. And just before my NYC travel, I've already booked!

How can I fix my economic situation and raise my moral?
Let's try to sell some prints of my photographs!

I'm not a professional photographer and I've never earned a single euro from this passion. But now it's time to test if what I do is really appreciated by someone.

It's a new challenge for me! No matter how it will go,  it will be a great experience anyway!

Why Indiegogo? I decided not to create an e-commerce and to opt for a crowd funding campaign because I felt it was more honest: I'm not a professional photographer and there are thousands of enthusiastic and professionals who are better than me. I do not have the presumption of making the sales of my prints a constant activity over time.

However, I think that my shots are quite good and I will be pleased to sell them in exchange for some help!

What I'm offering:

In return for 30 € + shipping costs, you will receive the print of the photo you will choose.The print will be on 250g/m2  Fujifilm paper. It measures 40x60cm or 60x40cm.

The print will be signed and numbered. It will also have a short description of the subject or the location: when your guests will ask you info about your new wonderful print you will know how to answer them!

Do you live in Trento or in his surroundings? Make a 30€ donation instead of paying a specific perk and I will hand deliver the print. You will save your money!

The costs that I have:

  • il 5% to Indiegogo
  • il 3% +0,3€ to the payment system
  • 6,5€ for the print
  • 5€ for Italian shipping, 10€ for international shipping
  • around 18€ for me!

I will also have a one shot expense of 25€ for the international wire transfer from Indiegogo to my bank account.

I will begin to ship the orders starting from June the 20th 2017. Shipping will take around 10 days.

I don't like your photos, but I still like you!

Hey! Do not say that, I have feelings too! However, I will not force you to buy anything. You can still donate  5 € to help out. I will not judge you.
Why you should donate without buying anything? Because although it probably doesn't look like, photographing is made by efforts, commitment, and perseverance. And photography can also be some kind of expensive.

Don't want to give me money? It's ok! You can always help me by spreading the word!

The photos I'm selling

#1 Fiat Dino - The sexiest car


#2 Santorini

#3 NYC interchange


#4 I pastelli di Burano

#5 Tramonto - Toblino

#6 Il lago vuoto


#7 Lamborghini 


#8 Dolomiti

#9 Trastevere

#10 Framed

story:
Help me save my Arts District Photography Studio!

 

A little about me:

Hi, My name is Mallorie Nasrallah. The fancy phone in the video is not mine! ;)
I am a photographer in Las Vegas, Nevada. And if I may take a moment to feel awesome, the RAW Las Vegas photographer of the year!
That makes me rich right?
Nope, I am broke! Ive been making my living entirely off photography for 8 years now. I've got what I thought was a reasonable business plan, and I have slowly progressed as my work has gotten better, but living off your passion and your art is tough work, and often extremely expensive!

For 8 years now I have been releasing my work to the public, for whatever enjoyment people can get from it. The only time anyone pays a cent is if I am doing work specifically for them, or they want a physical print.

I try to be active in the community, with art donations, and other fun stuff.
I provide video tutorials for free on my photography blog.


If I could, I would shoot for free and give all my work away. For someone with a business plan, I really shouldn't think that way. But I love my work, and I love sharing it.

 

Why I need help.

The owner (Kamran Foulad) of the property I rent is trying to evict me for either discriminatory or retaliatory (or both) reasons.

Let me explain, the owner of the property is attempting to illegally evict me!
I pay rent on time, everyone in this area has been remarkably supportive, I really have done nothing wrong.

On March 27th I had a booking in the morning, I arrived at my studio early to set up. Upon arriving I discovered workers cutting stone and grinding the exterior walls. I was given no notice that this would be happening. This is far from the first time this has happened.
I protested this occurring without warning, and informed the property manger (who is not licensed and knows nothing of landlord tenant law) that this was illegal. She contacted the owner who called me and told me I was a bitch, and threatened to call the police to have me removed.

Which is ridiculous and illegal.

The next day a building inspector shows up randomly, I am blamed for his presence.

Within hours an "eviction notice" was put under my door. As you'll notice it gives me from the date it was put under my door (around 7:00pm on March 28th) to March 29th "am".

After researching, and arguing, and crying I managed to prove to the "property manager" that first of all you can not give someone a few hours to vacate a property and that additionally the "violations" they cited were not in any way valid.
The reasons:
#18 is building modifications, which I made with permission: painting my wall. (not grounds for eviction)
#20 is barring an entrance, which I did not do, I asked for notice before they barred my entrance and modified my building. Which ironically is established as necessary in #20.
#29 is renter's insurance which I have and gladly provided, no one asked but once given this "eviction notice" I had to insist they look at a print out of it.

After all this I was assured by the unlicensed property manager that the owner would "just forget about it".
That was this morning.

I slept at my studio for fear of them destroying my equipment.
I left the studio for 15 min today to get some coffee.
In that time a new eviction notice (still not legal I think) was slid under my door.

This one a 30 day "no cause" eviction notice. 
(Second image)
 
The good news is they are admitting they have no cause to evict me. The funny news is that from my understanding of it a "no cause" can only be filed if the tenant is out of their lease. I am not. More funny news is that they claim to have given it to me in person, which they did not. So poor "Jerry" who signed it, perjured himself.
The bad news is these people are clearly just horrible and hate me for reasons beyond my understanding.
 
This is my best my best account of the past three days, where in my favorite place in the world became a means of harassing and terrorizing me.

If that sounds melodramatic, I understand, but this is my livelihood and I have so much invested in this property.
 

How your contributions will be used:

I am admittedly a starving artist. I know I need legal representation, but I simply lack the funds.
I will use your funds to fight to stop these people doing this to others, and attempt to seek justice. I am not the first and I know not the last (just today a man was told to quit his job to manage the property, after he did this he was told he wasn't needed and he had 2 days to leave his apartment, I have invited him to join me in pursuing legal recourse).

I want to be able to keep making art, keep sharing it and continue to be a part of this community. And I want to stand up for what is right.

I need your help.

If you donate a lot, or cant donate at all:

I appreciate anyone who read this far. If you can not contribute, please share this campaign, its a huge help.

If you can donate I will be offering small photographic prints of my work on a scale for those of you who want to pitch in.

Regardless of which group you fall in to, I appreciate you, So much. And thank you.

I am admittedly a starving artist. I know I need legal representation, but I simply lack the funds. I will use your funds to fight to stop these people doing this to others, and attempt to seek justice. I am not the first and I know not the last (just today a man was told to quit his job to manage the property, after he did this he was told he wasn't needed and he had 2 days to leave his apartment, I have invited him to join me in pursuing legal recourse).I want to be able to keep making art, keep sharing it and continue to be a part of this community. If you donate a lot, or cant donate at all:
I appreciate anyone who read this far. If you can not contribute, please share this campaign, its a huge help.
If you can donate I will be offering small photographic prints of my work on a scale for those of you who want to pitch in. Regardless of which group you fall in to, I appreciate you, So much. And thank you.

story:
THE CHARITY - COPE

While backpacking through Southeast Asia recently, I was fortunate enough to visit COPE, a center in Vientiane, Laos dedicated to helping rebuild the lives, families and communities destroyed by unexploded ordnance (UXOs).  The amount of UXOs in Laos is unimaginable and the majority of UXOs are a result of wars that Laos wasn’t even a part of.  Most disturbing, 50% of victims of UXOs in the post-conflict era are children.

I was very moved by what I saw at COPE and what they are doing for the victims.  You can read about my experience here. 

I want to use my IndieGoGo photography campaign to help raise money to further the efforts of COPE.

So, 20% of all money raised through my campaign will go to COPE.

If the overall goal of $2500 is reached, COPE will receive $500.  I understand that may not sound like a lot of money.  However, $500 can buy 33 weeks of food for a victim…..or six prosthetic legs…..or three prosthetic arms…..or two treatments for club foot.

A single prosthetic or treatment doesn’t just help the recipient.  It helps their family, their village, their community.

Everyone who participates in the campaign will receive all updates regarding the money donated to COPE and the people we help.  Please, let’s do everything can to reach the goal and donate $500…or more…to COPE.

To learn more about COPE, there is a video posted in the gallery section or you can view their website here.

_______________________________________

THE PHOTO GIVEAWAYS 

Participation Giveaway

Everyone who participates in the campaign by selecting a perk is automatically added to a drawing for a GIVEAWAY of a FREE photo.  Winner gets to choose the photo and size, 30x40 photos included!!

Facebook Giveaway

Everyone who likes my facebook photography fan page (link) will be automatically added to a drawing for a GIVEAWAY of a FREE 5x7 photo of the winner's choice.

Twitter Giveaway

Everyone who follows me on twitter (link) will be automatically added to a drawing for a GIVEAWAY of a FREE 5x7 photo of the winner's choice.

International shipping not included in all Photo Giveaways.

_______________________________________

THE CAMPAIGN

RECEIVE A GIFT JUST FOR WATCHING THE VIDEO!!

 

Art can preserve a moment.  Art can redefine an experience.  Art can change perspective.  Art can create an emotion.  Art can bring a smile...hope...peace. 

 

ME

Hi.  I’m Kevin and I am an Austin based travel photographer and writer.  I capture and record moments from my trips around the world, from internationally known landmarks (pyramids of Giza) to simple moments (a boat floating in a pond in Vietnam) to a relaxing milieu (surfers floating on their boards at sunset in Costa Rica). 

In the beginning photography was just a curiosity and writing was a slight interest.  From a curiosity and interest to a passion to a dream.  That is where I am now.  It is one of my dreams to be able to explore the world and document it through my photography and writing.

Angles.  Colors.  Texture.  Light.  Perspective.  Emotion.

 

THE GOAL

I am in the process of completing my photography website, Kevin Armstrong Photography, and travel blog, Stories & Scars. With your help, I know I can do that.

The foundations of both websites have been created.  My goal is to build on what I have started and ultimately generate a strong web presence.  Once that is achieved, I will be able to successfully update the online community about new trips, photos and promotions.  I have a great start on the websites thus far, but have a long way to go.

This is where you come in.  Participating.  Donating.  The Dough.

 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Some people just want to be a part of something creative.  I dig that.  Hopefully, you will find some satisfaction in being a part of something that is inspiring to you and also very important to me.

But, the perks.  Free photo.  Discounts.

Take a look to the right of this page, pick a perk and click the button. In addition to enjoying the perks for yourself, you can share the discount code with your family and friends.  The discount codes for each perk level will be delivered via email upon completion of the campaign and will be valid until September 1st, 2012.  The photo of your choice will be ordered at a time of your choosing prior to September 1st, 2012.

One common question is if you have to register for IndieGoGo to donate or receive a perk.  You do not have to register with IndieGoGo to participate in this campaign.

 

WHAT’S THE DOUGH GONNA BE USED FOR

Based on how much of the budget ($2500) is reached, my hope is to use the money in four areas:

  • Adding photos
  • Updating portions of photography website
  • Completing the blog
  • Marketing

It may seem like it doesn’t take much time to put a photo on the web or update a blog.  However, each photo and blog entry offers a different level of complexity and time.  When working with hundreds of photos and a multitude of blog entries, it can take months.

One of the goals is to add photos from trips to Colombia, Costa Rica, Jordan, California and Texas.

Once the photos are added, portions of the website will be updated.  There is the potential for a new layout as well as the addition of music.

I hope to complete the travel blog while adding photos to the photography website.  The current blog topic is about a 6-week trip through Southeast Asia where I taught my parents how to backpack.  Here is one of my blogs titled MY POLITICAL CAREER IS DEAD.  It's about an uncomfortable massage in Laos with my parents in tow.  There are plenty more stories like it.

Upon completion, marketing will begin.  My hope is to build an email list to maintain direct communication with the online community as well as generate a big following on twitter (@kevinleea) and facebook (www.facebook.com/KevinArmstrongPhotography.)

 

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

An extremely important way to help is to spread the word about my campaign.  I understand not everyone can donate.  That’s cool.  Word of mouth is what makes these campaigns successful.  You may share this with someone who also passes it on, and that could turn into multiple donations.  I just need you to spread the word.

Take a look at the white box below the video.  Everything you need to help send this campaign to every corner of the internet is right there.  Facebook.  Twitter.  Google+.  Embed.  Email.  And a URL to share my campaign.  The extra traffic and exposure you help create could get my campaign featured on IdieGoGo’s main page.  That would be huge!  It is all about getting this in front of as many eyes as possible and giving people the opportunity to be a part of it.

 

THANK YOU

Thanks for listening.  I hope this finds you well wherever you are.  And whatever you are doing, even if it isn’t your dream, I hope it’s at least one step closer to it.

Kevin

A single prosthetic or treatment doesn’t just help the recipient.  It helps their family, their village, their community.

To learn more about COPE, there is a video posted in the gallery section or you can view their website here.
_______________________________________
THE PHOTO GIVEAWAYS 
Participation Giveaway
Everyone who participates in the campaign by selecting a perk is automatically added to a drawing for a GIVEAWAY of a FREE photo.  Winner gets to choose the photo and size, 30x40 photos included!!
Facebook Giveaway
Everyone who likes my facebook photography fan page (link) will be automatically added to a drawing for a GIVEAWAY of a FREE 5x7 photo of the winner's choice.
Twitter Giveaway
Everyone who follows me on twitter (link) will be automatically added to a drawing for a GIVEAWAY of a FREE 5x7 photo of the winner's choice.
International shipping not included in all Photo Giveaways.
_______________________________________
THE CAMPAIGN
RECEIVE A GIFT JUST FOR WATCHING THE VIDEO!!
 
Art can preserve a moment.  Art can redefine an experience.  Art can change perspective.  Art can create an emotion.  Art can bring a smile...hope...peace. 
 
ME
Hi.  I’m Kevin and I am an Austin based travel photographer and writer.  I capture and record moments from my trips around the world, from internationally known landmarks (pyramids of Giza) to simple moments (a boat floating in a pond in Vietnam) to a relaxing milieu (surfers floating on their boards at sunset in Costa Rica). 
In the beginning photography was just a curiosity and writing was a slight interest.  From a curiosity and interest to a passion to a dream.  That is where I am now.  It is one of my dreams to be able to explore the world and document it through my photography and writing.
Angles.  Colors.  Texture.  Light.  Perspective.  Emotion.
 
THE GOAL
I am in the process of completing my photography website, Kevin Armstrong Photography, and travel blog, Stories & Scars. With your help, I know I can do that.
The foundations of both websites have been created.  My goal is to build on what I have started and ultimately generate a strong web presence.  Once that is achieved, I will be able to successfully update the online community about new trips, photos and promotions.  I have a great start on the websites thus far, but have a long way to go.
This is where you come in.  Participating.  Donating.  The Dough.
 
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
Some people just want to be a part of something creative.  I dig that.  Hopefully, you will find some satisfaction in being a part of something that is inspiring to you and also very important to me.
But, the perks.  Free photo.  Discounts.
Take a look to the right of this page, pick a perk and click the button. In addition to enjoying the perks for yourself, you can share the discount code with your family and friends.  The discount codes for each perk level will be delivered via email upon completion of the campaign and will be valid until September 1st, 2012.  The photo of your choice will be ordered at a time of your choosing prior to September 1st, 2012.
One common question is if you have to register for IndieGoGo to donate or receive a perk.  You do not have to register with IndieGoGo to participate in this campaign.
 
WHAT’S THE DOUGH GONNA BE USED FOR
Based on how much of the budget ($2500) is reached, my hope is to use the money in four areas:

Adding photos
Updating portions of photography website
Completing the blog
Marketing
It may seem like it doesn’t take much time to put a photo on the web or update a blog.  However, each photo and blog entry offers a different level of complexity and time.  When working with hundreds of photos and a multitude of blog entries, it can take months.
One of the goals is to add photos from trips to Colombia, Costa Rica, Jordan, California and Texas.
Once the photos are added, portions of the website will be updated.  There is the potential for a new layout as well as the addition of music.
I hope to complete the travel blog while adding photos to the photography website.  The current blog topic is about a 6-week trip through Southeast Asia where I taught my parents how to backpack.  Here is one of my blogs titled MY POLITICAL CAREER IS DEAD.  It's about an uncomfortable massage in Laos with my parents in tow.  There are plenty more stories like it.
Upon completion, marketing will begin.  My hope is to build an email list to maintain direct communication with the online community as well as generate a big following on twitter (@kevinleea) and facebook (www.facebook.com/KevinArmstrongPhotography.)
 
HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP
An extremely important way to help is to spread the word about my campaign.  I understand not everyone can donate.  That’s cool.  Word of mouth is what makes these campaigns successful.  You may share this with someone who also passes it on, and that could turn into multiple donations.  I just need you to spread the word.
Take a look at the white box below the video.  Everything you need to help send this campaign to every corner of the internet is right there.  Facebook.  Twitter.  Google+.  Embed.  Email.  And a URL to share my campaign.  The extra traffic and exposure you help create could get my campaign featured on IdieGoGo’s main page.  That would be huge!  It is all about getting this in front of as many eyes as possible and giving people the opportunity to be a part of it.
 
THANK YOU
Thanks for listening.  I hope this finds you well wherever you are.  And whatever you are doing, even if it isn’t your dream, I hope it’s at least one step closer to it.
Kevin

story:
I am Ekin Küçük , an Istanbul based photographer . 
My relationship with the stray cats began when my beloved dogs passed away .The process of getting to know the animals started with giref . Friendship and healing were my priority , photography came after. As much as they have a hard life in the city ,I try to capture their wit , personalities and their "happy" times . Now after many years ,I want to collect those photos in a book to honor them.​

Thank you 

Ekin Küçük

story:
Short Summary

"The scenery is beautiful - wish you were here" postcards from the past no longer paint an accurate picture of the reality of 99% of Americans. In 2018 we have an existential crisis with homelessness at an all time high and a lack of affordable housing.

Back in 2011 some folks started a movement in New York City called "Occupy Wall Street" against corporate corruption and rising inequality, receiving global attention and spawning a surge against economic inequality. Today in 2018 we feel the need to protest daily and we are reminded of what the original protest of the new Millennium stood for and foretold us would happen if nothing was done. Not enough was done and happening it is.

Photographer Carl Posey was on location in 2011 and his captures of the Occupy Wall Street Protest portray priceless historic documentation. 

It's our duty to defend liberties and human rights and as artists we feel the responsibility to somehow reflect the present status of society in our work. Even if we are not protesting on the street, we cannot ignore reality. Carl's images convey a direct message or a particular feeling without words and they're prefect for the call to keeping the momentum going. We thought postcards were an easy and impactful way for everyone to share them via the good old method of snail mail. We plan to create lots and lots of postcards to be mailed.

 

 

The Photographer

For close to 3 decades Carl Posey has passionately put  spotlights on people to bring out their character. "A mixture of patience and a form of manipulation is what eventually brings out the honest spirit in someone", Carl says. His love for life and people is what makes it possible for him to do it over and over again and what makes the images feel free of any barriers between the subject and the photographer.

View this video for an in-depth insight into the artist's world:

 

 

Throughout his long carrier, Carl Posey's work has been featured in countless magazines, museums, books as well as advertising. He is especially proud of his pro bono work for United Negro College Fund "A Mind Is A Terrible Thing To Waste" and his multi year New York Subway ad campaign for Hot 97 Radio, featuring many of Hip Hop's greatest artists such as LL Cool J, Lil Kim and many others. Please visit his website CarlPosey.com

 

The Impact

I'm thrilled that Carl has agreed to make his intriguing images available to use for this activist project, because needless to say in order for a postcard to be bought and sent out, not to mention be looked at and cherished by the recipient, appeal and is key. Every single image we picked is striking on its own or in a set. In an increasingly digital world, imagine what it will mean to get one of these postcards in the mailbox. We think the impact will be unmeasurable and oh so necessary. Let's spread these images (messages) people. The more money we can raise the more postcards we will print to be mailed, so let's get going! Thank you very much.

 

What We Need

If we raise enough funds to print the postcards and packaging of sets and distribution to you, that's basically all we need to start. The photos are the copyright of the photographer and are being shared by Carl Posey for the good of the cause. He will get a photographers credit on each card. Keep in mind that the more money we raise the more postcards will be printed and mailed.

 

What You Get

Amazing postcards (individual ones or postcards sets) to send around the world depicting real images that convey important messages from the 99%. It's a non-violent way of protest. Why send a next to meaningless greeting when you can send a real message that will have an impact on the recipient and beyond?

We really want everyone to be able to get at least a postcard, so we actually will give some out for free. Simply send us an email with the link to your social media post where you shared our campaign link and once we have reached our funding goal we'll send you a free postcard (don't forget to include your mailing address in that email). 

 

Stretch Goals

Imagine we get beyond our funding goal (yey!). We have plans for where to invest that additional money:

  • Expanding Occupy Wall Street Image Collection
  • Boxed Occupy Wall Street Postcard Sets 
  • Expanding Distribution of Occupy Wall Street Postcards via Book Stores, etc
  • Free Postcards
  • Occupy Wall Street Posters
  • Offering Occupy Wall Street Fine Art Greeting Cards Collection
  • Coffee Table Book Occupy Wall Street Protest
  • Other Protests Postcard Collections
  • 3D Postcards of Occupy Wall Street Protest
  • Occupy Wall Street Protest Photo Calendar

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise of your own. Take to the streets and protest. Talk to people about your ideas for change. Help someone who is homeless. Share your luck. Spare some change. Make someone smile. It's your world, it's your planet and we all together are the people responsible for it.

 

Copyright Notice

All images for the Indiegogo campaign "Occupy Wall Street Postcards Sets" are the copyright 2018 © of Carl Posey. Please do not copy, print or use any of the images or content from this page without linking back to this page.

Free Postcards
Occupy Wall Street Posters

Coffee Table Book Occupy Wall Street Protest

Occupy Wall Street Protest Photo Calendar


 
Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Our goal is to buy a retro photobooth that issues black&white vintage photos. Why vintage booth? Because we believe that black&whites pictures are always actual and out of time.


What’s Photobooth?

Photobooth is a vending machine that is equipped with digital cameras, image processing, onboard. Nowadays Photobooth has become a must-have item for weddings, graduations, parties and any other special occasion where guests and memorable moments come together.

Where it will be located?

We plan to put our first Photobooth in Peniche that is located in Portugal.

Peniche is a perfect spot for surfing. This city is well known as the wave capital. And it’s not surprising: more than 10 km of sandy beaches; more than 260 sunshine days; the lowest costs for accommodation, surf lessons, food and other activities.

Also Peniche is famous for nightlife with a lot of bars where tourist and locals like to spend time. In one of those bars we plan to set a photo machine.

So what?

Photobooth is a mainstream and trendy product. As usual photo machines are concentrated in super malls  cinemas or private events. From our personal experience there is no any Photobooth was found in bars or nightclubs. And it’s very sad. When people go out, they always look beautiful. Per one night can be posted thousands of selfies. However with Photobooth they can have great and stylish printed pictures for less money that can stay with them for long time. Especially it can become bright and memorable moment during traveling that will remind people about their trip to Portugal.

Also we have already checked that there is NO PHOTOBOOTH IN PENICHE. It can become a superior plus to our start up. 

Risks and challenges

We understand that Photo Booth is mainstream and seasonable product because it will be situated in touristic area as Peniche. On the other hand this is a great opportunity for first start up for the following reasons: 
1.Don’t demand too much investments 
2.No competitors 
3.Unique idea 
In future we’d like to put photo booths in different cities of Portugal. 
Our mission is to show how is amazing this country, ocean, surfing and to help people to keep these moments as long as possible.

WHO WE ARE?

We are a couple that actually met each  in Peniche. We love this city and people from their with all our hearts.

Our problem - we are from different countries, but Portugal is the place where we want to be. For being together we need money for our first start up that gives us possibility to stay in country and develop our business.

We hope that Indiegogo will help our dream to come true. We appreciate every donation from you.

story:
A Little Bit About Me & The Project

I'm an artist from Michigan and received my Bachelors of Fine Arts from the Maryland Institute College of Art. In 2010, when I graduated with my degree in photography I was lucky enough to have been awarded the Meyer's Travel Fellowship. The fellowship allowed me to travel to Tibet to photograph the Khampa Nomad's devotion to Gesar, an 11th Century enlightened warrior king, in their modernizing society.

Photographing and living with the Mira clan in their summer pasture was one of the most amazing experiences I've had. I fell in love with the landscape and made lasting friendships. 

The project grew and evolved. While it was still about the Khampa's faith in Gesar, it also became a portrait of a family that had been torn apart by feuds and their transition back to normal family life.

This final trip will allow me to create photographs of the entire family together, as well as formal portraits of the men, women, and children that make up the Mira clan. During my past trips I have recorded stories and interviews relating to Gesar and will incorporate these texts and photographs in a book.

Take a look some of the images that I took in 2010 and in 2011 for this project.

What I Need & What You Get

Below is a detailed list of where the raised funds will go:

  • $3000 for the flights from the USA to Beijing, Beijing to Chengdu, and Chengdu to Kangding (Tagong is a remote town and it will take me 3 days of travel just to get there!)
  • $900 for film, developing costs (To save money I will be developing the film myself)
  • $600 contingency for unexpected bumps along the way
  • $200 for visa and immunizations, medicine, etc.
  • $300 to produce the perks and ship them to you!

If we do not reach my entire goal all funds will go to the flight costs and getting me there.

  • $5 You will be listed as a supporter on the project website and will receive updates from the field.
  • $25 Pack of 5 assorted postcard size images from the series. You will also be listed as a supporter on the project website and will receive updates from the field.
  • $50 Hand made prayer flag from the Mira clan & Khampa Nomad Arts Cooperative. You will also be listed as a supporter on the project website and will receive updates from the field.
  • $75 Hand made prayer flag from the Mira clan & Khampa Nomad Arts Cooperative and a pack of 5 assorted postcard size images from the series.You will also be listed as a supporter on the project website, in the book and will receive updates from the field.
  • $100 Your choice of a signed copy of the completed book or a 11x14 signed print from the series. You will also be listed as a supporter on the project website, in the book and will receive updates from the field.
  • $300 Signed copy of the completed book and signed 16x20 print from the series. You will also be listed as a supporter on the project website, in the book and will receive updates from the field.
  • $500 Hand made prayer flag from the Mira clan & Khampa Nomad Arts Cooperative and a pack of 5 assorted postcard size images from the series. Signed copy of the completed book and signed 16x24 print from the series. You will also be listed as a supporter on the project website and in the book and will receive updates from the field.

The History & The Impact

The Khampas are ethnically Tibetan and live in what is now China's Garze Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture. Despite China's quickly modernizing cities Tagong, the closest town to the Mira clan's home, is in a remote mountainous region of Sichuan. 

Khampas are beginning to use motorcycles as their main source of transportation, although horses remain a huge part of their lives. 

The Khampas are known across China as being a tough warrior people. They look to Gesar not only as a god and source of inspiration but also as a model warrior for men and boys. When the Communist People's Liberation Army came into Khampa regions in the 1940's the Khampa's fought back. Both sides lost many people, but the Chinese still fear the Khampa sword. 

While the Khampas are kind and eager to laugh their warrior history still holds weight. Quick tempers and family disputes often lead to knife fights, jail and death.

I am interested in the conflicting sides of Gesar's story, and his long lasting effect on the Khampas. Many Khampas in Tagong are tired of the deaths of local men who fall in these fights. A conversation is beginning to take place to stop these tragedies. This project is my exploration of that conversation and with your help it will be made available to people outside of Kham.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! A quick email with a link to this page can do wonders!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Print off and share the campaign flyer (under the 'Gallery' tab)!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hello, My name is Jimmy. My campaign is about bettering myself as a photographer and to help others as well. I am looking to upgrade some of my camera things that will make it able to capture better pictures and better moments. After being hurt on the job and completely disregarded by workers comp, i have started to do pictures for people inexpensively just to survive. I is to help me survive and to make sure people that if even on a tight budget they can still get pictures of their special moments. Photography has been a great therapy after losing my job when i was hurt. The pictures can come out so calming and soothing with great colors... and then to get compliments on me actually relieves my stress and anger at the whole situation. I am looking to upgrade so that i can do better pictures as well as expand if possible. 

The funding will be going to a better flash so that i can take more rapid pictures at weddings and parties for people. Another battery so that i can take all of the pictures needed without running out of charge and losing the chance at precious moments because of it. Hoping to be able to set up a website to sell some prints of the "Art" i've set up and photo'd as well as the nature scenes i have been able to capture. Also, I have done a Trial of photoshop and it is absoulutely amazing when editing photos for people. There is a deal for 50 a month that includes all of the creative suite programs i would need so that would be another. Perks givin would be Prints of some nature scenes i have been able to capture. If unable to reach my goal it will still go towards my photography needs to help me better the things i am looking to upgrade.

The contributions made will be helping me to survive better and help me expand to better things and opportunities. This is what has calmed me for these 2 years of being hurt and fighting for justice that has never came. Now still in pain and mobility issues this is what i love to do and keeps my spirits up when im able to actually get out there and do it.

Any help would be appreciated. Please share this campaign if you cannot help or just spread the word some how. I try to help the best i can for others and as so, i would also plan to fund another person after i have been able to get my financial life better adjusted and stable. Thank you for even the thought of wanting to help. There are few people in this world..
story_txt:
Short Summary
 
Hello, My name is Jimmy. My campaign is about bettering myself as a photographer and to help others as well. I am looking to upgrade some of my camera things that will make it able to capture better pictures and better moments. After being hurt on the job and completely disregarded by workers comp, i have started to do pictures for people inexpensively just to survive. I is to help me survive and to make sure people that if even on a tight budget they can still get pictures of their special moments. Photography has been a great therapy after losing my job when i was hurt. The pictures can come out so calming and soothing with great colors... and then to get compliments on me actually relieves my stress and anger at the whole situation. I am looking to upgrade so that i can do better pictures as well as expand if possible. 
The funding will be going to a better flash so that i can take more rapid pictures at weddings and parties for people. Another battery so that i can take all of the pictures needed without running out of charge and losing the chance at precious moments because of it. Hoping to be able to set up a website to sell some prints of the "Art" i've set up and photo'd as well as the nature scenes i have been able to capture. Also, I have done a Trial of photoshop and it is absoulutely amazing when editing photos for people. There is a deal for 50 a month that includes all of the creative suite programs i would need so that would be another. Perks givin would be Prints of some nature scenes i have been able to capture. If unable to reach my goal it will still go towards my photography needs to help me better the things i am looking to upgrade.
The contributions made will be helping me to survive better and help me expand to better things and opportunities. This is what has calmed me for these 2 years of being hurt and fighting for justice that has never came. Now still in pain and mobility issues this is what i love to do and keeps my spirits up when im able to actually get out there and do it.


Any help would be appreciated. Please share this campaign if you cannot help or just spread the word some how. I try to help the best i can for others and as so, i would also plan to fund another person after i have been able to get my financial life better adjusted and stable. Thank you for even the thought of wanting to help. There are few people in this world..

story:
Short Summary

A Vintage Love Affair

Hello, I'm Harlow the owner of Harlow House Photography based in Chicago Illinois also  known as Harlow Pinup. A series of unfortunate events has lead me into extreme financial hardship.

After graduating from college and working a number of corporate jobs in sales and marketing I finnally built up the courage and finances to leave my 9-5 job and follow my dreams. I put my life savings into upgraded camera equipment, studio lighting, and set designs then moved into a studio just outside Chicago. Since August 2010 I've also made the dreams of deserving women come true. I have traveled to 25 states in 3 years offering our Bombshell Makeovers and Photoshoots. The letters of gratitude I have received are heartwarming and inspiring. I grew up with a number of image issues and an eating disorder which made me care deeply about the other view themselves. I wanted to dedicate my business to making women see just how beautiful they can be and help build their confidence. I see all women as beautiful and inspiring.  I have overcome a number of health issues including depression and anxiety by having this wonderful business.  This businesss gave me the opportunity to work with so many like minded and wonderful people who support me and my passion. It has also allowed me to give many upcoming makeup artists and hairstylists consistant and good paying work.

What We Need & What You Get

To keep Harlow Pinup going and avoid losing my Home/studio

  • rent for 2 months to catch up on our maxed out credit cards 1800
  • My camera lens need to be replaced canon 24 -70               900.00
  • The canon 430 speedlight that was stolen        300.00
  • Our Travel lights /softbox were broken by American Airlines 500.00
  • Advertising expenses  3 months 600.00
  • PERKS in return I will give  beautiful autographed 8x10s and Autographed copies of my book for large donations of 100.00 or more. 

The Impact

This business is my heart and soul. to lose it would be devastating. I have spent countless hours fighting to kleep it alive. I invested my entire life savings in this venture. I am always working, promoting, and talking to people about Harlow House. I have alot of people who are depending on me because I am their role model and when I succeed they succeed. I help many young women find new opportunites by working  for me as a promotional models, makeup artists, hairstylists. I have helped launch modeling careers and other small business.

  • In the future Harlow House will be launching a promotional agency which will offer young women great job opporunities while building their sales and marketing skills.
  • We have 5 independant hair and makeup contractors that rely on my success for stable inclome.

In less than 2 years I was able to publish a coffee table book through ME publishing now available on Amazon.com

I have gone on 2 self funded cross country tours to get my name out and now have loyal Harlow fans in every major city in every state.

I have been featured on the covers of many magazines and webitorials.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate, please share our fan page on facebook or share our website

Website

http://www.harlowpinup.com

Facebook Fan Page

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Harlow-Pinup/112188535507761?ref=hl

XOXO Miss Harlow

story:
Summary

Hello Indiegoers!  Welcome!  My name is Mike Vickers and I'm a photographer.   All my life I've been in to art of some kind.  I started out with music performance then went to recording, then to video focusing mainly on editing.  I got a job at a store building and repairing computers designed specifically for video production.   One day the owner showed me the video coming out of a Canon D-SLR.   I was instantly taken by surprise at how good it looked compared to the dedicated video camera I had!   I ended up selling all of my video gear to buy that camera.  Before even receiving the new camera I decided I should sign up for photography classes in order to better use it for what it was originally designed for.  Photography!  As I got more in to photography ( and less in to video ) I ended up selling all of my music gear too to help fund my new photography addiction.

After over 4 years of shooting, my camera took a dive last month leaving me with a couple lenses & strobes but no working camera body.  The majority of photography I shoot is costume or cosplay design sets which doesn't exactly pay much if anything at all.  I attend conventions whenever I can and have traveled all over the southeast just to shoot at them.  I rented a camera for AWA ( Anime Weekend in Atlanta ) but I can't always rent one whenever I want to.  Until I get a new camera there's not much I can do.  With your contribution though I can get back up and going and shooting the costumes you love!  This isn't just for the camera though.   This isn't just to travel.  This is to help me continue doing what I love!   Capturing art! 

What I Need & What You Get

Canon estimated the repairs on my camera to cost $1,011.25 plus another $103 for the battery pack.   Everyone I spoke with said it wasn't worth it to repair a 5 year old camera being that it was out on the market for a year before I purchased it.   After debating between several different models I decided to stick with the direct replacement of my Canon 5D mk2 and purchase a 5D mk3.   Retail price on this camera is $3,500.   True there are many cameras costing much less but it goes back to "you get what you pay for."  You wouldn't give a painter a box of crayons to create his next masterpiece or a sheet of sketch paper instead of a canvas would you?

Every single penny received will go towards the purchase of this new camera.  You're not just donating to me though because I will be giving something back!  For the first time ever and with the permission and support of several models I will be providing prints to all the contributors who donate $15 or more towards my camera fund.  Even if funding is not reached, I will still be purchasing this new camera!  The question is more a matter of when instead of if. 

The Impact

With your help, I will quickly get a new camera and be out there shooting again!   I have been studying photography for over 4 years now and have been attending conventions for nearly 2 years.  Just this year I have been to AL, GA, TN, KY, NC & MD for various shoots and conventions!   If you like my photography, contributing to my cause will help me continue to travel and shoot with all of you amazing people!  With your contribution of $15 or more you'll also receive your favorite print and for an additional $5 I will get that model to autograph it for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, or even if you can, please feel free to spread the word and share this page!  If you want to contribute in any other way, or if you have any suggestions on how to make this campaign more successful, feel free to comment below.   Thank you!

Photos

If there are any particular prints you'd like to see, comment below and I'll speak with the model and see if I can make it available!  If we've shot together and you'd like to purchase a print of yourself, message me and I'll have it printed!  If you'd like to purchase a print in any other size or format such as canvas, let me know!  Photos are originally a 2:3 ratio but have been cropped to show how they will look on an 11x14 print.

*Additional fees for any and all international shipping.

story:
I would like to first start off by telling you that I am attempting to live a brave life, not a safe one--which may be why the 1000 Shillings Photography Fellowship Program is offering me an exciting opportunity to live and work alongside women artisan entrepreneurs living in the Namatala slum (located in Mbale, Uganda) for 6 weeks. I am prepared to walk among the poor and broken people of this world—to forgo a few comforts, for the aim of making the world a bit more like it’s meant to be.

1000 Shillings works with impoverished women artisans around the world, giving their products an international market, a platform for women to tell their stories and seed capital for women to start their own businesses. I will be serving as the microphone to this cause, providing these women with various platforms to connect and share their stories with their consumers across global communities.

Over the past few years, I have been striving to find ways to marry my identities of humanitarian and reporter. For those of you who know me well, you know this experience is just the blessing I've been searching for. 

The funds raised through this campaign will cover my travel and living expenses in Uganda, as well as a portion of which will directly support the women artists with whom we work. Anything left over will be directly donated to the organization. 

Breakdown of cost: 

  • I am expected to pay for my: program fee, airfare, visa and traveler's insurance. 
  • Program fee (which includes: housing, breakfast and dinner, clean drinking water, internet, training, airport pickup and a donation to the women artisans) costs $2,800. 
  • Airfare estimated at around $1,500-$2,000.
  • Traveler's insurance costs roughly $150
  • Visa costs $50

If you would rather not donate straight to me, you can also visit the 1000 Shillings website and directly buy the hand-made goods that each woman makes. Upon checkout, simply state "Brittany" in the "Order Notes" section. Not only will you be providing an income for the woman who made the product, but you will also be granting me a discount that is taken from my program fee for each item that is purchased from my referral.

To learn more about 1000 Shillings and its mission, as well as how you can support this cause, please visit www.1000shillings.com. 

Thanks!

story:
KINGS AND QUEENS : THIRD SHIFT

Third Shift is a digital artist and photographer based out of Iowa City, IA. He is passionate about telling stories that change the perceptions and stereotypes of marginalized societies. Kings and Queens is a humanizing look into the world of Drag culture. Although dressing drag is becoming more widely accepted, this series takes an interesting look at the men and women dressing and less about their drag personas. Proceeds will go to high quality gallery prints and frames to be shown in April 2017.   

COSTS BROKEN DOWN

I am choosing to print through Artifact Uprising based out of LA. 

There are 20 pieces in the Kings and Queens gallery.

Each framed print will cost about $140 - $150

Total Cost: $3000

WHY DONATE?

LGBTQ Rights are a very hot topic as of late. The inequality the LGBTQ community faces on a daily basis is unacceptable and I think it stems from people uneducated on the topic. What Kings and Queens aims to do is bridge that gap. It humanizes the drag community to those who it isn't readily available to.  

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you know of any gallery spaces looking to show works like this please reach out to me.
