story:
*Vorweg: Bitte achtet darauf, eins der PERKS zu bestellen, anstatt einen Geldbetrag einzugeben. Sonst fehlt nämlich Eure Adresse und ich weiß nicht, wohin mit dem Buch!


Worum geht‘s?
TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER ist wieder da!!! 

Für alle, die den zweiten Teil der TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER-Trilogie gerne in den Händen halten wollen und wissen möchten, wie die Story, das Tagebuch weiter geht – bestellt hier Euer Exemplar, denn das Buch kann es nur auf diese Weise geben!

Damit die Trilogie hübsch und perfekt zueinander passend im Regal steht, bleiben die Buchmaße und Seitenzahl exakt gleich: 240 bunte Seiten auf wunderschönem Offset-Papier und Softcover ohne Finish. Format: DIN A4. Die Story wird ebenfalls wieder mit der Schreibmaschine verfasst.

Warum soll ich jetzt schon bestellen und nicht einfach bis zum Release warten?
- Nur für Vorbesteller über Indiegogo ist das Buch ab 29.- zu haben – ab dem Release im November wird es für alle Zeiten wieder  39.- kosten.

- Wenn nicht zumindest die Druckkosten hier per Vorbestellungen reinkommen, kommt das Buch leider erst gar nicht zustande.

- Die wunderbaren Pakete (Perks) mit Original-Dia der Reise, Erwähnung im Buch, persönliche Postkarte aus den USA, Prints, ein auf Super 8 gedrehtes Making Of, einer von mir belichteten, aber unentwickelten Einwegkamera des Trips(!) uvm. wird es später nicht mehr geben.

Ich werde auch diesmal wieder am laufenden Band in Videos und Posts über die Entwicklungen berichten, Bilder und einen Haufen Liebe teilen. Wir sorgen für geballte Vorfreude, bis das zweite Ding da ist! Man kauft also kein Buch – man bucht eine Reise. Auch hier immer tägliche News:
TALES-Facebookgruppe

Höchstwahrscheinlich wird das Design- & Postproduktion-Team, wie auch im ersten Teil, wieder aus dem wunderbaren Bureau Malte Metag und der phänomenalen Benjamin Pezo Postproduction bestehen. 

Und nun noch ein bisschen Hintergrund:

Ich heiße Ben Bernschneider, bin Fotograf aus Hamburg (www.benbernschneider.com) und habe 2015 ein Bild/Wort-Werk namens TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER veröffentlicht. Wer sich zum ersten Teil im Netz einlesen will, bitte sehr:

http://www.playboy.de/girls/fotograf-ben-bernsc...

http://hiphiphooray.de/blick-ins-buch-tales-of-an-american-summer/

http://www.interview.de/kunst/fotografie/bildband-tales-of-an-american-summer/

http://zeitjung.de/tales-of-an-american-summer-ben-bernschneider-fotografie/

http://www.zuhloo.de/ben-bernschneider-tales-of-an-american-summer-verlosung/

http://coultique.com/photographie/diamondtimes-ii-im-gespraech-mit-fotograf-ben-bernschneider

http://hiphiphooray.de/who-the-fk-is-ben-bernschneider/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dT98LFsyf4


Wann kann ich mein Exemplar in den Händen halten:

Der Produktions- und Schreibzeitraum wäre erneut von März bis September, Editing und Postproduction im Oktober, Druck im November und noch vor Dezember liegen wir uns alle betrunken mit dem Buch in den Armen.

Ich finde das ganze hier cool, habe aber kein Bock auf ein Buch.

Kein Thema – wir wäre es, wenn du einem Bruder aushilfst und diese crowdfunding Kampagne teilst?! Bei Facebook oder whatever. Wäre super. Und ich würde dich dafür lieb haben. Und du kannst ganz toll die Tools nutzen, die IndieGoGo dafür bereit gestellt hat. DANKE für JEDE Hilfe! <3

Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.

Liebe – Euer Ben







Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.

Der Produktions- und Schreibzeitraum wäre erneut von März bis September, Editing und Postproduction im Oktober, Druck im November und noch vor Dezember liegen wir uns alle betrunken mit dem Buch in den Armen.
Ich finde das ganze hier cool, habe aber kein Bock auf ein Buch.Kein Thema – wir wäre es, wenn du einem Bruder aushilfst und diese crowdfunding Kampagne teilst?! Bei Facebook oder whatever. Wäre super. Und ich würde dich dafür lieb haben. Und du kannst ganz toll die Tools nutzen, die IndieGoGo dafür bereit gestellt hat. DANKE für JEDE Hilfe! <3Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.Liebe – Euer Ben





















Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.

story:
Short Summary

ça va, Bonjour, Hello... 

Here is a little about me, I am a total nut when it comes to photography and art! I am creative by nature and like to think that "I create right brain solutions for a left brain world" even though my pedigree is in the mechanical engineering field I like to interject my creative side in everything I do.  My main interests drive me towords drawing, photography and playing my guitar, and each one has a common point amongst themselves and that is each one allows me to tell a story without words through each unique media and that is what I am trying to convey with my photo prints and photobook here on indiegogo. I am taking my hobby of photography, and love of Paris cemeteries and melded them together to create a unique view of Pere Lachaise cemetery through my "voice" of print.  My campaign ultimately is to bring you the viewer of the photo print or book a different and new perspective of the famous Parisian cemetery, whether you have never been to this Parisian treasure, or you have visited several times these images will either bring back memories or bring a new curiosity to this amazing location and potentially become a future destination.  The ultimate goal of my campaign would be to help fund another future projects, one; which would be "Paris is to die for... dead of winter" same concept as this book but shooting the cemetery in the "dead" of winter as well as other future projects covering the other remaining 2 famous cemeteries (Montparnasse, and Monte Martre)

Sincerely,


Esteban Cortina



What We Need & What You Get

What is our goal for this campaign? well we are looking for $22,000 to help start book publishing of my initial coffee table book called "Paris is to die for..." and to help with our future project website which will sell a softcover version of this book as well as other prints exclusive to the website (prints will be limited edition and will not be offered again after 4 months from print release). The unique offer of this campaign is that we will only be offering a limited edition of 175 13x11 HARD COVER coffee table books and 5 limited edition matte prints (each separate individual purchases).  If we do not meet our goal, no worries; if you purchased a book and/or prints from this campaign we will honor your generosity and ship out your campaign perk(s)

The Impact

In a saturated world of Parisian picture books that document that same thing over and over again, "paris is to die for..." is a refreshing addition to to the world of Parisian picture books and would be a welcome addition to your home or office and might just be a conversation starter.  You don't have to be into the weird and creepy to fully enjoy the true beauty of this 110 acre wonder which is often overlooked and passed on by for the common tourist traps

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel that this campaign might not be your cup of tea, we ask that you spread the word to those you know who might be interested in our artistic and creative prints and book documenting Pere Lachaise cemetery.

OR go ahead and use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

story:
With the potential profit we make from our goods, we have the opportunity to experience several immersive programs highlighting and strengthening a wide array of skills and educational points. Academic disciplines including astronomy and humanities are illuminated in our trips to the Planetarium and Jewish History Museum, and others. Furthermore, the opportunities we are given touch on ideas beyond merely the realm of academics, but also personal and community growth.

One of the most significant activities that focuses on this is a highly engaging drama week, in which we receive the expertise of a professional involved in the performing arts. During the drama week, students are able to form strong connections with each other, and more importantly, themselves. They become familiar with the critical concepts of self-confidence, creativity, as well as widespread diversity. Finally, towards the closing of the year, we embark on our biggest trip: a three-day sleep away camp taking place at the University of Arizona Sky School. At Sky School, students are enveloped in a thought stimulating education program centered around science exploration.  Implementing the sky island atmosphere as the main tool of learning, the facility provides a rich understanding of our planet as a whole by intertwining subjects in science and engineering, such as geology, ecology, and astronomy.

 

To create our metal pieces, we worked in a shop that recycles old, dysfunctional bike parts for artistic purposes.  The group designed several different and unique sculptures out of the reused parts-considering productivity and quality-and had them welded thereafter.  Each piece is an original; ranging in size, purpose, and style. Some are designed to be wall embellishments, while others are capable of being decor. For our photography work, we walked through the University of Arizona campus, taking high resolution images that reflect the incredible attributes of urban and desert settings.  We are selling products such as calendars, pillows, mugs, and mouse pads that display these photos and enable you to choose which photo you would like on what. It is our hope you enjoy our exclusive, handcrafted pieces and we appreciate you helping us to reach our goal of $2000.

-Snap and Weld Group

story:
• I have been working in the photography Industry in various capacities for the last 10 years. This MA has given me the time and space to work on a long term personal project whilst developing my sense of place within photography. I have gained valuable experience and contacts that have all played their part in bringing this project to life, and It would be amazing to be able to show this project in my first solo show and in a published book.

What I need and what you get:

  • To bring this project and book to life, I am looking for £2500. This will be split between the two main areas. The design time has already been incredibly generously donated by Dan at Honest Studio in Bath, and he shall be taking care of the design layout, print production and project management of both he book design, and a new website to launch with this project which I am funding. Half of the money raised  by this Indiegogo campaign will be spent on getting the books printed. I plan to get an edition fo 100 signed and numbered books printed to be available at the exhibition private view and any remaining books to be sold on my website. The remainder will be spent on framing, photograph printing costs and materials for hanging the show, and the private view. The labour involved with the framing is also being generously given free of charge by Malcom at Portico Art Gallery. Any money left over will be spent on a second edition of the book and further exhibitions of this project later in the year which are already in the planning stages.
  •  This will be my first solo photography show, and I am excited about the prospect of showing my work in the public, referencing one of my initial project goals of 'making the private archive public'. 
  • If you feel you would be able to contribute then please take a look at the list of perks which vary from a BIG thank you up to a signed and framed limited edition print from the project. 

Risks and Challenges:

  • If you are unable to make a donation, I would really appreciate it if you could share my campaign and get it infant of as many people as possible so that I am able to hang this show and produce the project in a book form.

There are various Indiegogo tools for sharing on your social accounts.

Thank you so much for your time in reading about my project and this campaign and I hope you will be able to make it to see the show. 

www.anthonyprothero.co.uk

story:
Who I Am

My name is Sean Patrick Hill, and I am entering the second part of my life. Through photography, I honestly feel I've been reborn. I've found a calling in life, loud and clear. When I picked up my father's film camera, after it sat in the closet for many years, it was a way to honor him, I felt. Now the camera has grown to fill my life.

I'm a writer, poet, photographer, and single dad living in Louisville, Kentucky. I juggle a career as a content writer, caring for my daughter, and, whenever I can, dragging my cameras into the field and coming home to work in the darkroom. On the side, for extra money (and maybe a bit of extra glory), I write and publish articles locally and nationally.

Where did all this start? A childhood of looking at photographs in books, encyclopedias, and magazines. My grandparents' houses, adorned with years of portraits.  When I was about 12 years old, my father bought a Pentax K1000 35mm camera. He gave me the old 1970's Kodak Instamatic camera he'd been using. I loved it. Over the years, I shot on all sorts of cameras—mostly snapshots, but every so often something I thought might be "art."

In 2003, when I was living in Bend, Oregon, my father mailed me the K1000. For years I shot film, color, black and white. In time, I bought a small Sony digital camera; maybe I thought film wasn't worth the cost. Then, in 2013, I got my first iPhone, not least of all for the camera.

But in the fall of 2017, three years after my father died of cancer, I took the Pentax from the closet. And once I started shooting, I never stopped. I quickly moved up to medium format and, finally, to large-format photography, which I've been shooting now for one year. I built a darkroom. I develop my own film, and I make silver gelatin prints--all in the traditional way.

What really interests me, among many other things, is landscape photography. In June, I took my 4x5 Sinar-F to Utah. I shot 50 sheets of film in Arches and Capitol Reef National Parks. By now, I've felt my passion; large-format photography is, for me, a vocation.

So why Death Valley? Because like my trip to Utah, my heroes have shot there: Ansel Adams, Edward Weston. And the instructor for this workshop, Lynn Radeka. Death Valley is MADE for black and white photography.

This is my chance to work with a master, to fully learn the fundamentals of not so much how to work the camera (though I know there are tricks I haven't yet thought of) but rather how to compose a powerful shot. This gives me an opportunity to create a body of work that I hope to show in a gallery and, ultimately, to sell as prints.

Your help will cover the enormous expenses of traveling to Death Valley, and of lodging and feeding myself. You'll also help me pay for the film (large-format is expensive; a single photograph costs $2 an exposure!) and get my gear ready—calibrating my light meter and shutters, getting replacement parts for the camera, and so on.

Most of all, your help will launch me into my life.

What I Need & What You Get

I am setting the goal at $3,500.

What that covers is workshop tuition ($1,200), lodging ($900), a flight (+/- $600), and car rental (+/- $300). The remaining $500 will cover food, film, printing paper, and CLA's for my equipment (in short, calibrating them, fixing them up, etc).

What I am offering you for your help are images. The images will range from a digital file you can use as a wallpaper to an archival-quality, mounted silver gelatin print that will last a lifetime.

Any funds help. Between the tuition and travel and accommodations, your donations will ease the cost

The Impact

The most simple thing that will come of this workshop is ART. That is to say, fine arts photographs—for you, certainly, and for anyone else.

But for me, professionally, the images I collect can be used for much more.

I can use images to apply for professional and creative grants. As a poet, I've secured grants from the Kentucky Arts Council, the Elizabeth George Foundation, and more.

I can use the images to apply for fellowships, such as Light Work, an organization in Syracuse, New York, where I could spend up to a month photographing my home state. I've received fellowships from the Vermont Studio Center, the Montana Arts Refuge, and Fishtrap.

I can publish them in photography magazines and art journals (and some of my images have, in fact, been published). 

Currently, I am working on my negatives from Capitol Reef National Park. I will use those images to apply to be an artist-in-residence at Capitol Reef. With Death Valley being a national park, I can use those images to apply at other parks, as well.

As a writer, I've created a pretty good reputation and a decent track record: books, publications, and awards. My dream is to couple my writing with my photography; who knows where that will lead?

Risks & Challenges

What are the risks? Few. I suppose I can try to not die in the desert, but in December I think I'll be OK. I may damage my camera (done that before). I may run out of film. But in general, the challenge will be entirely artistic. So long as I don't mess up my exposures, or accidentally expose my film (done that, done that), I will create great negatives.

Granted, I may have to drive to Nevada, in which case gas money will go a long way!

Other Ways You Can Help

By all means, please, tell your friends. Know someone who loves photography? Black and white? Tell them there's a guy that needs a bit of kindness.

Share this post. The more people know, the greater the chances for backers.

story:
What is the Timelapse Master Class 2021 - America in Motion?

 

The Timelapse Master Class 2021 - America in Motion (TMC21) is the most complete and advanced timelapse and hyperlapse online master class ever made!

The TMC21 is the only Master Class that incorporates travelling around America while teaching timelapse, motion timelapse, astro-timelapse and hyperlapse photography.

The Timelapse Master Class 2021 is a one-of-a-kind course. It combines travelling, teaching and storytelling. For years, timelapse photography has been a way for me to share my story, to share my way of seeing the world around us. Beauty is everywhere, you just need to see it! I use timelapse photography to share that message around the world and this is what this Timelapse Master Class 2021 is all about! 

This Master Class will teach you everything you need to know about the craft, and everything behind it. I will share with you my expert secrets to have a 100% success rate when going on location, you will never waste your time again! But you will also learn how to shoot amazing and flawless motion control timelapses, how to capture the smoothest hyperlapse videos or how to shoot breathtaking astro-timelapses, drone-hyperlapses and more. This Master Class will also come with projects, tons of bonus videos and free assets to practice at the same time!

Click here to see the full list of videos included in the Timelapse Master Class 2021.

Keep scrolling for more detailed information about the TMC21!

 

Where will the fundraising money go?

As you might know, creating such a big online master class requires a lot of work. So far, the TMC21 has 42 videos, 11 officially done and exported, 6 at the editing stage and 5 already written ready to be recorded. The TMC21 is already 3+ hour long and will be around 10-15 hours long once completed.

 

The TMC21 takes place all around the United States, from Chicago, to Miami to Los Angeles or New York, and even in some amazing and beautiful National Parks of the American Southwest such as Yosemite and Joshua Tree!  There is nothing better than being on location to share my knowledge and my passion.

 

The money will be smartly split into 4 different categories:

1 - Camera operator: I will hire a camera operator so I, Emeric, can focus on teaching and sharing my knowledge to provide a more personalized course. Hiring a cameraman will help me create visually nicer videos! 

2 - Travel fees: Since the TMC21 takes place all over the US,  the travel cost will add up and your donations will help me travel to different location to shoot different classes for you! So far, I have travelled to Miami, Chicago, Los Angeles, Yosemite and San Francisco for the TMC21. There are many more locations left such as New York City, Las Vegas and Joshua Tree for the remaining videos. I will also travel to other cities and national parks in the future and add new videos to the master class for FREE!

3 - A new website: For the past 3 months, I have been working on a brand new website to watch all my online classes on a secure server. You will be able to keep track of your progress, ask questions about each lesson, watch the classes you purchased one after the other with a good video player and much more.

4 - Efficiency: This project is so big that it's really tough for me to focus on it every single day! I also need to think about other projects that will help pay the bills a little faster. Having a bigger budget for the TMC21 will help me write, shoot and edit the videos way faster than normal.

 

Those are the first 8 destinations included in the TMC21! I will add free lessons as I travel to new locations like Denver, San Diego, Seattle and other National Parks.


What is the difference between the TMC21 and Emeric's Timelapse previous classes?

The main difference with any other timelapse classes I have released so far is the "on location" teaching around the United States, along with the advanced timelapse and hyperlapse techniques I have never taught before.

A huge section of this TMC21 is showing you how I approach different cityscapes in the US.  This is my favorite part of the Master Class as I will be sharing my knowledge on location while capturing America's most beautiful cities!

For the first time as well, I will be teaching motion control timelapses with 1, 2 and 3 axis setups. I will give you TONS of tips and tricks to create better motion control timelapses, even day-to-night.

I will teach you how to capture amazing and beautiful hyperlapses and drone-hyperlapses.

Finally, I will have 8 videos about how to capture nature and astro-timelapses in some of the most beautiful National Parks of the American Southwest.

The TMC21 will be a great addition to the TMC19 which has taught you how to create and sell you work online. TMC19 and TMC21 will create the ultimate timelapse master class combo!

 

Here is a short sneak peek of some of the TMC21 lessons I have already shot and edited.

 

 

 

Your donation will also get you some perks!

Anyone who donates to making TMC21 a reality will receive one of the perks below based on the amount of your donation. Make sure to select one of the perks at the top of the page before purchasing!

 

$5-$9:

A huge thank you and your name in the credits of the last video

 

$10-$19:

A discount code totaling the amount you donated + an extra $5 off the TMC21 (Example: Donate $10, receive a $15 discount code)

+ a huge thank you and your name in the credits of the last video

 

$20-$49:

A discount code of the amount you donated + an extra $10 off the TMC21 (Example: Donate $30, receive a $40 discount code)

+ a huge thank you and your name in the credits of the last video

 

$50-$99:

A discount code totaling the amount you donated + an extra $15 off the TMC21 (Example: Donate $90, receive a $105 discount code)

+ a huge thank you and your name in the credits of the last video

 

$100-$169:

A discount code totaling the amount you donated

+ your name in the credits of 3 videos as "This video was made possible with the help of..."

+ a huge thank you and your name in the credits of the last video

 

$170+

The TMC21 for free: instead of $197! By donating $170 and over to this campaign you will get the TMC21 for free!

+ your name in the credits of 3 videos as "This video was made possible with the help of..."

+ a personalized video thanking you via email or Instagram.

+ your Instagram @ or Youtube Channel in a document called "Top Donations" in the TMC21 folder for everyone to see

+ a huge thank you and your name in the credits of the last video

 

$300 and over

The TMC21 for free: instead of $197!

+ The Emeric's Timelapse Complete Pack 2020 for free: instead of $197

+ One 1h online (virtual) workshop via Zoom

+ a personalized video thanking you via email or Instagram.

+ your Instagram @ or Youtube Channel in a document called "Top Donations" 

Give $300 and over and receive all my classes ever created!

 

 

More info about the Timelapse Master Class 2021 

 

I started writing and shooting this class in February 2020, which is now over a year ago! Then the COVID-19 pandemic happened and I got locked down in my apartment for over 4 months. The entire production took a hit and was delayed.

Now, in March 2021, the TMC21 is over 30% done with 11 videos officially exported, and 5 more already in the editing software. 

For the first time ever, the TMC21 will come with over 7 different projects (homework) and a 20 multiple answers question quiz to pass the class. You will also receive a free 30 minute video call with me Emeric to discuss your projects. The different projects and quiz are needed if you want to officially pass the class!

 

Some cool numbers!

  • 40+ videos (For the original launch, many more with the free unlimited upgrades)
  • 12 videos done (as of March 2021)
  • 3+ hours of lessons already exported
  • 8456 (13608 kms) miles already traveled
  • 1 year in the making
  • Too many cups of coffees
  • Countless late nights editing

 

TIMELINE:

April 2021: Finish Part 4: How to: Motion- Control timelapses, A Complete Guide

April-May 2021: Finish Part 3: The American Southwest, Nature and Deserts (Milky Way Season)

May 2021: Finish Part 5: Hyperlapse Photography and Bonus Videos

June 15th 2021 (maximum): Timelapse Master Class 2021 official release date

 

The TMC21 is also my first class that will come with FREE UPGRADES. As I travel to new locations, I will shoot more videos and add them for free!

Since I was 15, I dreamed of visiting America biggest cities, and this is what I have been able to do with timelapse photography. My passion changed my life!

This Master Class is the result of over 10 years of experience shooting, editing, sharing and teaching timelapse videos.

This is the most advanced and complete timelapse, motion timelapse and hyperlapse master class out there!

 

Who is Emeric's Timelapse?

 

 

Hi there, I am Emeric. I am a 29-year-old French filmmaker and timelapse photographer based in Los Angeles, CA. I have been shooting timelapse videos for almost 10 years now and I love it! I travel all around the United States to shoot cityscape timelapse and hyperlapse videos. I have captured some of the biggest American cities like Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, Chicago, Miami, Las Vegas and a lot more.

I have worked with companies like Netflix, Facebook, Adobe, LG, Google, OPPO to name a few. I am a brand ambassador for the gear company Syrp and music licensing website Epidemic Sound.

I went viral with my SpaceX Falcon 9 timelapse  a couple of years ago!

For more information about my work and myself, visit my website!

 

Since 2017, I have been teaching the craft with online classes in both English and French. I recently reached over 1100 students from over 50 different countries in the world! You can see some of the classes I have already released on my website here.

 

Here is my 2021 Showreel with my best work from the past 6 years:

 

 

And some of my favorite timelapse videos:

 

     
     


    So learn from Emeric's Timelapse and help the TMC21 come to life by donating! Anything helps, and whatever amount you donate, you will receive a discount code + a little extra to purchase it when released.

    The main goal is $5000, but the minimum goal is $1000. If I do not reach the minimum goal I will be reimbursing every one at 100%.

    I will share monthly updates here!

    Thank you!

    - Emeric
story_txt:
What is the Timelapse Master Class 2021 - America in Motion? The Timelapse Master Class 2021 - America in Motion (TMC21) is the most complete and advanced timelapse and hyperlapse online master class ever made!The TMC21 is the only Master Class that incorporates travelling around America while teaching timelapse, motion timelapse, astro-timelapse and hyperlapse photography.The Timelapse Master Class 2021 is a one-of-a-kind course. It combines travelling, teaching and storytelling. For years, timelapse photography has been a way for me to share my story, to share my way of seeing the world around us. Beauty is everywhere, you just need to see it! I use timelapse photography to share that message around the world and this is what this Timelapse Master Class 2021 is all about! This Master Class will teach you everything you need to know about the craft, and everything behind it. I will share with you my expert secrets to have a 100% success rate when going on location, you will never waste your time again! But you will also learn how to shoot amazing and flawless motion control timelapses, how to capture the smoothest hyperlapse videos or how to shoot breathtaking astro-timelapses, drone-hyperlapses and more. This Master Class will also come with projects, tons of bonus videos and free assets to practice at the same time!Click here to see the full list of videos included in the Timelapse Master Class 2021.Keep scrolling for more detailed information about the TMC21!
 
Where will the fundraising money go?
As you might know, creating such a big online master class requires a lot of work. So far, the TMC21 has 42 videos, 11 officially done and exported, 6 at the editing stage and 5 already written ready to be recorded. The TMC21 is already 3+ hour long and will be around 10-15 hours long once completed. The TMC21 takes place all around the United States, from Chicago, to Miami to Los Angeles or New York, and even in some amazing and beautiful National Parks of the American Southwest such as Yosemite and Joshua Tree!  There is nothing better than being on location to share my knowledge and my passion. The money will be smartly split into 4 different categories:1 - Camera operator: I will hire a camera operator so I, Emeric, can focus on teaching and sharing my knowledge to provide a more personalized course. Hiring a cameraman will help me create visually nicer videos! 2 - Travel fees: Since the TMC21 takes place all over the US,  the travel cost will add up and your donations will help me travel to different location to shoot different classes for you! So far, I have travelled to Miami, Chicago, Los Angeles, Yosemite and San Francisco for the TMC21. There are many more locations left such as New York City, Las Vegas and Joshua Tree for the remaining videos. I will also travel to other cities and national parks in the future and add new videos to the master class for FREE!3 - A new website: For the past 3 months, I have been working on a brand new website to watch all my online classes on a secure server. You will be able to keep track of your progress, ask questions about each lesson, watch the classes you purchased one after the other with a good video player and much more.4 - Efficiency: This project is so big that it's really tough for me to focus on it every single day! I also need to think about other projects that will help pay the bills a little faster. Having a bigger budget for the TMC21 will help me write, shoot and edit the videos way faster than normal. Those are the first 8 destinations included in the TMC21! I will add free lessons as I travel to new locations like Denver, San Diego, Seattle and other National Parks.
What is the difference between the TMC21 and Emeric's Timelapse previous classes?
The main difference with any other timelapse classes I have released so far is the "on location" teaching around the United States, along with the advanced timelapse and hyperlapse techniques I have never taught before.A huge section of this TMC21 is showing you how I approach different cityscapes in the US.  This is my favorite part of the Master Class as I will be sharing my knowledge on location while capturing America's most beautiful cities!For the first time as well, I will be teaching motion control timelapses with 1, 2 and 3 axis setups. I will give you TONS of tips and tricks to create better motion control timelapses, even day-to-night.I will teach you how to capture amazing and beautiful hyperlapses and drone-hyperlapses.Finally, I will have 8 videos about how to capture nature and astro-timelapses in some of the most beautiful National Parks of the American Southwest.The TMC21 will be a great addition to the TMC19 which has taught you how to create and sell you work online. TMC19 and TMC21 will create the ultimate timelapse master class combo! Here is a short sneak peek of some of the TMC21 lessons I have already shot and edited.   Your donation will also get you some perks!Anyone who donates to making TMC21 a reality will receive one of the perks below based on the amount of your donation. story:
About Us and Our Campaign

We are Ben Maier, Emily Josephine Rooney, Emma Grima and Lina Selg - four good goofy friends from Germany, Pennsylvania (US),  Malta and Germany again and photography students at the Royal Academy of Arts, NL.

In February 2021, the four of us founded Pineapple Road Press and began working on a photographic publication called ‚Under Her Gaze We Feel Golden‘, which - all inspired by the summer sun - tells a tale of collective hopes and longings. 

More than just to collaborate between us, we wanted to work with others in and outside of our own university's walls, to have a diverse publication and to make new connections. We sent an open call to students of the Fotobus Society (students from different art universities, Germany), Moholy-Nagy University (Hungary) and our own, Royal Academy of Arts (Netherlands), asking the students to take part with an image of their own which expressed something they longed for, or their escapes. (We received a lot of really cool and beautiful images!) 

We’ve missed these connections, we still miss togetherness, both with friends and strangers. This publication will be - and already is - an ode to this and many more longings; and an escape from the claustrophobia of society.  

You can take it as a catalyst to reflect on this society, or as an escape itself; a reminder of the light-heartedness of being, and the innocent joy of summer sun on your skin. 

We also hope that this project can be a starting point to get to know students of the same field, to collaborate and support each other.   

 

How Can You Help Us

We need your help to turn our longings into a physical reality: to make this publication a printed one. With this crowdfunding, we are raising the money to cover the print costs. 

You can help us to make this love experiment of ours happen by donating, by pre-ordering our publication or by acquiring any of the other wonderful big and little perks which all come with a whole lot of love!  

 

Lovely Perks For You  

The Zine:  Will be printed, then packaged by us with love and shipped to you in June! (the zine is still a dummy, it will be even more beautiful :) )

The Extended Zine Package: A publication, a postcard and a poster! ( we will surprise you!) 

 A4 Fine Art Print: Signed digital fine art print of the image below! Taken by one of the lovely Pineapple Road Press members. 

 

A Set of Postcards: A set of 5 postcards - photographs from the publication - for you to send to your friends, lovers or strangers - to connect or tell a story or share a memory perhaps. Let's spread love! not corona!  


 

Finances

All contributions will be used to print the zine and ship it to you. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re a broke artist like us, you can also help by getting the word out and making some noise about this! Tell your friends, your family, your rich neighbour - there’s also some super cool share tools Indiegogo told us we should remind you about,  let's make this happen! 

And.... 

WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

We’ll be sending something beautiful your way shortly!

Much love from our very excited newborn publishing collective, 

Yours truly – The Pineapples.

story:
“Art, freedom and creativity will change society faster than politics.”

-Victor Pinchuk

Poetry, Photography, Design and Urban Art - woven together in a large-scale street intervention, poetry workshop & photo zine by CHUZKOS and INZYNC Poetry.

We believe in the power of collaboration, art and photography to not only disrupt, but to empower and promote positive change. We are therefore co-creating the third [CROP] project (‘Creative Resistance & Open Processes’), providing South African creatives an opportunity to explore important social issues, raise awareness, uplift local communities and inspire social change by using creative resistance.

 

How it works

The third [CROP] Creative Open Call, invites photographers to submit documentary and/or artistic images that explore South African identity, highlight social issues like the housing problem, promote the critical visual exploration of the social environment, and capture our united resistance by focusing on local stories, landscapes, faces and emotions.

Selected images will be presented in a poetry workshop held with poets from Kayamandi in July 2018. The young poets will select a few photos that resonate, and will create their poetry about them. These photographs will be printed large and will be installed in an urban environment. The images will also engage youth in the community, thus promoting interaction in public spaces, increasing participation and encouraging reflection on cultural dynamics.

The photos, poems and the story of Kayamandi will be included into a photo zine, which will be distributed with the hope of starting new dialogues, showcasing local talent, and raising awareness about the challenges the township faces.

 

Get Involved

[CROP] Project is a passion project, something we believe in & WANT to do. The project therefore relies on openness, participation & collectivity, not on profits. All funds therefore go towards production and logistics. Your contributions will help us with:

  • Transport (flights, car & petrol)
  • A1 Poster - Printing
  • Large scale photos & poems - Printing
  • Photo zine - Printing & distribution 

 

Join the movement

Art changes us, inspires us and can create movement. Together we can:​

  • Promote interaction. Urban transformation encourages people to engage with each other and their surrounding, enhances moods, strengthens community identity, starts conversations, encourages interaction and inspires hope, unity and resistance.
  • Evoke emotion. Street art is an unlikely platform that echoes a feeling of revolution, uprising and challenges the status-quo. It is not censored, monitored or paid for, it is for the people by the people.
  • Celebrate local culture and talent.  Our workshops, interventions, social media campaigns and photo zine will give  poets, photographers and creatives a voice and create platforms for them to showcase their work both locally and internationally.
  • Raise awareness amongst the general public about the area and the challenges they face, as well as how they can contribute and support the community.
  • Create a community of creative minds that are committed to the ideals of tolerance, change and collective problem solving.

 

More info:

For more of our projects visit chuzkos.com or cropproject.com.

Also feel free to FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK.

​Feel free to get in touch if you have any question: chuzkos.collective@gmail.com

story:
Welcome!

My name is Bernard Webb. I am an Anglo-American fine arts photographer residing in Hove, East Sussex

"Wet feet" will be my first solo exhibition and what better place for this than the Naked Eye gallery in Hove!  This is a culmination of a lot of shooting over the past year. The title "wet feet" coincides with the fact that I have got my feet wet on numerous occasions when taking pictures on the beach, and after twenty six years of being in America everything seems so raw and new for me.  With this exhibition I want people to see beyond the familiar backdrop of their lives, and see the beauty and drama of living in this coastal town.

So really, what are you contributing to?  I liken it to recording songs, this is my crowd funded album!  Your contributions will help with renting gallery space for two weeks, printing, framing and mounting, and producing a limited run book to accompany the work. Naked Eye gallery and I will take care of promoting the venue for the opening night and for the rest of the show...I can't wait!!!!

Donating to this event could not be easier.  Paypal is set up and ready and there are different levels of donation.  Of course, anything is welcome; to have you as part of this exhibition will mean the world to me. It will help promote my vision and to continue my work across this city and beyond, so in advance...thank you!

Bernard J Webb
www.bjwphotography.net

story:
EAST STREET TALES        

                  

Here is Iris with her carefully powdered cheeks and stylish hat. She borrows her shopping trolley from Farmfoods every day and walks up and down the street or simply sits around on the benches. Everybody knows her. Ken is wearing his cowboy hat again. People are chatting outside the shops, having coffees or just breaking the toil of the weekly shop. Of course here are the rough ones too: the drunks, the ‘miserables’ and the ‘screamers’, channelling their anger towards children and seagulls. This is the land of Asda and Cash For Gold. This is Bedminster Parade, my local high street. 

Once a thriving area where local businesses and industry served the community, it is now filled with empty units, bargain stores and betting shops. For many, the area is a place to avoid.  Bedminster’s shopping centre, described as a “disgrace” by the chairman of the local development committee, now faces a controversial new development which will thrust nearly two hundred unaffordable luxury flats into its heart.

My project is a celebration of life and the people behind the statistics. It is a systematic documentation of a unique community during its transition towards ‘gentrification’. 

I am passionate about sharing the charm of this place and it's array of characters with the wider community. The work invites the audience to look beyond the negative stereotypes associated with Bedminster and promotes social acceptance and wellbeing. I believe that it is an important community project and it will continue to show that the people of Bedminster are valued and appreciated.

The outcome of this project is a unique photography archive about the people of East Street, their stories and the most recent history of Bedminster. The project will be exhibited in the local area giving an opportunity to celebrate the community.

This work is about the community and for the community and my intention is to share the final outcome in ways that will be accessible to everyone. 


WHY DO I NEED YOUR HELP?

In order to capture, record and celebrate the essence of this community before it is irrevocably changed, I need to spend significantly more time working on this project. I have been working on this project for over two years as a labour of love using my own savings. Now I need to raise the rest of the expenses to be able to continue my work and be able to show it to the community.

With your help I will be able to cover the minimum cost of film processing, printing, framing and hiring of an exhibition space.

THIS PHOTOGRAPHIC WORK CAN ONLY BE MADE NOW, AT THIS TIME IN HISTORY.


How can you help?

I hugely appreciate any support and in exchange  for your generosity,  I offer exciting and unique rewards. Please consider making a contribution.

You can also help me by sharing the link to this page with your friends. Please spread the word on your social media and other platforms and help me reach out to as many people as possible.

About the prints

All photographs will be digital C- type prints on archival paper printed at the legendary BDi in London. The given size is the paper size, the image will be printed approximately 1inch (2.5 cm) smaller to allow framing. All prints will be numbered and signed.

If you wish to see more images from the series please visit the Gallery at the top of this page.


The thank you card and bag design

This wonderful artwork and the campaign logo is designed by the talented Stephanie Sarlos. All cards will be numbered making them even more special. I hope they will delight you as much they delight me.All the bags will be printed with this fun and clever campaign logo.


Biography

Ibolya Feher is an emerging photographer who has already garnered much praise and received some significant awards. Her previous work, Sisters of Sclerder  has gained national and international recognition, it has been nominated for, and won various awards.

She was runner up for the Guardian Student Media Awards, Student Photographer of the Year Award in 2011; won the South West Graduate Photography Prize in the same year; and was most recently long-listed for the Magnum & IdeasTap Photography Award. 

Her work has been published around the globe in publications such as BBC Mondo, Slate magazine, Featureshot, Voices of Italy to mention a few. 

Ibolya, a native of Hungary who has been living in Bristol for 10 years.

She is passionate about telling people’s stories and this passion drives her to work up to the highest standard.


Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge in this project is being able to continuously connect to the people I have been photographing. However, knowing the generosity and openness of the people on East Street this represents only a very minor risk and could only result in a slight delay in schedule. This would not affect the prompt delivery of your rewards.

story:
Campaign Information

My name is Verna and I'm a former teacher turned photographer living in Austin, Texas.


A few years ago, after returning from London and Paris with hundreds of photos, I shared my travel experience with my students.  After answering several of their questions about my travels, I remembered that a lot of the students I taught did not come from families that could afford travel beyond the US.

In an effort to change that, I came up with the idea of World Class: A Photo Expedition Abroad.

What is World Class?

World Class: A Photo Expedition Abroad is a way for students that wouldn't otherwise have the means to travel overseas, to learn about the world they live in.  In addition to reading and learning about foreign lands in books and in the classroom, students will have the chance to actually be there.  Each day they will act as photo journalists being immersed in the culture and sharing their experiences through photography and words.
 



Why is traveling abroad so important?

Our planet is a constant spinning sphere of change.  Our youth are essential to global and cultural change, but unfortunately funding for international travel is not easily accessible to students from low income families.  When ALL students, regardless of socioeconomic status, have access to international educational trips, it improves quality of life.  They learn about lands beyond their country and begin to understand how to configure a cooperative economic and social global network.

Why Indiegogo?

Great ideas often start with one person, but it takes the support of family, friends, our communities and people like YOU to make it a reality!
 
Indiegogo is the perfect platform to create a national and global community of people working together to change lives and everyone can get involved.  
 
My hope is this project is just one of others like it that will be created in communities across the world. 
 
How will Indiegogo funds be used?

About $38k of the funds will be used for students' travel expenses.  I have been working with EFTours.com and their sister company, GoAheadTours.com to create a trip that is both highly educational and economical.  Expenses include flights, ground transportation, meals and educational tours and activities.

Additionally, about $2k of the funds will be used to cover pre-travel related fees, including passport fees.  The remaining funds will be used to create and ship perks/rewards, as well as pay fees associated with Indiegogo.

What if the goal is exceeded?

If the goal is exceeded, the extra funds will be used to get an extra laptop or two to take and use for uploading photos and blogging.  For every extra $5000, we can offer the trip to another student.

What are the AWESOME rewards?

This is an educational photo journalism project, so students will be taking photos of everything they see and experience. These photos will be featured in the rewards, for example:
 

Photo Postcards

 
Example of 4" x 6" photo postcards.
 


Exclusive World Class Photo Expedition T-Shirt (designed by Bob Boucher)

 
 

Gallery Wrapped Canvas Prints

 
Example of a 16" x 24" Gallery Wrapped Canvas Print

Signed posters, a limited edition book and more!

(Note: The photos on the postcards and canvas above are just EXAMPLES and ARE NOT actual photos you will receive.)

Are there other ways I can support this campaign?

Absolutely!  Please help spread the word through Facebook, Twitter, your blog, website, and with family and friends!
 
Another way to help is through donating camera equipment, such as quality digital camera bodies, lenses and memory cards.  Additionally, we'd love to provide extra laptops for students to upload their photos and blog while they are on their trip.  To donate these items, please contact me at starlingphotography@gmail.com.
 
Have more questions?
Send me an email!  I'd love to hear from you!

Special Thanks and Acknowledgement

Special thanks to Angel, Robert, Ayan, Daniella, Tar'rell and Adam for being a part of the making of this video.

Thank you for being a contributor!

story:
Short Summary

Mystika Glamoor is the high priestess of Edinburgh drag, a tarot card reader as well as hostess of her weekly drag show, GLAMOOR! Having worked for almost a year at the show with the amazing young photographer Lou McCurdy, the two of them now plan on mixing their passion for both drag and the mystical arts into a tarot-themed photography project that they also hope to turn into a physical deck of cards!

What We Need & What You Get

We are both young LGBTQ artists balancing our day jobs with our passion projects, and Lou is still in University. In order to cover our costs for materials and transport to make this a truly stunning deck, we need your help! Plus, we fully dream of creating an actual physical deck of cards, which can be yours for a donation of £50! This covers both printing and delivery costs with a little extra going to support the campaign.  Other cheaper perks include tarot readings and prints of one of the portraits of your choosing! 

The Impact

With your help we'll be able to create a piece of art that merges the world of spirituality and queer culture, and a true testimony of the work possible when supporting local queer artists! The tarot and all other forms of magick are powerful tools of self-realisation that prove particularly helpful for queer people, who are so often marginalised and given a lesser role in the worldm so we hope to spread more awareness of the cards message and their power.

Risks & Challenges

This is an ambitious project, both due to the rich imagery and symbolism in the cards, plus the sheer amount of portraits that need to be made. We have decided to focus on the Major Arcana, AKA the first 22 cards of the tarot, and add some cards that alude to the Minor Arcana and three personal symbolic cards. This is due to simply being realistic with our deadline of next April and allowing us to focus properly on what we can do to the best of our abilities, creating a visually stunning deck and allowing us to potentially work on further cards in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please spread the word! Share on social media and directly with your friends who you feel would be interested in such a project! Both queer and spiritual circles are sure to love what we hope to create!

Thank you to all of you, we can't wait to create this beautifully challenging work xx

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone.. thanks for stopping by ! I am excited to release my 12th calendar in production this year. My new 2022 Calendar will feature 12 of the best hot rods and customs along with 12 of my beautiful pinup girls. This will be my 2nd year I have decided to do a fundraising campaign again this year to help me produce my calendar along with other products like my new deck of cards. Thanks for all the support

What We Need & What You Get

I have decided to increase my quantities to 2000 calendars this year and will be producing a new deck of Pinup Playing Cards as well as new Lapel Pins.  This campaign helps me cover printing cost along with any extra expenses I incurred while producing the calendar.

The Impact

I have enjoyed producing my calendars and have been successful selling out for the last 11 years. This will be my 12th year in production and I hope to continue to create products everyone can enjoy year round. 

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge at the moment is covering printing cost. My goal is always to release the calendars in September so I have plenty of time to sell them to retailers as well as to beat my competition.

story:
An art photography book celebrating natural female sensuality without retouching and photoshopping

Every contributor gets exclusive unpublished art photos.


During the last 5 years I photographed many women in Barcelona. I encouraged them to explore their sensuality in front of my camera without limits and invited them to move freely without imitating the typical glamour poses or pretending something they didn't feel.


I am creating a photography book with 140 pages of full-page and double-page sensual art nude images


(the images in the book and those delivered with the perks are, of course, without pixelated parts and watermark. Uncensored versions can be seen here [NSFW]: sample images )

The photos were taken in the showers, the kitchen, the living room or on the terrace of my studio-flat, on the ancient sofa that already appeared in my early work many years ago and in the narrow streets just around the corner in my neighbourhood, "El Borne", in the old town of the magic city of Barcelona...


The beautiful young women who revealed themselves from their most sensual sides are amateur models and most of them have never before been photographed in the nude.

The results of these photo sessions are images of an exceptionally strong sensual vibrancy. Sometimes quite provocative, always intense and emotional. Fine art nudes that show the female beauty of authentic, self confident and modern women.



Real photography. Real women.

Despite of the modern and young look of the photographs, I see myself as an old school photographer. Instead of adding effects or enhancing pictures using editing software, I work in the classical way with the light and the camera.

During the sessions I create an atmosphere in which the portrayed women can feel free and safe. To capture their individual sensual charisma I abstain from using the typical "glamour poses" and never ask for those characteristical expressions of pretended arousal. I want artistic, not artificial nudes.

Hence, what you see is real. Women with skin and hair. Natural, authentic beauty. Genuine feelings.


Details about the book

The Barcelona Album is a 140 page book, self published and available as print-on-demand. All photos are full-page or double-page, many color images, while the greater part are black and white photos. 21x28cm, hardcover.

It is my third monographic photo book, but my first self-published one and my first print-on-demand project.



Bonus images: Unpublished extra photos

Each contributor gets an exclusive series of unpublished art photos that nobody has seen until now, that will not appear in the book and that will give you a "backstage" sight on what else originated from the photo sessions:

  • a pdf with 3 unpublished photos from the Barcelona sessions (up to €4.99)
  • a pdf with 10 unpublished photos from the Barcelona sessions (up to €24.99)
  • a pdf with 25 unpublished photos from the Barcelona sessions in printable resolution (€25 and up)
The pdf's with the unpublished photos will be sent per e-mail to all contributors immediately after the end of the campaign.

In the meantime...

I am currently in the final phase of the electronic production.

I am experienced with analogue and digital printing. I work with a calibrated screen to achieve best colors and tones for the images of this book and you can expect a high quality product delivered on time. I have considered enough time in case that any corrections should be necessary before the final release.


Other ways you can help to realize
The Barcelona Album

Please share the campaign through your social media reach, your e-mail contacts, and by word of mouth!!!

Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons below the video on top to share through your social media networks or copy the URL and paste it into an email or social media update.

Help to publish this book of artistic nudes that shows the beauty of authentic woman and that demonstrates that images of stunning beauty and sensuality do not depend on spotless, hairless and "optimized" bodies or simulated expressions. But on genuine feelings, confidence, love and authenticity - and artistic talent.

I need YOUR help to bring the book project to life!

If you enjoy my work, consider contributing to the project to receive your very own copy.


My thank you! on social media and a special page:



When I receive the good news about your contribution, I'll ask you per email, if you give permission to mention your name on my social media sites and on the special thank-you page I'll create when the book is published. If you agree I'll

  • immediately thank you publicly on my social media updates (facebook, google+, tumblr). If you like with a link to your own facebook, g+ or website.
  • thank you on the special page after publishing the book (with link to your facebook, g+ or website, if you like)

It is your support that makes you an important part of my project and therefore all names will appear without mentioning the amount they contributed.


"Barcelona for YOU" and "fly high!", details:



These perks must be carried out within a year after the end of this campaign (between April 2015 and March 2016). Dates are to be arranged according to the possibilities (availability of room and models, flights, workload).

"Barcelona for YOU": Details about the room are available here: airbnb

"fly high!": Restricted to destinations of Vueling or Easy-Jet within the European Union.

Photos taken by the contributors are for personal use only and may not be published. However it is always possible to ask the model for permission for specific images, but her decision must be accepted.

If you decide for the "fly high!"-workshop you may invite 1 additional person to attend during the workshop. 

The delivered, edited photos taken of you by me during a private session belong to you with all rights. You own them and you may do with them what ever you like without any restrictions. I will hand out them only and directly to you. Nobody else than you and I will ever see them, except when you yourself show them.


Your ideas, suggestions, wishes...

I am open, of course, for any ideas and suggestions and also for wishes for special perks. Just contact barcelona@daniel-bauer.com for any questions or concerns.

Contribute to this beautiful and unique art photo book and be part of the community that supports unconventional, non-commercial art photography.

If you agree I'll
immediately thank you publicly on my social media updates (facebook, google+, tumblr). If you like with a link to your own facebook, g+ or website.
thank you on the special page after publishing the book (with link to your facebook, g+ or website, if you like)
It is your support that makes you an important part of my project and therefore all names will appear without mentioning the amount they contributed. "Barcelona for YOU" and "fly high!", details:These perks must be carried out within a year after the end of this campaign (between April 2015 and March 2016). Dates are to be arranged according to the possibilities (availability of room and models, flights, workload)."Barcelona for YOU": Details about the room are available here: airbnb"fly high!": Restricted to destinations of Vueling or Easy-Jet within the European Union.Photos taken by the contributors are for personal use only and may not be published. However it is always possible to ask the model for permission for specific images, but her decision must be accepted.If you decide for the "fly high!"-workshop you may invite 1 additional person to attend during the workshop. The delivered, edited photos taken of you by me during a private session belong to you with all rights. You own them and you may do with them what ever you like without any restrictions. I will hand out them only and directly to you. Nobody else than you and I will ever see them, except when you yourself show them.Your ideas, suggestions, wishes...
I am open, of course, for any ideas and suggestions and also for wishes for special perks. Just contact barcelona@daniel-bauer.com for any questions or concerns.Contribute to this beautiful and unique art photo book and be part of the community that supports unconventional, non-commercial art photography.

story:
What is ON DAIDO ?

The book ON DAIDO is a photographic anthology of statements and homages to the Japanese photographer Daido Moriyama made by internationally acclaimed photographers and writers. This publication is dedicated to him and will be available in a special edition of 500 copies on the occasion of the 7th Fotobookfestival Kassel in June 2015. FBF Books, the publishing branch of the not-for-profit Fotobookfestival Kassel will publish this book. Your support of this Indiegogo project will make this special publication possible.

Why and How?

Daido Moriyama is undoubtedly one of the most important photographers of all times. But who is this reserved, likeable man from Tokyo, who has affected the development of Japanese photography like no other? Which overwhelming energy is behind this fascinating simplicity in the art of photography? How is it possible that his images, no matter how they are cropped, reproduced, rotated or flipped, still manage to keep their core essence? How does one approach the Daido Moriyama phenomenon? We asked 31 photographers and 21 writers to help us find an answer by way of visual and textual statements. We requested appraisal and acclaim, commentary and feedback. Our request predominantly met with a resoundingly positive response and immediate approval. The resulting anthology ON DAIDO paints a multifaceted picture of the great renewer of photography. Essentially, it does not so much pay homage to an individual, as celebrate the photographic medium as a whole. We are grateful to the photographers and authors for their participation. We wish to carry on spreading and understanding the great work of Daido Moriyama through this anthology. Let's do it together.

The photographers:
Morten Andersen
Nobuyoshi Araki
Jacob Aue Sobol
Machiel Botman
Krass Clement
Antoine D’Agata
JH Engström
Stephen Gill
John Gossage
Todd Hido
Takashi Homma
Osamu Kanemura
Rinko Kawauchi
Keizo Kitajima
Takuma Nakahira
Asako Naharashi
Mika Ninagawa
Katsumi Omori
Koji Onaka
Martin Parr
Anders Petersen
André Principe
Leo Rubinfien
Ken Schles
Joachim Schmid
Oliver Sieber
Alec Soth
Katja Stuke
Aya Takada
Ali Taptik
Terri Weifenbach

Sample spreads:

© Araki

© JH Engström

© Todd Hido

© Jacob Aue Sobol

© Ken Schles

© Alec Soth

© Mika Ninagawa

© Asako Narahashi


The writers:

Dan Abbe - art historian
Gerry Badger - photography critic
Simon Baker - curator of photography and international art at Tate
Ute Eskildsen - curator of photography
Jean-Kenta Gauthier - gallerist
Akira Hasegawa - photo editor
Steven Kasher - gallerist
Clément Kauter - photo book seller
Erik Kessels - art director and publisher
Shino Kuraishi - curator of photography
Freddy Langer - author and journalist
Russet Lederman - Japanese photo book collector
Akio Nagasawa - gallerist and publisher
Sandra S. Phillips - curator of photography at San Fransisco Museum of Modern Art
Andrew Roth - gallerist and publisher
Leo Rubinfien - photographer and essayist
Yoko Sawada - publisher, editor and photographer agent
Minoru Shimusu - art critic
Miwa Susuda - photo book consultant and writer
Mariko Takeuchi - critic, curator and professor

"Daido is one of the supreme masters of stream-of-consciousness photography, where the camera is used as a direct, unfiltered, spontaneous conduit to the photographer's subconscious. His photographs are a visual record of seeing, certainly, but also a reflection of his private thoughts and emotions. That might serve almost as a definition of photography, and Daido defines it as well as most." Gerry Badger

"Daido Moriyama might well be the last great black-and-white photographer of the analogue era, which is coming to an end. He is definitely one of the most radical, and his oeuvre continues to captivate us, as is apparent from this publication."
Ute Eskildsen

"Whether on matted, coated or glossy paper, in heliogravure, offset or photocopy, in a magazine or in a review, inside an attractive binding or on the wall, Daido Moriyama's photography carries out its very own aesthetics."
Clément Kauter

"In his search for the surfaceness of photography, Moriyama radically proved that transcription, repetition, and mass-production are the essence of this medium. For him, it cannot be realism, self-expression, or documentary. In this sense, he is the Warhol of photography."
Mariko Takeuchi

What we Need?

Most of the work has been done! We received powerful contributions from photographers and writers all over the world. They were all very enthusiastic about the project. All we need to do now is to print the book the way we envisage it and make this anthology available to an international audience.

With your help, ON DAIDO will be ready in June 2015 and available by the next, 7th edition of the Fotobookfestival Kassel (June 4th-7th, 2015). Each contribution is vital and will be used for the production of the book anyway!

Who we are?

For the past seven years, Kassel in Germany has been home to the most important annual forum on the world of photography books, the Fotobookfestival Kassel. The festival is a long weekend full of artist lectures, book exhibitions, booksellers and publishers showcasing their most recent offerings, portfolio reviews and awards for the best photobooks from the previous year. For photographers hoping to find people interested in their yet-to-be-discovered book projects, the main attraction of the Fotobookfestival Kassel is its photo book dummy competition for the best unpublished photo book mock-up. Find more information at:
www.fotobookfestival.org

Other Ways You Can Help?

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Please feel free to share this campaign with your social network or send it to your email contacts who might be interested in this project. We thank you sincerely in advance. The book will feature the names of everyone who helped to make it possible by supporting this Indiegogo campaign.

Thank you for your support in making this book possible!

ON DAIDO - An Homage by photographers & writers
Edited by Dieter Neubert
Published by FBF Books / Kasseler Fotografie Festival gUG, Kassel, Germany
Design by Steffen Kalauch
77 b+w and color images, 88 pages, size 21x28 cm, integrated book end paper, printed on Lessebo Design (photographs) and Popset Grey (text) paper, open thread stitching, silver embossed cover.

story:
Smart Studio Gallery?

Everybody has a Smart phone these days, and the internet is every where. 

So it's my plan to use those tools to allow patrons to view and purchase art and photographic services, quickly, painlessly and 24/7!

Over 30 years of Photographic Experience

So far the reaction of each person who has listened to my pitch has been enthusiastically positive. More than one has a commented that this is perfectly suited to my experience and knowledge. 

But they already know me and my history, and they're my friends-not unbiased strangers. They already know what I'm capable of and my track record of successful projects. 

If you haven't seen my work, then I can't expect you to have any faith in my vision. 

So, please feel free to check out my work on my website.www.dwightreinhardt,com 

Working Smarter 

  • Using Today's technology to everyone's advantage
  • Swift safe purchases from their own phone or our tablet

The Olde Town area is rapidly changing, growing and maturing. This concept will bring another reason for visitors to support Olde Town Arvada, Colorado.

Please feel free to visit the campaign's website for even more information. SmartPhotoStudioGallery.com

A Place to Start

Even I can't change the whole world all at once. But with your help, we can start building the necessary tools:

  • Retail Store front
  • Smart Phone App
  • Initial Gallery content
  • Matching QR Code and Web site
There are a few available options, but they are getting snatched up fast. So this funding will allow a lease to get signed and reconstruction to begin. 

There are many cheap and free QR code apps out there, I'm hoping to find one that allows for branding and other features.


Once those are available, all I need to do is print and code the gallery's first show. The Artwork will be framed with a small QR code next to it. If we can afford it I'd also like to print business cards for each image with the QR code. Then patrons can share the art work, and increase sales.

               


Share the Success

When we get our funds together, I want you to share the feeling of accomplishment, too. Your contribution will make an artistic impact on this historic community.

  • Every donation gets an Invitation to the Gallery's Opening
  • Local Business Donations get Free Photographic Services

Joining the NEW Olde Town

After watching businesses leave Olde Towne and shut their doors during the recent rocky economy, now it is reviving itself with fresh businesses. 

That's why this is the perfect time to provide the NEW Olde Towne area not only a necessary service, but also a point of interest close to shopping, dining and coffee. 

One of the luckiest breaks, in a lifetime of pretty favorable turns, was getting hired and trained by the President of the Midwestern Hardware Association. He taught me the best retail and customer service practices any one could hope for. 

Using that extensive experience, and a keen eye, I hope to create diverse exhibits which will draw the eye of the increasing foot traffic. The Key is to make it a place that belongs there. The kind of place people are comfortable with. Not a "Snotty- Up-scale" boutique, but a Colorado kind of place where jeans and sneakers are the formal attire.

Today's SMART Tech

There are already several App's available which incorporate QR Scanners, and allow for private branding. They are subscription services, but that seems to be the wisest choice to begin with. Over time I hope to build a set of specific apps for the studio and the gallery. But they aren't necessary the initial launch of the SMART concept.

In House, we will have smart phones and tablets available for scanning and ordering artwork through the website and Digital Photolab. The system will allow clients to decide what size and finish they desire, and allow them to check out with their credit card or PayPal Account. 

The gallery will host show openings, discussion groups, book signings and fundraisers. The type of events that will attract attention to the studio, spread the word to potential clients, and benefit the community.

Full Service Photography Studio

The studio will also provide a wide range of services, from product photography to graphic design. Over the years my photography and customer service have won their own awards. And for several years before joining the CU/Boulder faculty, I was the art director for a fledgling Island guide in the Caribbean, which won awards and accolades from the Island community.   

Before that I was the Digital Output Specialist for the Rocky Mountain Division of Kinko's. Working out of one of the largest Kinko's centers in the nation, it was my job to make sure the client got what they expected and more whenever possible.


That means I have accumulated the tools and knowledge to provide a broad spectrum of services for the community. Whether it's a single portrait for newsletter or the whole newsletter itself, the client can get it through one place. To me, that's SMART Business.

Ready to Lend a Hand?

So, I hope that I have answered some of your questions, and fired up your interest in bringing SMART Art to this part of the Rocky Mountain Front Range. 

Obviously the goal is just a starting point. Don't let it scare you in any way. The greater the response, the faster we can get this project up and running. If we meet and exceed the goal then we increase our chances of success that much more.

Please feel free to check in on the the new website, where I'll be posting new information and photos.

 SmartPhotoStudioGallery.com

And I hope I can count on your support for this Unique Adventure. In fact I'm so confidant you will see the benefits of this project I'd like to thank you now for you time, attention and support.
