In fact I'm so confidant you will see the benefits of this project I'd like to thank you now for you time, attention and support.

story:
Was wir erreichen wollen

Zusammengefasst: Unser Ziel ist es, das erste und einzige duale Baseball und Softball Feld in Duisburg zu bauen. Die Arbeiten auf einem alten Fußballplatz in Duisburg-Neumühl haben bereits begonnen und wir sammeln nun Spenden um die Basiselemente des Feldes zu finanzieren. Wenn wir das Ziel erreichen sollten wir den Platz bis Juni 2013 fertig haben, sodass man noch die zweite Hälfte des Sommers damit verbringen kann, darauf zu spielen.

Alle Spenden gehen ohne Umwege an folgende Projektgruppen:

  1. Hauptsachen
    1. Die Umzäunung des Platzes: Der bestehende Platz ist fast komplett mit einem Geländer umzäunt, an welches wir Maschendraht befestigen wollen um den Spielbereich einzugrenzen.
    2. Backstop: Zwei sehr hohe Backstops sind nötig um die angrenzenden Gebäude hinter den jeweiligen Homeplates zu schützen. Dies sollte an sich kein Problem sein, doch wir haben vor kurzem erfahren, dass die Fundamente sehr tief (und somit sehr teuer) sein müssen da der Baugrund zu sandig ist.
  2. Nebensachen
    1. Aschebahn und "Pitcher's Mound": Da neue Asche ziemlich teuer ist, haben wir uns dazu entschieden alte Tennisasche zu recyceln. Da Tennisplätze jeden Frühling ihre Asche erneuern kann man diese günstig erwerben. Im Moment planen wir, nur kleine Aschefelder um die Bases und Home Plate herum anzulegen, aber mit Ihrer Hilfe könnten wir richtige Aschebahnen zwischen den Bases bauen.
    2. Dugouts: Die größten kosten beim Bau der Dugoutsn liegen bei dem Baugutachten, der Bauzulassung und den Betonfundamenten. Die Dugouts selbst werden aus jeglichen gespendeten Materialien gebaut, damit wir den Spielern so schnell wie möglich Unterschlupf vor dem Regen bieten können.
    3. Geräteschuppen: Wir versuchen ein oder zwei gebrauchte Container aufzutreiben damit wir dort unsere Garten-, Wartungs- und Trainingsgeräte unterbringen können.
    4. Außerhalb des Platzes: Der Platz ist auf allen Seiten von ungepflegten Dornenbüschen und Unkraut umgeben. Wir haben vor jegliches Unkraut und Baumstumpfe zu entfernen und stattdessen Gras dort zu pflanzen, damit jeder der sich unsere Spiele angucken möchte auch einen Platz zum sitzen findet.

Der Traum

Zur Zeit spielen fünf Baseball und Softball Teams jedes Alters und Geschlechts bei den Duisburg Dockers. Wir hoffen, dass da dieser speziell angefertigte Platz mehr Aufmerksamkeit auf diese tolle Sportart zieht und wir somit neue Spieler für uns begeistern können. Wir interessieren uns im Moment sehr dafür, zwei neue T-Ball Teams zu gründen, in dem auch die Kleinsten in Duisburg spielen können!

Die Welt braucht mehr Baseball!

Ein bisschen zur Geschichte

Die Baseball und Softball Teams des 1. ASC Duisburg Dockers spielen schon seit sehr langer Zeit auf dem alten Fußballplatz im Schwelgernstadion, welcher heute hauptsächlich als American Football Platz genutzt wird. Die Wiese ist stark abgenutzt und zu sagen der Boden ist uneben wäre eine Untertreibung. Die lange, schmale Form des Platzes und die umgebende Aschelaufbahn tragen auch nicht wirklich zu unserem Nutzen bei.

Wir haben schon vor Jahren die Suche nach einem neuen Platz begonnen. Das größte Problem ist dass Duisburg mitten im Ruhrgebiet liegt und die Bevölkerungsdichte hier die höchste in Europa ist. Es gibt nur wenige große, offene Flächen, die man sich leisten kann, und in der Geschichte des Baseballs und Softballs in NRW mussten viele Vereine deswegen ihre Sachen packen und umziehen oder ganz aufhören. Erst letztes Jahr haben wir endlich den unbenutzten Fußballplatz ergattern können, was uns große Freude brachte (und immer noch bringt!).

Wir haben sofort mit den Baumaßnahmen begonnen.

Was wurde bisher erreicht?

  • Als allererstes wurde das Feld innerhalb des Geländers gepflügt, geebnet und letztes Jahr mit neuem Gras bepflanzt
  • Von der Stadt vorgegebene Bodenstudien, die für die Bauerlaubnis der Backstops und Dugouts nötigt sind, wurden durchgeführt.
  • Die Brombeerbüsche wurden 2012 über Wochen von Freiwilligen aus den verschiedenen Teams aus dem Boden gerissen, klein gehäckselt und wieder über die Erde zerstreut. Damit ist die Arbeit dort aber leider nicht getan, da immer wieder neues Unkraut (besonders Brennnessel) dort wächst. Deswegen müssen wir diese Bereiche so schnell es geht mit Gras bepflanzen.

Über die Duisburg Dockers

Der 1. American Sports Club Duisburg Dockers wurde 1986 als American Football Team gegründet. Bis zum heutigen Tage ist der Verein stetig gewachsen und beinhaltet heute American Football, Flag Football, Cheerleading, Baseball, Softball und seit Februar 2013 Wrestling.

Die Baseball und Softball Abteilung ist Teil des BSVNRW (Baseball & Softball Verband Nordrhein-Westfalen) und beinhaltet im Moment drei Baseball Teams (Jugend, Junioren und Herren) und zwei Softball Teams (Damen und ein gemischtes Freizeitteam).

 

 

What we are trying to do

In short: we are trying to build the first and only dual baseball & softball field in Duisburg. Work has already started on an old football pitch in Duisburg-Neumühl, and we are now raising funds to finance and complete some of the basic elements for these fields. If the target is reached, we should be able finish working on the field by June 2013, which in turn means that people can enjoy the second half of the Summer playing on it.

Any funds collected will go directly towards the following structures and facilities:

  1. Essential:
    1. Fencing around the fields: the field is almost completely surrounded by a handrail, which we will cover with wire mesh fencing to enclose the playing surface.
    2. Backstop: two high backstops are necessary, as there are some industrial and commercial buildings behind where both homeplates will go. This should be simple enough, but we recently received bad news from the building consultant that the foundations will have to be very deep (and therefore expensive) because the soil is too sandy.
  2. Non-essential:
    1. Dirt tracks and pitching mound: New clay is prohibitively expensive in Germany, so it was decided that we will recycle tennis clay for this purpose. Luckily enough, tennis clubs redo their courts every spring. We have planned for dirt areas around the bases and home plate, but with your help, we might be able to do a whole infield track.
    2. Dugouts: the bulk of the funds for dugouts will go to building inspectors, building permits, and pouring a concrete foundation. The dugouts themselves will be built out whatever donated materials we can get our hands on, so we can keep players out of the rain as soon as we can.
    3. Equipment container(s): we are looking to obtain one or two used containers to store gardening, maintenance, and training equipment.
    4. Around the field: the field is surrounded on 4 sides by unkept, bushy, poison-nettle infested areas. The idea is to remove the unwanted greenery and the tree stumps. Then resow with grass, so that people that would want to watch a game, have actually somewhere to sit on.

The vision

Currently 5 baseball and softball teams of all genders and ages play as Duisburg Dockers. We hope a purpose-built field will attract more attention to these amazing sports, as well as get some new members for the teams. We are especially interested in starting two new t-ball teams for the smallest kids in Duisburg!

The world needs more baseball!

A bit of history

For a very long time, the baseball and softball teams of the 1. ASC Duisburg Dockers have been playing on an old football pitch in the Schwelgernstadion, which is primarily now used as an American Football field. The grass is severely worn, and the ground is uneven to say the least. The shape of the pitch and the running track surrounding it are unhelpful at best.

For years the search for a suitable surface went on. The main difficulty being that Duisburg was smack in the middle of the Ruhr Area, the highest populated urban area in Europe. Affordable, large open spaces, are really hard to come by, and throughout the history of baseball and softball in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia, many teams had to fold or relocate because of this. Only last year did we finally get the abandoned soccer pitch. We were (and still are!) extatic about this.

Work on it began right away.

What has been done so far?

  • First and most importantly, the field within the handrails was ploughed, evened and suitable grass was sown last year. 
  • Soil studies were conducted by an inspector, as required by the city, in order to obtain the building permits for the backstops and the dugouts.
  • The bushes surrounding the field were disposed off over weeks in 2012 by volunteers of the different teams. This work is ongoing, as the weeds, especially the poison nettle, always come back. This is why we need to put grass there ASAP.

About the Duisburg Dockers

The 1. American Sports Club Duisburg Dockers started in 1986 as an American Football team. To this day, the club has expanded itself and now includes American Football, Flag Football, Cheerleading, Baseball, Softball, and since February 2013, Wrestling. 

The Baseball & Softball department is a member of the BSVNRW, and currently consists of 3 baseball teams (youth, junior and men's) and 2 softball teams (ladies and a mixed recreational team).
story_txt:
Was wir erreichen wollen
Zusammengefasst: Unser Ziel ist es, das erste und einzige duale Baseball und Softball Feld in Duisburg zu bauen. Die Arbeiten auf einem alten Fußballplatz in Duisburg-Neumühl haben bereits begonnen und wir sammeln nun Spenden um die Basiselemente des Feldes zu finanzieren. Wenn wir das Ziel erreichen sollten wir den Platz bis Juni 2013 fertig haben, sodass man noch die zweite Hälfte des Sommers damit verbringen kann, darauf zu spielen.
Alle Spenden gehen ohne Umwege an folgende Projektgruppen:

Hauptsachen
Die Umzäunung des Platzes: Der bestehende Platz ist fast komplett mit einem Geländer umzäunt, an welches wir Maschendraht befestigen wollen um den Spielbereich einzugrenzen.
Backstop: Zwei sehr hohe Backstops sind nötig um die angrenzenden Gebäude hinter den jeweiligen Homeplates zu schützen. Dies sollte an sich kein Problem sein, doch wir haben vor kurzem erfahren, dass die Fundamente sehr tief (und somit sehr teuer) sein müssen da der Baugrund zu sandig ist.


Nebensachen
Aschebahn und "Pitcher's Mound": Da neue Asche ziemlich teuer ist, haben wir uns dazu entschieden alte Tennisasche zu recyceln. Da Tennisplätze jeden Frühling ihre Asche erneuern kann man diese günstig erwerben. Im Moment planen wir, nur kleine Aschefelder um die Bases und Home Plate herum anzulegen, aber mit Ihrer Hilfe könnten wir richtige Aschebahnen zwischen den Bases bauen.
Dugouts: Die größten kosten beim Bau der Dugoutsn liegen bei dem Baugutachten, der Bauzulassung und den Betonfundamenten. Die Dugouts selbst werden aus jeglichen gespendeten Materialien gebaut, damit wir den Spielern so schnell wie möglich Unterschlupf vor dem Regen bieten können.
Geräteschuppen: Wir versuchen ein oder zwei gebrauchte Container aufzutreiben damit wir dort unsere Garten-, Wartungs- und Trainingsgeräte unterbringen können.
Außerhalb des Platzes: Der Platz ist auf allen Seiten von ungepflegten Dornenbüschen und Unkraut umgeben. Wir haben vor jegliches Unkraut und Baumstumpfe zu entfernen und stattdessen Gras dort zu pflanzen, damit jeder der sich unsere Spiele angucken möchte auch einen Platz zum sitzen findet.


Der Traum
Zur Zeit spielen fünf Baseball und Softball Teams jedes Alters und Geschlechts bei den Duisburg Dockers. Wir hoffen, dass da dieser speziell angefertigte Platz mehr Aufmerksamkeit auf diese tolle Sportart zieht und wir somit neue Spieler für uns begeistern können. Wir interessieren uns im Moment sehr dafür, zwei neue T-Ball Teams zu gründen, in dem auch die Kleinsten in Duisburg spielen können!
Die Welt braucht mehr Baseball!
Ein bisschen zur Geschichte
Die Baseball und Softball Teams des 1. ASC Duisburg Dockers spielen schon seit sehr langer Zeit auf dem alten Fußballplatz im Schwelgernstadion, welcher heute hauptsächlich als American Football Platz genutzt wird. Die Wiese ist stark abgenutzt und zu sagen der Boden ist uneben wäre eine Untertreibung. Die lange, schmale Form des Platzes und die umgebende Aschelaufbahn tragen auch nicht wirklich zu unserem Nutzen bei.
Wir haben schon vor Jahren die Suche nach einem neuen Platz begonnen. Das größte Problem ist dass Duisburg mitten im Ruhrgebiet liegt und die Bevölkerungsdichte hier die höchste in Europa ist. Es gibt nur wenige große, offene Flächen, die man sich leisten kann, und in der Geschichte des Baseballs und Softballs in NRW mussten viele Vereine deswegen ihre Sachen packen und umziehen oder ganz aufhören. Erst letztes Jahr haben wir endlich den unbenutzten Fußballplatz ergattern können, was uns große Freude brachte (und immer noch bringt!).
Wir haben sofort mit den Baumaßnahmen begonnen.
Was wurde bisher erreicht?

Als allererstes wurde das Feld innerhalb des Geländers gepflügt, geebnet und letztes Jahr mit neuem Gras bepflanzt
Von der Stadt vorgegebene Bodenstudien, die für die Bauerlaubnis der Backstops und Dugouts nötigt sind, wurden durchgeführt.
Die Brombeerbüsche wurden 2012 über Wochen von Freiwilligen aus den verschiedenen Teams aus dem Boden gerissen, klein gehäckselt und wieder über die Erde zerstreut. Damit ist die Arbeit dort aber leider nicht getan, da immer wieder neues Unkraut (besonders Brennnessel) dort wächst. Deswegen müssen wir diese Bereiche so schnell es geht mit Gras bepflanzen.
Über die Duisburg Dockers
Der 1. American Sports Club Duisburg Dockers wurde 1986 als American Football Team gegründet. Bis zum heutigen Tage ist der Verein stetig gewachsen und beinhaltet heute American Football, Flag Football, Cheerleading, Baseball, Softball und seit Februar 2013 Wrestling.
Die Baseball und Softball Abteilung ist Teil des BSVNRW (Baseball & Softball Verband Nordrhein-Westfalen) und beinhaltet im Moment drei Baseball Teams (Jugend, Junioren und Herren) und zwei Softball Teams (Damen und ein gemischtes Freizeitteam).
 
 

What we are trying to do
In short: we are trying to build the first and only dual baseball & softball field in Duisburg. Work has already started on an old football pitch in Duisburg-Neumühl, and we are now raising funds to finance and complete some of the basic elements for these fields. If the target is reached, we should be able finish working on the field by June 2013, which in turn means that people can enjoy the second half of the Summer playing on it.
Any funds collected will go directly towards the following structures and facilities:

Essential:
Fencing around the fields: the field is almost completely surrounded by a handrail, which we will cover with wire mesh fencing to enclose the playing surface.
Backstop: two high backstops are necessary, as there are some industrial and commercial buildings behind where both homeplates will go. This should be simple enough, but we recently received bad news from the building consultant that the foundations will have to be very deep (and therefore expensive) because the soil is too sandy.


Non-essential:
Dirt tracks and pitching mound: New clay is prohibitively expensive in Germany, so it was decided that we will recycle tennis clay for this purpose. Luckily enough, tennis clubs redo their courts every spring. We have planned for dirt areas around the bases and home plate, but with your help, we might be able to do a whole infield track.
Dugouts: the bulk of the funds for dugouts will go to building inspectors, building permits, and pouring a concrete foundation. The dugouts themselves will be built out whatever donated materials we can get our hands on, so we can keep players out of the rain as soon as we can.
Equipment container(s): we are looking to obtain one or two used containers to store gardening, maintenance, and training equipment.
Around the field: the field is surrounded on 4 sides by unkept, bushy, poison-nettle infested areas. The idea is to remove the unwanted greenery and the tree stumps. Then resow with grass, so that people that would want to watch a game, have actually somewhere to sit on.



The vision
Currently 5 baseball and softball teams of all genders and ages play as Duisburg Dockers. We hope a purpose-built field will attract more attention to these amazing sports, as well as get some new members for the teams. We are especially interested in starting two new t-ball teams for the smallest kids in Duisburg!
The world needs more baseball!
A bit of history
For a very long time, the baseball and softball teams of the 1. ASC Duisburg Dockers have been playing on an old football pitch in the Schwelgernstadion, which is primarily now used as an American Football field. The grass is severely worn, and the ground is uneven to say the least. The shape of the pitch and the running track surrounding it are unhelpful at best.
For years the search for a suitable surface went on. The main difficulty being that Duisburg was smack in the middle of the Ruhr Area, the highest populated urban area in Europe. Affordable, large open spaces, are really hard to come by, and throughout the history of baseball and softball in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia, many teams had to fold or relocate because of this. Only last year did we finally get the abandoned soccer pitch. We were (and still are!) extatic about this.
Work on it began right away.


What has been done so far?

First and most importantly, the field within the handrails was ploughed, evened and suitable grass was sown last year. 
Soil studies were conducted by an inspector, as required by the city, in order to obtain the building permits for the backstops and the dugouts.
The bushes surrounding the field were disposed off over weeks in 2012 by volunteers of the different teams. This work is ongoing, as the weeds, especially the poison nettle, always come back. This is why we need to put grass there ASAP.



About the Duisburg Dockers
The 1. American Sports Club Duisburg Dockers started in 1986 as an American Football team. To this day, the club has expanded itself and now includes American Football, Flag Football, Cheerleading, Baseball, Softball, and since February 2013, Wrestling. 
The Baseball & Softball department is a member of the BSVNRW, and currently consists of 3 baseball teams (youth, junior and men's) and 2 softball teams (ladies and a mixed recreational team).

story:
FIND IT, SHARE IT, PASS IT ALONG.

Help fund FINDS 2 — a newsprint of found sculptural form photography which will be distributed across mapped and random locations in London and Brighton this October.

 

 

The original issue of FINDS was distributed guerilla-style during the Brighton Fringe Festival 2010 and around various locations in London, creating a social frenzy to 'find' FINDS. The images from the series depict Watts' captures of the disregarded and discarded materials on our streets, often turning them into sculptures through the photography.

Through this crowdfunding campaign, Watts hopes to self-publish the second issue of FINDS and distribute them over 100 locations in Brighton and an additional 100 in London this October. Creating a movable exhibition and online experiment - documenting the distribution points, public FINDS submissions and articles from a range of renown writers such as Benedict Burbridge and Wayne Ford.

By distributing the FINDS 2 newspaper around the two cities, it will encourage people who may not have an interest in photography to pick it up, pass it along or leave it on the bus for the next person to find.

FINDS pushes the boundaries of a considered photographic discipline whilst also creating and engaging social, participatory experience by inviting the public to actively locate the paper and also submit their own FINDS via Twitter using the hashtag #FINDS.

 

The funding that we need for FINDS 2 will cover the PRINT RUN, DESIGN and DISTRIBUTION.

"By donating to the project, you are helping me to disseminate art to a lot more people. I want to produce something that people can own, for free and FINDS 2 would be a fantastic opportunity to do this." - Harry

 


In sponsoring FINDS 2, you can become a part of the FINDS community - receiving an issue of FINDS 1, limited edition prints, your name printed in FINDS 2 and for the top level sponsor a complete set of 16 prints.

  



 

About Harry Watts (www.harry-watts.co.uk):
Harry Watts graduated from Brighton University in 2009 with a BA in Editorial Photography. The same year, Harry was selected by Italian Vogue for a solo exhibition at the Salvatore Ferragamo flagship store in London, and has since exhibited across the UK and internationally. Harry is currently working on the series FINDS and ILLUSIONS, along with this, he assists photographers Martin Parr, Simon Roberts and Ewen Spencer.

story:
The Island

Rediscovering Adak aims to do exactly what the title suggests. Once a remote, bustling naval air station in Alaska's Aleutian island chain, Adak is now nearly deserted compared to its historical population. It's part of a rich and picturesque wildlife refuge, a birder's paradise, an important part of military history, and an absolute gem that's nearly disconnected from the rest of civilization. I was born on Adak in 1985, where my father worked on theAlaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge. We moved away when I was three, but the distant memories, stories from my parents, and photos of being born in such a unique, isolated place stay with me to this day. I feel strongly compelled to return, explore my birthplace, and share my perspective on what it once was and what it is today with the world.

The Pilgrimage

Now is the right time for me to return to the island. I'm a photographer, a backpacker, a writer/blogger, and a nature enthusiast. With a successfully funded project, I plan to travel to my birthplace this August and explore both the town and the island as it exists today. I'll travel as much of the island as possible while I'm there, photographing and journaling my experience the entire time. Adak's weather can be unpredictable, so part of my challenge will be to capture what I find and experience, be it perfect weather and scenery or stormy conditions that are a reality of life on the island.

The Book and Photos

Given the military base shutdown in the mid 1990s and limited inhabitants and visitors since then, Adak has had very few quality photographs published since the invention of the modern digital camera. I aim to change that. The full-color book will be part photo essay and part story of the return to my birthplace. What I find and the emotions I feel when I visit will ultimately determine the book's contents, but I guarantee that it will be inspired and truly from the heart. I'll strive to discover and document what the island means to me, and what it can mean to you. My parents are also skilled photographers, and using their historical photography to contrast what the island was and my photography of what it is today will be a core part of the book.

The Funds

If I reach my funding goal, the funds raised will make the trip a reality and allow me to *almost* break even on the project by covering travel and printing costs for the resulting book and related materials. If the funding goal is not met, I'm still trying to figure out how to make the trip happen this year, because the Alaska Airlines contract to fly to the island is in jeopordy for future years.

Other Ways to Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, please share this project far and wide with your friends, both in person and online (and especially any that may have Adak connections). In addition to directly offsetting trip costs, if you have island contacts that could help with vehicle rental, lodging, and other logistics, please let me know! I've had some people ask about alternatives to online donation, and if you're interested in going that route, please email me at adam@adamedgerton.com to coordinate.

The Plea

Please help me fund this project to rediscover Adak and share it with those who have visited the island in the past, those who hope to in the future, and most importantly, you. Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Amy Delilah Leon and I am 19 years old!

I am currently studying Experimental Theatre at NYU.


 Ok, so heres the deal! I love life so much. I think this world and everything that occupies it is so incredibly beautiful. I have been through a lot in my 19 years. I have lived in many homes, many boroughs, I've called many people family. I was adopted when I was 13 and changed my name. I have most definitely developed a unique appreciation for life that I am proud of. But heres the thing, I don't remember anything before the age of 13. I don't know if that is normal or not but the fact that I look at my life and cannot remember more than half of it frightens me. I only know what has happened in the last 6 years. When I realized this I started journaling everyday writing down every single detail I could, I became the annoying friend who took pictures at every event, and not just a few but hundreds of pictures at the silliest events. None of them were award winning, or worth hanging up in a frame but each and everyone holds a memory. 

  I was recently given 2 suitcases with pictures of my childhood in it from my birth mother. In it were hundreds of pictures of moments I don't remember. But I looked happy. Whenever I look back on my time with my birth mother I always see darkness and unhappiness because I guess it is easier to remember the tears we've cried than the laughs we've shared. But when looking through the photos there were laughs that I shared with my mother that I never knew existed. It was as if she gave me back my childhood that was so mercilessly stolen from me. Looking at them didn't make me remember anything but it ensured me that my childhood did in fact exist. 

                                          SO FINALLY THIS IS WHY I'M DOING THIS!

I want to raise money to buy a camera! After years of taking pictures I became a bit good at it and I really want to further my craft when it comes to photography. But more than anything I want to capture my life now so that when I am 30 I can look back and remember the life I have led. I truly hope this memory thing isn't clinical (maybe I should get it checked out?) but if I do forget I will not worry because, well I will have thousands of beautiful pictures to remind me of my journey and all the people who have influenced me.


I also am not simply getting this camera simply because I want a fancy camera but I do plan on taking photography courses at NYU and they sorta require fancy cameras haha :)


The Impact

I believe that having the ability to capture lifes moments will only further my creativity. It will most definitely affect my writing and therefore affect the message I give to people. I write poetry, like a lot of poetry and i think looking at life through a lens may directly inform the way my mind meets the paper.


I also think that everything and everyone is beautiful. Hopefully my photographs (and hey maybe films!) will capture that beauty and inspire others to see the way I do.


If this doesn't all work out I mean it will totally be fine. I am a firm believer that everything happens for a reason. But I would very much like this support because I most definitely cannot do it on my own. NYU pshh is hella expensive even with a scholarship so I can't do this alone. But I know the Lord will provide.


What We Need & What You Get

OK! So I am trying to raise $1,500.

The camera: I am not picky. But DSLR's usually range between 500-1000.


Hard drive: I want a 2tb hard drive because I take literally hundreds of photos and all of them are important, I would never want a silly thing like space to affect the amount of moments I could save.


Photoshop: There are so many different kinds! I will probably get the student one because I think that it will suit my needs and those that any photography classes may require.


IN RETURN FOR YOUR DONATIONS! 

You wil receive personalized bits of Amy Love! haha

You can see the perks off to the side!

 BELIEVE ME THEY'RE AWESOME! <3


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!


Use Facebook, twitter, email, anything!

Let's be serious we talk about the silliest things why not talk about me. hahaha!

story:
Press CC on youtube video then you'll get subtitle. 

Hello. My name is Gonchigsuren.

I am a photographer and this is my 40th year in Mongolian photography sector.

Now I am preparing my first exhibition that shows all my best photos of last 40 years.

My first album includes actions between 1975 till 2000, also it is the time changing political system Socialism to Democracy.

There is a requirement of HD film scanner for converting my film archive to printable photo. So I need your help for it. Thank you.


Here is my photo film archive. These films will be converted by a film scanner that you help to aid to me. Then I am gonna create photo album in HD quality.



Here are some of my scanned photos. Apologies for bad scanner. Please leave comment/subscribe.

I am gonna hardwork for creating great photo album if I reached this goal. 

Contribute me. Thank you :)

See more photos on my facebook

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000041...

story:
Dear friends and strangers,

 

Thank you for finding and taking time with this project. My name is Ieva Raudsepa and I’m an artist from Riga, Latvia, currently doing my MFA at California Institute of the Arts, based in Los Angeles. Together with Milda Books, a new publishing initiative focusing on artists from the Baltics, I want to publish my book Cruise.

 

Cruise

Cruise is a story about coming of age in which a ferry that goes between Riga and Stockholm becomes a metaphor for the transitional space between being a teenager and becoming an adult. Young people love it, as tickets are cheap and it's a good way to get away from their parents' sight and just let themselves go. The ferry provides all kinds of amusement—karaoke, an evening show with a flamboyant dance performance, gambling halls, a daily lottery, and a disco hall. ​The entertainment is sort of cliché and sometimes even absurd but, through its banality, the awkwardness of what it means to be human can appear.

 

Youth is a fleeting phenomenon that is both painful and beautiful, and so is the contrast between the trashy interior of the ferry juxtaposed with the beauty of the sea. Trips on the ferry evoke a sort of nostalgia for the present that will soon be past—the sea surrounding the party is magnificent, but it is also this vast nothingness, ready to just swallow us up.

 

The photobook and its production

I created a dummy for the project in 2016 which I designed, printed, and bound. The original book dummy was shortlisted for the Unseen Dummy Award in 2016, and since then has been included in group shows including Self Publish Riga (2017), Gazebook (2017), and Fotobok Gbg (2017). The project itself has been featured on i-D (2016) and YET (2016), and was part of the group show MIXTAPE, curated by Aaron Schuman, during the Riga Photomonth 2016.

 

MIXTAPE, curated by Aaron Schuman, Riga Photomonth 2016

While keeping up with the spirit of the original dummy, we will be working with designers Lea Michel and Christian Hofer to add content and refine the design to prepare it for a larger print edition. We're planning to start working on the design of the book in January 2019. The book will be printed and bound in June 2019 in Latvia, for an edition of 500 copies. The book launch in late June will coincide with a solo show at the ISSP Gallery in Riga which will feature new work that is an extension of the Cruise project.

Cruise, original dummy, 2016

 

Who we are

Ieva Raudsepa holds a BA in Philosophy from the University of Latvia and is currently a MFA candidate at California Institute of the Arts in Los Angeles. Her work has been exhibited internationally and featured in publications including i-D, YET, The Guardian, Wallpaper, It’s Nice That, Aint-Bad, and the Latvian Photography Yearbook. Cruise was shown at Riga Photomonth 2016, while the book dummy was shortlisted for the Unseen Dummy Award 2016 in Amsterdam. In Spring 2018, her work was part of Post-Soviet Visions: image and identity in the new Eastern Europe at the Calvert 22 Foundation in London.
www.ievaraudsepa.com

 

Lea Michel and Christian Hofer are graphic designers working in tandem and based in Switzerland and Germany. They hold Master's degrees from the Academy of Visual Art in Leipzig in the specialization of graphic design, and have worked for different design firms and artists. Lea and Christian have helped produce numerous print projects within their practice.  

 

Milda Books is a non-profit, non-commercial, Baltic-based publisher of documentary photographers, visual writers, artists, and poets from the CEE region, founded in 2017. Milda Books produces one to three new books each year by contemporary artists, and also focuses on authors from abroad who have made their work within the Baltic region.
www.mildabooks.com

 

Why do we need your support?

This campaign is a pre-sale of the book that will cover the production costs of the book (from the design of it to printing and binding it) and shipping. All of us have previous experience working with photography books, both on an artistic and production level (printing, binding, and distribution). We're confident that our combined knowledge and skills will result in a quality book. We have already worked with Green Print, a print house in Latvia offering high quality offset and digital printing, which will produce the book, and will be visiting festivals and book fairs to increase the visibility of the project after its launch.

We are planning for a production of 500 copies of the book. The main expenses are estimated at $6,600 on production, $3000 on shipping & packaging (we've included the cost of shipping within the pledge you make), $3000 on design. Indiegogo's platform fee on all funds raised is 5%. 

In addition to the pre-sale, I have made a series of Riso prints with some images from Cruise. Their sale will also contribute to covering the costs of production of the book. The prints are 28 x 43 cm (11 x 17 inches). They are based on sea landscapes from the project, and because of the two-color Riso printing, each of them is a unique piece. The prints will be shipped from Los Angeles within a 3 business days after purchase.

Share

We understand that it's not possible for everyone to donate, so we would really appreciate you sharing this campaign with your friends, family and through your social media. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

By contributing to our cause, you will be helping to make _____ is dead, our BFA thesis exhibition, a reality. The exhibiton will be held in Seigfred Gallery at Ohio University, April 9-13. Featured artists include Claire Cushing, Bo Hoffman, Nettie McGee, Carrie Mitchell, and Andrea Pierson. While each artist's work deals with a different subject, we have all focused on the central theme of death. in many cases, this is not a literal interpretation of death, but rather an effort to kill the previously held notions about the topic, and reinvent it. The subjects we work with range from an investigation of abandoned landscapes once inhabited by people, to the mask of masculinity and the true nature of male emotions, to a defamilarization of the body, to an exploration of the semiotics of sex and sexuality, and even a venture into morbidity with close look at death itself.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your contributions to our show will go to printing, framing, refreshments, posters, postcards advertising the show, and any other expenses we incur whilst trying to make this exhibition happen.
  • In return for your generosity, we would like to present you with incentives, created by the artists. The incentives and the levels of donation to which they correspond are further detailed below.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, we'd still love to have your help getting the word out. Tell everyone you know about this donation page and the show, and make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools.

We hope to see you there on April 9th at 6:00 p.m. for the opening!

story:
HELP JARED MOOSSY RECOVER

Jared is a renowned photojournalist and cinematographer who was critically injured by a drunk driver on September 3rd, 2015.


Jared needs extensive rehabilitation. You can get involved starting with $25 contributions. Over 50 photographers have donated limited edition and open edition prints to help Jared raise the funds in support of his recovery. Every dollar will go to Jared.


PHOTOGRAPHERS WHO HAVE DONATED PRINTS:

Adam Ferguson, Adriana Zehbrauskas, Alec Soth, Aline Smithson, Andrea Bruce, Ashley Gilbertson, Balazs Gardi, Ben Lowy, Blake Gordon, Brandon Thibodeaux, Brian Frank, Brinson Banks, Camille Seaman, Chiara Goia, David Alan Harvey, David Guttenfelder, Dominic Bracco, Eric Kayne, Erin Trieb, Eros Hoagland, Gareth Phillips, Melissa Golden, Janet Jarman, John F Peters, Justin Maxon, Katie Orlinsky, Kevin Miyazaki, Kristen Luce, Lance Rosenfield, Lexey Small, Liz Arenberg, Lynsey Addario, Maggie Steber, Matt Mahon, Matt Eich, Meg Griffith, Michael Christopher Brown, Michael Kirby Smith, Mustafah Abdulaziz, Peter DiCampo, Peter van Agtmael, Phillip Scott Andrews, Q Sakamaki, Robbie McClaran, Ron Haviv, Rush Jagoe, Scott Dalton, Ying Ang.

Find a full list of the 88 prints available in the gallery section (hyperlinked here)
Note that we are limited to showing 20 perks at a time. If you don't see the print you are looking for listed in the perks section on the right please contact us at jaredmoossyfund@gmail.com. 



JARED’S BIOGRAPHY

Jared has worked in war torn and impoverished countries. He has been widely published, and was Director of Photography on the HBO series Witness. While he is mostly known for his photography, he is a humanitarian first. An advocate for human rights at all cost. Jared has skillfully and creatively used his art of photography and cinematography to capture human suffering in its purest form. He has risked his life, time and time again, to tell stories. He has traveled the world, and through his evocative images given voice to people who have been silenced. It is important that he is recognized as a man who has strength of heart. A courageous man, a nonconformist who refuses to accept the status quo and takes risk for the greater good. He has witnessed the fragility of our existence in many contexts and now the reality of his own fragility is before him.


Please see Jared's work and reel at www.jaredmoossy.com.


WE NEED YOUR HELP

In the face of a difficult situation, we must remember the stories of the individuals. We must focus on these narratives to understand and appreciate the value of each and every human life. Jared is not merely a victim of a careless act. He is a fighter, and as his family we have a grave responsibility to tell his empowering story in way that will make him proud. We hope to shine a light on the terrible and destructive effects of Drunk Driving, and to encourage safer practices. The world needs more artists, more humanitarians, more Jared Moossy's, and less carelessness.


PRINT DETAILS

  • Every dollar raised will go to Jared

  • Please allow 2-4 weeks from the close of the campaign to receive your print.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can't contribute or can't contribute as much as these perks are listed for, and we completely understand. However, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends and help get the word out! See the updates for example copy for emails and Facebook.

  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to share on your social media!

  • Web site experience? Help update Jared's website.

  • Jared lives in Austin, Texas and will need daily assistance, do you have any time to spare?

If you can't afford the price of our perks please visit the Go Fund Me campaign and contribute any amount you can.

FEATURE PRINTS
PERK 15: Balazs Gardi - Print $1500


PERK 30: Peter DiCampo - Print $100



PERK 50: Michael Kirby Smith - Print $200


PERK 65: David Guttenfelder - Print $100


PERK 70: THANK YOU POSTCARD FROM JARED & BILLY- $25


PERK 71: Andrea Bruce - Print $100

PERK 81: Jared Moossy - Print $1000


PERK 82: Jared Moossy - Print $1000


PERK 85: Lianne Milton - Print $100


PERK 88: Erin Trieb - Print $250


PERK 91: Holly Pickett - Print $100


PERK 92: Daniel Berehulak - Print $100


PERK 94: Alex Masi - Print $100


PERK 96: Jennifer Pantaleon - Framed Print $600


PERK 97: Lisa Krantz - Print $100


PERK 98: Sim Chi Yin - Print $100


PERK 99: Amber Maitland Hamilton - Print $100


PERK 100: Melanie Burford - Print $100


PERK 101: Jessica Lutz - Print $100

story:
OUR STORY: Once again college is going to be starting up. I am starting my first year of school, and with that all of my money saved is going towards other school supplies. But, there is one thing that is still a necessity for school that I have to earn money for, a digital camera. I am going to be studying photography and the arts thereof. Without the camera, this can't be done. I am asking for your help so that i can begin my life career.

THE IMPACT: Providing I get the help to get the camera, I will also help others. Not only will I use the camera for schooling, but to help those in need. For example, many people out there need and want portfolios of pictures for things, but can't afford it. I want to make it cheap and easy for people to get what they want and not charge them all of their money like others will.

WHERE IT GOES: I have estimated a need of $2,900. All of this money will be going towards my camera as well as what I have saved. $2,300- Canon camera $350- Different lenses of different mm. $250- Stand and spare batteries and memory cards for the camera If the whole amount is not reached, I will continue to raise and save money on my own for the same things and the same reason. The smallest contribution helps and any share of word is great and very much appreciated.

story:
Abba..Zappa Seventies Rock Photography: The App

We have The Book. Now we need your help to produce The App. 

All 300 black and white photographs of seventies rock artists from the book, now in an app. Including anecdotes, stories and descriptions. You will be taken on an unforgettable journey back in time by this rare compilation of pictures: seventies rock photography as you have never seen it before.

The seventies

The seventies. Hectic, exciting, creative. Constantly reinventing itself, full of self-confidence. Sometimes tiresome, but never for long. I am Gijsbert Hanekroot and I was there. As a photographer mainly, but also as a restless young man and a music lover.

Together with designer Sybren Kuiper, I selected almost 300 black and white photographs from my collection. Sybren has made a unique design for the book, beautifully printed in duo tone. Interested in both The Book and The App? Have a look at the perks!

 

 

Some reviews

Two years ago the pop photographer-on-a-timeout, Gijsbert Hanekroot (1945), turned up on SYB Design's doorstep with two plastig bags full to the brim with photos; vintage prints..  read more

Let us know your platform!

When choosing to pre-order The App please let us know the platform of your tablet. iOS (Apple), Android, Android-Amazon or Android-NOOK.

The perks

Pre-order The App plus The Book, a $64 value (Amazon) for the book alone.

 

 

Or go for The App, The Book and a print of Mick Jagger, London 1977. Limited print 10x12inch (25x30cm) signed by me.

 

 

 

 

Pre-order The App plus The Book plus a vintage print of Leonard Cohen (1972), Patti Smith (1976), Bryan Ferry and Jerry Hall (1976), Lou Reed (1972), Robbie van Leeuwen (who wrote Venus - Shocking Blue) (1976) or Frank Zappa (1971).

 

 

Pre-order The App plus The Book plus the vintage print of Neil Young as used on his Tonight's The Night album (1973).

 

The team 

Gijsbert Hanekroot (Gilbert) started his career as a photographer of rock musicians in the late sixties. He stopped being a professional photographer in 1983 and became an entrepreneur. He owned a publishing house and a webshop for computers and digital cameras. While working on his book and exhibitions, Abba...Zappa Seventies Rock Photography (published in 2008), he felt that he wanted to be a photographer again. He began again by traveling and shooting his way through India, China, Eastern Europe and North and South America.
gijsberthanekroot.nl


Mette van der Linden

Mette is a freelance video production professional based. in Amsterdam. After being educated at the College of Haarlem where he graduated as Bachelor in Media Entertainment Management he worked as project manager at a cross media company where he expand his experience of camera’s and editing software. In 2010 Mette started a video production company known as MOC Video.
mocvideo.tv

Ronald Klip

Web developer and mobile app builder. Putting content first. contentecontent.com

Award winning Dutch designer Sybren Kuiper (-SYB-).
sybontwerp.nl

Ian Transui

I am a photographer, voice talent, blogger, traveller and occasional musician originally hailing from the “Deep South” of the US who decided long ago to take up residency in Central Europe so as to further my goal of being a “jack of all trades”.
wonkypaw.com

What We Need & What You Get

We will spend the money

  • to pay the designer and programmer of the App (iPad and Android) 
  • to pay for the prints
  • to produce the clip
  • to pay Indiegogo and Paypal
  • for distribution

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, the BEST way you can help is to spread the word by sharing this on Facebook, Twitter, or good old fashioned email. 

And please feel free to connect with me on Facebook or email me if you have any questions or special requests.

The seventies
The seventies. Hectic, exciting, creative. Constantly reinventing itself, full of self-confidence. Sometimes tiresome, but never for long. I am Gijsbert Hanekroot and I was there. As a photographer mainly, but also as a restless young man and a music lover.
Together with designer Sybren Kuiper, I selected almost 300 black and white photographs from my collection. Sybren has made a unique design for the book, beautifully printed in duo tone. Interested in both The Book and The App? Have a look at the perks!
 

 
Some reviews
Two years ago the pop photographer-on-a-timeout, Gijsbert Hanekroot (1945), turned up on SYB Design's doorstep with two plastig bags full to the brim with photos; vintage prints..  read more

Let us know your platform!
When choosing to pre-order The App please let us know the platform of your tablet. iOS (Apple), Android, Android-Amazon or Android-NOOK.
The perks

Pre-order The App plus The Book, a $64 value (Amazon) for the book alone.
 

 
Or go for The App, The Book and a print of Mick Jagger, London 1977. Limited print 10x12inch (25x30cm) signed by me.
 

 

 

 
Pre-order The App plus The Book plus a vintage print of Leonard Cohen (1972), Patti Smith (1976), Bryan Ferry and Jerry Hall (1976), Lou Reed (1972), Robbie van Leeuwen (who wrote Venus - Shocking Blue) (1976) or Frank Zappa (1971).
 


 
Pre-order The App plus The Book plus the vintage print of Neil Young as used on his Tonight's The Night album (1973).
 
The team 

Gijsbert Hanekroot (Gilbert) started his career as a photographer of rock musicians in the late sixties. He stopped being a professional photographer in 1983 and became an entrepreneur. He owned a publishing house and a webshop for computers and digital cameras. While working on his book and exhibitions, Abba...Zappa Seventies Rock Photography (published in 2008), he felt that he wanted to be a photographer again. He began again by traveling and shooting his way through India, China, Eastern Europe and North and South America. gijsberthanekroot.nl

Mette van der Linden
Mette is a freelance video production professional based. in Amsterdam. After being educated at the College of Haarlem where he graduated as Bachelor in Media Entertainment Management he worked as project manager at a cross media company where he expand his experience of camera’s and editing software. In 2010 Mette started a video production company known as MOC Video. mocvideo.tv

Ronald Klip
Web developer and mobile app builder. Putting content first. contentecontent.com

Award winning Dutch designer Sybren Kuiper (-SYB-). sybontwerp.nl

Ian Transui
I am a photographer, voice talent, blogger, traveller and occasional musician originally hailing from the “Deep South” of the US who decided long ago to take up residency in Central Europe so as to further my goal of being a “jack of all trades”. wonkypaw.com
What We Need & What You Get
We will spend the money

to pay the designer and programmer of the App (iPad and Android) 
to pay for the prints
to produce the clip
to pay Indiegogo and Paypal
for distribution


Other Ways You Can Help


Remember, the BEST way you can help is to spread the word by sharing this on Facebook, Twitter, or good old fashioned email. 
And please feel free to connect with me on Facebook or email me if you have any questions or special requests.

story:
Hello friends..

                        As some of you might know, My Visa extension application has been denied and I have appealed against the decision. If you have appealed on time, your previous visa terms extend while decision is pending (including right to work) but it has become difficult to get work as employers want to see a current visa and passport and My passport is with home office. 

As for the whole process, the appeal fees is 150£ and the lawyers charge 800£, and I need to give them 400£ in advance as soon as possible for them to start doing my paperwork. My hearing date is set on Nov 10th and If I lose the appeal, I would have to return home. 

Glasgow is where I have lived since 2009, a city which shaped my life and gave breath to my dreams and I have worked my best to contribute to the vibrant cultural life of Glasgow.I worked in clubs  and saved to do events under Reverb (www.facebook.com/reverbglasgow) where I did my best to bring together DJ's ,musicians, performers and other artists, played with Kasper in various venues, took part in many fashion shows and photo shoots for student and upcoming designers and now I am trying my best to make photographs.I have worked relentlessly for the last 5 years to be able to do what I am doing and my life, dreams and hopes are here and this is where I want to live and where I feel home.

I would really appreciate any help now matter how small.

Thanks in advance.

story:
The Plot:

My name is Andrew Wong.
A mere boy of twenty summers who just graduated with a Diploma in Early Childhood Education.
On passion-fueled days, i take my Canon 650D DSLR camera and take photos during the "golden hour" and on other days, i gym, i play basketball and i fish.

Funny story about that DSLR i own, it will forever remain a marked chapter in my life.

It was 2010 if i recall correctly, i got my "O" level certification and hence, it was time to move on to polytechnic(Diploma).
Here in Singapore, we are given the privilege of twelve choices of course to enroll in. From engineering to culinary, literally hundreds and dozens of courses your "O" level score could get you.

But what, where and how would a teen of 17 or 18, at that age, come to choose a course that would no lesser, come to define who he or she would be in 4 years time?
I was in that crowd. 
No, i was not that kid who always owned a stethoscope and had a natural-born immunity for blood and wanted to a doctor for the rest of his life.
I was clueless.
I was just that fat kid who was deeply infatuated with The Lord of the Rings, The Fellowship of the Ring, when it came in 2001. There, something about movies sparked inside of me.

But i knew, that i've always wanted to be somewhere in the media and arts line.
Writing, narrating, filming, singing.
Basically being a person who would express oneself only for the benefit of him and him alone, while the only perks were if others liked it.


So i applied for Mass Communication, despite be 2 points short of its cut-off point.
They called me in for an interview. So i went.
There was i, dressed more or less appropriately.
Across from me in the waiting room, was a dude, probably same aged, but i see he was carrying a portfolio, and god was it humongous. Whilst naive me, was there with nothing.
And there WAS nothing, i could show, do or say that would sell myself to the teachers interviewing me. Nothing but dreams.

So duh, i was rejected and got in the the 9th of my 12 choices, that being Early Childhood Education.
So i stick by it. Hoping to change my route for university.
But damn did year 1 suck. 
Ironically, the media faculty and the humanities faculty shared the same building. So i passed by everyday, knowing i could've been there. but here i am.



Yes, i love kids, but i've always felt that, i wouldnt teach,care and love a child, the same i would mine. So it was never meant for me.
With my interest at an all time low, i became an insomniac. Dreading to wake up every morning.

Those nights would soon come to define me. I started watching Youtube videos on my Ipad, 
I never knew the technology of cameras had reached a level of quality something to similar to the movies.
I could have the ability to tell stories, relate to people, express myself for the simple cost of something as saddening as money.




Im not gonna lie. I am from a relatively well-off family. I have both my dad and mom. Both of em are working. A pride of the family sister and a lovable autistic brother.
However, my parents didnt really support the idea. But i don't blame them. I never will.
So i started saving money from my allowance, only spending it when required to.
Last nights dinner would be tomorrow's lunch. This worked well, cause i had lost a relatively large amount of weight, and had a phobia of putting it back on.

So a few months later, i got my 650d all on my own for 1400SGD.
But as i understand more about DSLRs, watch more youtube tutorials, read more articles, i understand that in this industry, equipment really plays a huge role for quality.
More was always on my mind.


So here i am. A flight bound to Bangkok to backpack South-East Asia for 1-2 months worth before the dreaded National Service.
The last period of free time before my life takes on university and work.
I've been working as a waiter, waiting part-time to fund my backpacking trip. Never in my 20 years of existence would i thought i would find myself hands-deep, clearing tables, and cleaning utensils. Something i'd never thought i'd do. But like love, its amazing how your dreams have a way of making you do stupid things for it. 

My biggest regret would be that my camera and lens would not do the places that i visit and the people that i meet, justice.


A picture really defines that moment for a person. Amazing how something so minor in the past, could lead two people to interact at this very place, at this very part of the world.

So i need your awesome help!

The Cost:

I am looking at the Canon 6D kit II (EF 24-70 f4L IS USM) which is a much cheaper alternative than the Canon 5D Mk III.

According to http://www.clubsnap.com/forums/showthread.php?t=931506&page=7

A 6D(Body) at a popular local camera store is $2299SGD

According to Ebay http://www.ebay.com/itm/NEW-Canon-EOS-6D-Body-24-70mm-20-2MP-Digital-SLR-with-1-Year-Warranty-/360676523841?pt=Digital_Cameras&hash=item53f9feff41

A 6D Kit II, shipped from Hong Kong is $2492USD

So of course, with continual research and asking for quotes, as well as the local IT fair this coming late may/early june. My camera with its lens would be the vicinity of at LEAST $2000SGD.

My passion has already driven me to fight a few more days and now im a proud owner of a Manfrotto Tripod($140SGD), a Nano Flycam ($100SGD), two 16GD SD Memory cards and thank the school for providing all students with free Adobe Software.


Here is where my life in Photography has brought me so far:
www.fatdonut.smugmug.com
(I'm using a trial account, if my indiegogo campaign gets on track, i might just purchase a month's worth of an account for my pictures.)


Basically it's my work of what beauty i find in that of Singapore.
Unfortunately, it does not have many people inside because I've always preferred the company of nature and animals than that of monsters and men but i intend to change that when i meet people along the way during my backpacking trip!

The Impact:

I am actually a wee bit more towards film than photography. But knowing film cost 3X as much as photography, i think i'll start off small and still headed in a similar direction.

I'm still learning. I am not a successful and experienced photographer. I'm a mere boy taking a shot at his dreams.
But if you love my work, I will be more than glad to be apart of yours or anything in my way to make yours a better day.


To be honest, its my first time doing an indiegogo campaign. I'm not very sure what people want of me as perks of helping fulfill a large part of my life. 
I personally think a heart-warm hand-written message from the hands you've helped to click the shutter from a new camera would be a great deal for me to show my appreciation. However, if theres anything about what you've learnt from me and my story that would be a benefit for you, please let me know.

If this campaign is successful, it goes far beyond a single trip of backpacking. Expect to see more from me as i plan to do more film and photography projects in the future. Being in the humanities, i can definitely see my photos and films having a positive effect for different campaigns and initiatives.
To help spread the message, or set a tone with a picture could be so meaningful for others.

Succeeding in this campaign would also grant me a step closer in finding out with what i would like to do with my life.
Come university, I am still not definite on my route that would come define my adult life.

Like many others being funded on indiegogo, I too have dreams of producing a short film which tells a story. Be it romance or horror, we all have a story in head to share with the world.
A proper camera capable of producing the quality of work in harsh environments such as low-lighting would definitely give me the platform to begin work on this dream.


Having a more decent camera for work, experiences and play around and help me understand more into this field. 
What i do know is this. Telling a story through film or a picture is something I genuinely love.


To know that you were apart of someone's dream.
I couldn't describe the profundity of that sentence.

If this venture is successful, the excess amount of money will be used to be donated to the various individuals i meet that help me along my journey through South-East Asia, all of which will be documented on that new Camera.

Also, being new to the backpacker scene, I've done countless research online to make sure my travels through the different countries would be rather safe and smooth. 
But you can't really find many blogs online that go into detail about the journeys and the people they meet. Basically, the minor aspects of what happened.

So for similar people in my position, you'll get to join me in my journey as i scour and account the different events that will help you visualize and understand the route you're about to take as i share my experiences with ya'll online on a blog!


Other Ways You Can Help:

To be honest, to even read my story would be a nice gesture already. Its not everyday I can squeeze emotions into a post. So thank you for taking time to read it.

If you find my story relatable or inspiring or whatnot.
Please share it with your friends, family and someone who was just like me.
Share this on Social Media websites like Facebook or Twitter or Instagram!
#FundFatdonut on instagram!
Sadly, I do not own a Twitter account 

Indiegogo reminded me to remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About me

I am a photographer from the Netherlands, graduated from the Acadamy of Arts in 1997, being a documentary photographer since then. Capturing life of minorities and subcultures with a special interest in Roma and Sinti.

Since 2005 i visit  and photograph life of the Romani people in Europe on a very regular base. Every minute amongst Roma i am surprised by their behavior, humor, rythm and passion.

This largest minority of Europe ( 10 to 12 million ) lives a remarkable life. Centuries ago they migrated from Punjab and Radjastan toward the West. Beartamers, storytellers, tinmakers and horsetraders lived a tough life. Strangely enough, in 2013 it still is.

I would like to achieve more awareness of the unique situation of Roma all over the world. By means of photography i give a personal image of life of this amazing minority without a king or a president, with no land and no borders. But with pride, religion, tradition and lots of humor. By creating a photobook and exhibiting the works i intend to built awareness for the life of Roma and Sinti.

 

The book

The photobook shows 200 photo's and tells 10 personal stories.

To get the book designed,printed and internationally published I need 22000 euro. In return I will offer you artist's prints of wonderful people,  beautiful photo's, a signed book of course. A photoshoot when you live in Europe or when able to visit the Netherlands. Or i will visit you in your country and we make a good and creative deal.

If i do not reach the entire goal the funds will go to Roma villages where i will give photography lessons at Roma schools and create workshops with creative collegues. I realised these projects before  and the Roma children as well as their parents were very excited about the projects.

 

Important: For Dutch people i get my book crowdfunded as well and at thjis very moment (july 25) i received almost 10.000 euro!

Wanna have a look? Feel free. it's in Dutch though.

http://www.voordekunst.nl/vdk/project/view/1377-roma-travelogue

 

Network

Will you please share this message and introduce me into your network?

Please visit my website and enjoy my work.

Peter van Beek

www.petervanbeek.com

story:
Our Story

 

My name is Julayne Farmer. I am a graduate of the San Francisco Art Institute in California and I am initiating a program called Follow Your Art. This is a participatory photographic program which provides visual literacy instruction to under-served children around the world. It is my belief that teaching photographic technique and creative writing to these children will help them identify, represent, and enhance their health, communities, and lives. This program will provide the tools that foster self-awareness, conscience, independent thinking, and creative imagination. By encouraging the children to be surveyors of their communities and world, I am also encouraging them to take a journey inward, toward self-discovery as authors and artists of their own life stories. The articulate voices produced from this work will give these individuals new vision, new possibilities, a wider range of life choices, ways to respond to life and to change the world. Please see more about Follow Your Art's previous initiatives at our website:  http://www.photo-literacy.com. In addition to raising funding for the project on Indiegogo, I am also selling prints of both my own work and the children's work at http://www.bluemelon.com/julayne81. 88% of the money raised from the selling of these prints will go to benefit the Follow Your Art initiative in Nepal and Northern India (as "bluemelon.com" procures 12% for hosting the images on their website).

 

 

The Impact

With Follow Your Art, I hope to set into affect positive social change through providing photographic tools and training to the children in these communities. The program will provide a stage for these participating groups to both exhibit and market their work and to motivate change in their communities and around the world. Through my past personal experiences in working with these children across the globe, the real consequence of not having a program like this one is that many of the children in these under-served countries are never shown a way to give voice to their concerns, dreams and hopes for the future. This program gives the youth - especially those who feel silenced by their elders, their religion, their culture, etc. - a unique voice through which to initiate and activate change.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have raised money, in the past, for two Follow Your Art program initiatives: The first one was at a not for profit children's hospital in Siem Reap, Cambodia in 2006. The second initiative was in a remote primary/secondary school in Shey village, Ladakh, India in 2009. I needed money to implement this program into these facilities and I am again in need of money to fund this next venture into both a school in northern India and in a children's orphanage in Nepal by October 2012. By donating to this cause, you will be helping to offset the costs of travel expenses and creative materials. I am trying to raise $4,000 to help lay the foundation for this particular project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this on to anyone who might have even the slightest interest in youth empowerment, international cultures, childhood education, Nepal, India, art, photography, or even me, Julayne Farmer.  "Like" the project on Facebook and share with as many people as possible. It's important that we get this done and I can't do it without you!

This is a participatory photographic program which provides visual literacy instruction to under-served children around the world. It is my belief that teaching photographic technique and creative writing to these children will help them identify, represent, and enhance their health, communities, and lives. This program will provide the tools that foster self-awareness, conscience, independent thinking, and creative imagination. By encouraging the children to be surveyors of their communities and world, I am also encouraging them to take a journey inward, toward self-discovery as authors and artists of their own life stories. The articulate voices produced from this work will give these individuals new vision, new possibilities, a wider range of life choices, ways to respond to life and to change the world. Please see more about Follow Your Art's previous initiatives at our website:  http://www.photo-literacy.com. In addition to raising funding for the project on Indiegogo, I am also selling prints of both my own work and the children's work at http://www.bluemelon.com/julayne81. 88% of the money raised from the selling of these prints will go to benefit the Follow Your Art initiative in Nepal and Northern India (as "bluemelon.com" procures 12% for hosting the images on their website).
 
 


The Impact
With Follow Your Art, I hope to set into affect positive social change through providing photographic tools and training to the children in these communities. The program will provide a stage for these participating groups to both exhibit and market their work and to motivate change in their communities and around the world. Through my past personal experiences in working with these children across the globe, the real consequence of not having a program like this one is that many of the children in these under-served countries are never shown a way to give voice to their concerns, dreams and hopes for the future. This program gives the youth - especially those who feel silenced by their elders, their religion, their culture, etc. - a unique voice through which to initiate and activate change.
 


What We Need & What You Get
I have raised money, in the past, for two Follow Your Art program initiatives: The first one was at a not for profit children's hospital in Siem Reap, Cambodia in 2006. The second initiative was in a remote primary/secondary school in Shey village, Ladakh, India in 2009. I needed money to implement this program into these facilities and I am again in need of money to fund this next venture into both a school in northern India and in a children's orphanage in Nepal by October 2012. By donating to this cause, you will be helping to offset the costs of travel expenses and creative materials. I am trying to raise $4,000 to help lay the foundation for this particular project.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please pass this on to anyone who might have even the slightest interest in youth empowerment, international cultures, childhood education, Nepal, India, art, photography, or even me, Julayne Farmer.  "Like" the project on Facebook and share with as many people as possible. It's important that we get this done and I can't do it without you!

story:
Who is Jack Rosen?

New Hope, PA photographer Jack Rosen (1923 - 2006) is considered by many to be one of the best "unknown" photographers of the second half of the twentieth century. Acclaimed primarily for his photos of New Hope and Bucks County, PA, Jack also was an outstanding photographer of celebrities, and his humorous yet telling editorial photos reveal his sense of justice, while appealing to our higher sense of ourselves.

Jack referred to himself as "New Hope's oldest streetwalker", and could usually be spotted somewhere in town wearing at least two cameras, shooting all the things many of us walked right past but that Jack saw and captured. His body of work is a record of our lives for the period from the late 1950s to the early 2000s, and includes extensive documentation of Bucks County, New Hope, and the early Levittown years.

The Jack Rosen Photo Challenge

By the time of his passing in 2006, Jack's body of work had grown to well over 500,000 raw 35mm. b&w negatives and thousands of color slides. The collection is now in storage under the control of Jack's son Rick, and is only very minimally cataloged. The ultimate challenge is to digitize and catalog all of the negatives and slides, so that the full content of the collection can be ascertained and a complete database of Jack Rosen photographs be made available for a variety of purposes. We are now ready to respond to this challenge.

The Project

We are seeking $5,000 in funding for the necessary equipment (computer, scanner, storage, printer, peripherals) to begin the process of at first selectively and then ultimately fully digitizing and catalog the entire Jack Rosen body of work. Funding for perks shipping costs is also included in this amount.

Your contributions to the project will be rewarded with a collection of Jack Rosen-related perks. Perks include Jack Rosen prints, mugs, T-shirts, and signed items!

Project results will be marketed through a variety of outlets including, but not limited to:
    a. Local retail outlet photo sales
    b. Local /regional community organization relationships (media, historical societies, chambers of commerce, etc.)
    c. Exploration of licensing, stock photo, etc. agreements
    d. Online photo direct sales
    e. Fine Arts America - retail sales of photo-imprinted products (fineartsamerica.com)
    f. Etsy - retail sales of photos (www.etsy.com)

The Request

Those who are familiar with Jack's work know that he was a gifted photographer with a unique photographic eye & style. Jack's work truly touches and reaches us. Please take a look at the video presentation which includes a selection from this great body of work, please give a few moment's thought to the thousands and thousands and thousands of Jack Rosen images waiting to be rediscovered, and please help us to get things rolling by supporting this project,

story: Hi, we are two middle school students from Tucson, Arizona. We have amazing field trips all year, and we have a lot of fun on them. Unfortunately, these field trips cost money, just like everything else these days. We need to raise money for a leadership camp run by a partner of Free the Children, an athletics camp, a community service week, a drama week and many more. We both need to raise $250 dollars to contribute to these trips. If we cannot meet this goal, we will not be able to have these field trips. So we are turning to you to help us. We will be selling various products that all have a randomly selected picture of Tucson and its beautiful culture (we took these pictures, of course). Thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

An app made by photographers for photographers. Imagine this you make pictures with your smartphone, easily prepare them for selling and upload with a push of a button to all best selling agencies on the web. You don't need to be professional photographer to be part of a 2 billion dollars industry!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will go to app & back-end development. Development started already but we need a bust of funds to finish it faster! Even if the goal is not reached, the funding will speed-up the process and bring it quicker to live. In app purchases will allow us later to start Android app, web app and Photoshop/Lightroom plugin.

Everyone who contributes with 5 euro or more will receive a free digital copy of the "Successful Mobile Stock Photography" practical guide. All you need to know about shooting, editing, uploading and promoting your portfolio. You don't need to be a pro to make money in this $2 Bn industry.


    The Impact

    We want to change how selling pictures works right now. Photographers professional or amateurs should earn more from their images with less time spending on agencies websites. Currently, they are limited in submitting pictures to a few agencies because of time needed to for each of them. Pixendr will change this!

    Risks & Challenges

    In the beginning, big players in microstock photography will probably be reluctant in allowing users to finish submission from a different app than their websites or apps. We will try to accomplish that. Submission will still be possible anyway.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't financially contribute, share this project with your friends. How many of them are already making good pictures with their smartphones?

      Thank you!
