story:
Our Story

 My name is Victor Salvo. This is the story of how I became involved with The Macombre Christian Academy in Macombre, Haiti.

 

 It started in the October of 2010. I went to a TEDx event at The Marine Biological Laboratory in Woods Hole on Cape Cod. There, amongst all the distinguished speakers, was the scientist William Mebane talking about fish farming in Haiti. In appreciation for his talk I sent Bill a photo I had taken of salmon farming in New Brunswick, Canada.

 

 As things would have it, the day he emailed a thank you to me I was in Florida talking with two strangers that I had met at an outdoor concert (after they had grabbed me to lead their conga line at the Naples Botanical Garden). They had just returned from their home in Haiti where they had hosted the very same Mr. Mebane. And so I met Rick and Kathy Land who own a flat above the administrative building at the Macombre Christian Academy. Or what was the Academy prior to The Earthquake.

 

 The Macombre Christian Academy is situated just outside of Leogane, a poor, rural town twenty miles west of Port-Au-Prince, facing the bay. The Academy is the pride of the community, educating 800 children from preschool through the  senior year of high school. Founder and educator Obinson Joseph started the Academy ten years ago after seeing a need for a better school in the largely agricultural area. His school soon became the best known and respected center of education in the Leogane Plain.

 

 When the earthquake hit there were only Mr. Joseph and one employee in the building; thankfully, both survived. Within days the community came with steel bars and hammers (and even rocks) and began breaking down the huge cement walls and ceilings of the former two story building. Eventually, through local and international volunteers the land was cleared and a committment to rebuild was begun.

 

 Using a blueprint provided by the University of Florida's College of Design, Construction and Planning an astonishing amount of reconstruction has since occured. The Evangelical Free Church of America swept in while I was there and built the forms for supporting the large, cracked cistern high up on fractured cement legs. Nonetheless, the kitchen, the cafeteria/meeting hall and the building for the older students, those who will be first to graduate from the Academy, have yet to be built.

  


The Impact

 Haiti is the poorest nation in the Western Hemisphere. When I went there to work I was told, "Do not get hurt - there is no 911." This country is in dire need of infrastructure, and education of the young is key to achieving that goal. Educating the nation's youth will create future leaders capable of moving their country forward in it's quest to modernize and stabilize. In essence, your contribution will help Haiti help itself.

 

 Your contribution to tOUCH hAITI will enable me to return to Haiti to create a photography book documenting the progress of the effort to rebuild the Macombre Christian Academy. The book will help spread awareness of the plight of the Haitian people as well as the importance of the school to the region. My intent is for the book to generate contributions to the rebuilding effort. By generating interest in the school and its reconstruction, I am looking to have my photographic art pave the way to A STABLE NATION.

 


Update August 24

 

The Vermont Center for Photography has linked to this site.

 

UPDATE August 10th

 

 Correction: I had previously reported that the TEDx event was held at the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute. It was actually at The Marine Biological Laboratory in Woods Hole.

 

 

Update June 25th, 2011 & What We Need & What You Get

 Obinson Joseph writes,

 

 "The roof is not on, the metal is not released yet. We're still working on it. The field is so muddy we had to anticipate the closing for young students yesterday (June 24) while the older ones will continue on until mid July. I had a talk with the head of the public school that hosts the older students about the possibility of using the place again in September, he is very skeptical because the government is planning a permanent building just to meet their need for 6 rooms. I am a bit concerned.

Except for the new 3 rooms tent, there is no future use for the tents. They are completely deteriorated."

 

 The ultimate goal would to be complete the school - $30,000 for the kitchen and cafeteria and $70,000 for the high school. That being said, I have set an initial fundraising goal of $12,000 to create the photographic art book as well as seed money for building supplies. The first quarter will fund my return to Haiti, half will go toward the production of the book, and the rest will purchase building supplies.

 

   There is no limit for you getting your reward. My first trip produced some 3900 images with about 125 or so in the keeper range meaning that you will be compensated with photographs even if the funding falls short of hopes.

As of this posting your rewards will be books I will self publish through Blurb. My prototype came out just fantastic - nice paper, excellent tonal quality, and the ability to adjust the size and page number to suite your budget.


Other Ways You Can Help

 

For information on Macombre, Haiti and the good people I have met, please visit the following sites:

 www.creatinghopeinhaiti.com

 www.efca.org

story:
About this project

Damascus steel, Antikythera mechanism, data from Apollo and Gemini missions spacecrafts, mummification, Stradivarius' violin, Roman concrete, Greek fire, aunt Berta's Vorschmack recipe… civilization lost probably forever so many technologies and we can’t feel nothing but sincere regrets about it.  Photography is not an exception. It seems that the knowledge is still here, that it’s not too late… but people are passing away, old books and magazines are going to a dumpster, and we are chasing a number of megapixels… 

We still can buy some analog photography chemicals but it looks like in a few years we will be able to use only 3 most popular premixed developers which we are going to order online. But fortunately some people out there are interested to study photography in-depth. People who do not balk at anything and who are ready to spend time and money for the benefit of the craft. 

An analog photographer is like a medieval alchemist in a search for the Philosopher’s Stone to turn things into the gold – beautiful photo prints. Photographic Alchemy is an exercise in controlled chaos and a study in the science of art. By breaking down silver salts and celluloid to their elemental form, we are creating new reflections of our world. Sometimes dark and gritty and sometimes bright and soft. World seems to be emerging and dissolving right before our eyes. Toxic and fascinating, each new roll of film leaves us intrigued. And we just can’t wait to try the next substance on this ever increasing list.

 It’s always out there - something we don’t know, something new to discover… It’s highly unlikely that one person will be able to use all formulas from this book during one lifetime. But it’s not the goal. We hope this publication will help you put your best foot forward, that every reader can find here many formulas to achieve their creative goals in photography.

What we want to make

A nice comprehensive formulary today is a rare find. We have to hunt them down in antique stores and eBay. And some can be found only in archives or libraries. We decided to create the fullest and the most comprehensive book in the last two hundred years with all the formulas for photo chemicals. We want to bring back to life all forgotten recipes and formulas in one book. Today analog photography is going through the resurging phase and such book can become the biggest aid for anybody who is looking to create unique “authentic” prints.

The book will include all the recipes for film developers, photo paper developers, fixers and toners. 
Classic process of the following companies: Ansco, Dassonville, Defender, Du Pont, Kodak, Haloid, Agfa, Ilford and others . 

In addition, there will be alternative processes such as: 
Albertype - a picture printed from a kind of gelatine plate produced by means of a photographic negative bromoil process, an early twentieth century process which begins with a silver bromide print and ends with an oily or inked print of alluring elegance; 
Calotype - the first process to utilize sodium thiosulfate as a permanent fixer for the image;
Cyanotype, also known as a blueprint, that is considered among the easiest of all the historical methods;
And other methods like vesicular process, heliotype, daguerreotype, calvar process, collodion process, and artotype. 

Another unique section of the book is the Recipes from beyond the Iron Curtain. During the time when the East and the West were separated by political differences, both sides were developing some photography techniques in their own unique ways. Have a look at the formulas that were not accessible for decades.

This book preserves very extensive information about all kind of photographic chemical formulas from the passed centuries and is currently work in progress. We have already the material for more than 300 pages and continue to add the information every day. We believe at the end it may be 500+ pages.

Book Highlights:

Design: Durable / resilient material for prolonged use in darkroom-like environment 

Cover style: Hard Cover

Cover finish: Gloss Cover Finish 

Binding: Adhesive Case Wrap 

Paper: 50lb Natural 500PPI 92 Opacity / Black & White Headbands

Volume: More than 300 pages of unique and useful information – 1000s of formulas. 

Publisher: Unicorn publishing USA; First edition (July 2017) 

Language: English

Trim Size: 6"x 9"inches 

 Design

This book is intended to be used in the darkrooms, so we made it extra-durable. The cardboard cover is sturdy and strong. The white paper is of excellent quality. The 6x8 inches size makes it easy to carry the book around.

 A word of caution

When you submerge yourself into wonderful ocean of analog photography we urge you to use extra caution when apply the knowledge from this book. Wasted film or chemicals will be least of your worries. The components of some formulas may be corrosive, toxic or produce thermal chemical reaction or cause chemical burns. Read carefully MSDS for each ingredient of each formula! Treat every solution appropriately! Always follow safety guidelines and use recommended protective gear!

Before you start mixing your first self-made developer we recommend that you practice with premixed chemicals carefully prepared for you by professionals. After some time you would like to try something more sophisticated than classic D-76 from a nearest photography store. And that will be the time when you take this book from your shelf. And if you are already an expert you will find your favorite formulas and a lot of new ones in this book - all in one place.

This book is not for absolute beginners, it’s not a textbook, and it doesn’t cover school chemistry basics. Readers are advised to familiarize themselves with basics of photography.

If you are just approaching this fascinating universe and have never burned your favorite shirt with potassium permanganate and sulfuric acid solution support this book for your future experiments because very soon it will become a collectible item.

About us

We are more photographers than publishers (in spite the fact, that one of us has a degree in publishing). We already have more than one idea for photography books and we decided to join our forces as an artist co-op if you will to bring this and other projects to life. 

The analog photography was a part of our lives for about 40 years combined. We learned from the best and gathered formulas from very old books (the oldest one goes back to 1866), magazines, and handwritten notes of real professionals. We shared photography secrets at the art events, workshops, and just friends’ gatherings. We collected a huge amount of useful and helpful information. And now we would be happy to share it with you. It’s time to join forces, to preserve this unique knowledge for our fellow photographers today and those in the future.

Book Highlights:
Design: Durable / resilient material for prolonged use in darkroom-like environment 
Cover style: Hard Cover
Cover finish: Gloss Cover Finish 
Binding: Adhesive Case Wrap 
Paper: 50lb Natural 500PPI 92 Opacity / Black & White Headbands
Volume: More than 300 pages of unique and useful information – 1000s of formulas. 
Publisher: Unicorn publishing USA; First edition (July 2017) 
Language: English
Trim Size: 6"x 9"inches 

 Design
This book is intended to be used in the darkrooms, so we made it extra-durable. The cardboard cover is sturdy and strong. The white paper is of excellent quality. The 6x8 inches size makes it easy to carry the book around.
 A word of caution
When you submerge yourself into wonderful ocean of analog photography we urge you to use extra caution when apply the knowledge from this book. Wasted film or chemicals will be least of your worries. The components of some formulas may be corrosive, toxic or produce thermal chemical reaction or cause chemical burns. Read carefully MSDS for each ingredient of each formula! Treat every solution appropriately! Always follow safety guidelines and use recommended protective gear!

Before you start mixing your first self-made developer we recommend that you practice with premixed chemicals carefully prepared for you by professionals. After some time you would like to try something more sophisticated than classic D-76 from a nearest photography store. And that will be the time when you take this book from your shelf. And if you are already an expert you will find your favorite formulas and a lot of new ones in this book - all in one place.
This book is not for absolute beginners, it’s not a textbook, and it doesn’t cover school chemistry basics. Readers are advised to familiarize themselves with basics of photography.
If you are just approaching this fascinating universe and have never burned your favorite shirt with potassium permanganate and sulfuric acid solution support this book for your future experiments because very soon it will become a collectible item.
About us
We are more photographers than publishers (in spite the fact, that one of us has a degree in publishing). We already have more than one idea for photography books and we decided to join our forces as an artist co-op if you will to bring this and other projects to life. The analog photography was a part of our lives for about 40 years combined. We learned from the best and gathered formulas from very old books (the oldest one goes back to 1866), magazines, and handwritten notes of real professionals. We shared photography secrets at the art events, workshops, and just friends’ gatherings. We collected a huge amount of useful and helpful information. And now we would be happy to share it with you. It’s time to join forces, to preserve this unique knowledge for our fellow photographers today and those in the future.

story:
My name is Cesar Jumpa and I am a freelance photographer based in Lima, Peru. This project is about giving light to and old, but vital, tradition in a very personal way through my work as a photographer. It's also a way for me to reconnect with my own ancestry and identity, which was lost in part during the historical process of migration from the countryside to the city.

What is Scissor Dance?

It's a traditional dance that comes from the south Andean region in Peru. Unlike most other dance forms in this region, which are practiced by the whole community, Scissor Dance is only done by certain special individuals, who had learned it since early age with an older master. These dancers compete against each other in special ocations, as part of both the christian and traditional Andean religious rites (which revere the forces of nature). The competitions often include tests of courage, dexterity and resistance to pain. The winners are decided either by a jury or by the favor of the audience.

Where does it come from?

The origins of the dance itself are unclear. The dancers, who decent from certain family lines, or inherit the art through a master-student bond, identify themselves with the Taky Onqoy, a movement of cultural resistance and rebellion that spread from the south Andes against the Spanish colonizers during the XVI century. That movement announced the return of the old gods, and their preachers were said to be possessed by them as they danced in a strange unnatural fashion. Still today, Scissor Dancers talk about "Five hundred years of cultural resistance" when refereeing to themselves and their tradition. The first written testimony of the dance as we know it today comes along way later. In the year 1871 the local priest of Corculla, a little town in the South Andes much alike many other towns, quotes the testimony of a widow, who's late husband was a Scissor Dancer who made a pact with the devil. The devil would teach him new dance moves and feats of courage, and with them the dancer was able to beat his opponents in competition. He was later found dead and dismembered in the outskirts of town. Stories like this show the religious duality that the dance maintains to this day. I one hand, they represent Andean culture; they pay tribute and sacrifices to the earth and lakes, and take the name of the local "Apus" (mountain deities, who can transform into various kinds of animals), who were regarded not so long ago as "the devil" by the Catholic Church. On the other hand, the dance is performed very often in front of the churches and in religious ocations, paying tribute to the local saints, to Jesus and to the christian god, as most of the dancers, like most Peruvians, are christians themselves.


Where is it today?

 In the most recent years, the tradition had to adapt as history changed around it. Since the mid of the century, a process of migration from the countryside to the urban areas has been taking place, driving large colonies into the cities along with their traditions. This process was accelerated during the 80s by a sanguinary war that hit in a dramatic way the land of Ayacucho, one of the centers of Scissor Dance. There, in the big cities, Andean musicians, dancers and artists clashed with a new world of sounds and colors they didn't hesitate at making their own. Among the changes that came to be, the rise of female Scissor Dancers is one of the most notorious. This has been traditionally a male only activity and the appearance of women dancers represent a special characteristic of Andean culture: that of being in constant change and adaptation, that of keeping their traditions alive by the act of defying them. The dance and the dancers, in their current state, represent a culture that refuses to be kept frozen in time as a museum object, and chooses to stay alive and moving.

Why this work is necessary

This work wants to be an objective introduction into the history and aesthetics of the dance, both textually and visually. It's also, in a more subjective way, my own attempt at showing not only the dance itself but also some of the magic that surrounds it. That would be my small contribution into this long living tradition, my own take, not only as a photographer, but also as a Peruvian, whose ancestry has been lost in time into the southern Andes.


Why crowd funding?

Needless to say, traditional media doesn't support this kind of projects and even if the space to publish on the internet is infinite, the resources are scarse. My goal with this campaign is to gather the resources that would help me finish my work by following the steps of various dancers around the Andean towns. The contributions would be used, besides printing the rewards, to help me pay for transportation for both me and my equipment, accommodations, and the help of an assistant when necessary. This final part of the project would take place between the ends of December of 2014 and March of the next year.

story:
The undying flame, all year long

Student Bonfire is a singular experience.  The Aggies who build it are equally unique.  And their commitment to Bonfire is year round.  This calendar will offer a look into Bonfire 2013, even as the students prepare for Bonfire 2014.  In large, brilliant photos accompanied by the stories behind them, you will follow a Bonfire's construction from Cut to Burn.

This calendar will be meant to help all of us show our support for Bonfire and its Aggies, rekindle a bit of the past, motivate, inspire, and keep everyone squared away in making plans for the next Bonfire in 2014.

Additionally, the calendar will feature important dates for the Good Ag, like Muster, campus events (as available), historical and significant Texas A&M anniversaries and dates, and more. 

As a former participant, leader, and Head Stack of the first Bonfire Stack off campus, and now as an adviser to the students, I am at home at Bonfire and among its participants.  My view is one informed by experience, and of deep respect and admiration.  I have been fortunate to enjoy an uncommon perspective, and I hope to share it with you here.

The students of Bonfire offer us all a valuable example of loyalty, pride, determination, in relentless pursuit of a stunning end product.  This is just a small tribute to them.

Each month, an image fit to be framed

Each month will feature an 8x12 photo of another moment in Bonfire 2013.  This is a non-standard size for a wall calendar.  But it will leave you with 13 separate photos (including the cover), each fit for framing at their original resolution.

The calendar will also include an extra page to ensure that each photo will have its own page.  No photo will be printed on the back of another, so when the month has passed, you can remove and frame each photo on its own.  The space from the extra page will then be used to highlight supporters of Bonfire and this calendar project.

Making the calendar

Even now, while students progress through the 2013 Bonfire season, I am with them at every step capturing photos and stories from the Woods to Stack.  Throughout the calendar, stories and descriptions of the activities pictured will enrich the photos, making each a complete story for you to share.  Burn will complete the calendar, and within days, with the addition of that final photo, the calendar will go to press to be delivered in the first week of December.

For a calendar to be ready in December, the timing of Burn in late November presents a major challenge, but one that all parties are ready to meet.  Since 2009, I have designed and printed Bonfire's Burn Night t-shirts featuring the year's Last Shift photo taken only days before Burn.  From that experience, I am aware of and look forward to the challenge this project will present.

But for all the hours it will require from now until delivery, and for its sleepless stretch of days at the end, it will still hardly be a challenge at all when compared to what the students will have taken head-on and overcome.

This campaign

The project should and will reflect on Bonfire and its Aggies not just in its content, but in its careful planning, attention to detail, and end product.  To offer a meaningful product of worthy quality will require expense.  I have for years taken on much of the expense required to capture, compile, and share these photos.  I will continue to do so, regardless of the outcome of this campaign.

But this campaign, if successful, will make possible a wider audience for the Bonfire story.  It will keep fresh the memories of Bonfires past, and the anticipation for the next.

Perhaps most importantly will be the stories and conversations it inspires.  "What is that?!"  "That's Bonfire.  Let me tell you about it."

Pass it back

Whether or not you can make a contribution, you can play a part in making this project a success.  Pass it back.

  • Share this campaign on your social media, and look for:
    • dion-c on flickr with current views from Bonfire
    • @DionCGallery on twitter
    • dioncmcinnisgallery on facebook
    • @StudentBonfire on twitter
    • studentbonfire on facebook
  • Share your support for Bonfire or this calendar on your favorite web forum.
  • Donate to Student Bonfire, a 501(c)(3) non-profit, and help Build the Hell Outta Bonfire.

Learn more

To learn more about Bonfire, and to see a little more of what to expect from this calendar, visit...

  • Dion C. McInnis Gallery: the online home of the Gallery
  • Bonfire 2013 Progress Report: on Good Bull Hunting, a photo progress report from the Woods
  • Student Bonfire Q&A: on Good Bull Hunting, answers to common questions about Bonfire today
  • Bonfire: not out of the Woods yet: on Good Bull Hunting, why an Ol' Ag never leaves
  • Last Shift 2011: from dion-c.me, what these photos and Bonfire mean to me.
  • Burn Night 2008 speech: my 8 minutes at the feet of Stack 2008.
  • Detailing Bonfire: A tradition like none other: from TexAgs Radio, Bonfire in 2012 and beyond, and why you don't just want me behind the camera, you NEED me behind the camera (not in front of it).

Thanks. Gig 'em. And Build the Hell Outta Bonfire!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Conor Cruz, I studied at New York Institute of Photography. I am currently working on my photo book of high quality male fitness and nude. In exchange for your support, I offer two exclusive photo prints that will be in my book.

You can take a look at some of my work at www.facebook.com/CruzVisionnaire

As you can see, we are very good at what we do, and we are very excited about our upcoming photo book.

What We Need & What You Get

Models need to eat :) and they need your support to create art for your pleasure. The money we raised will be used to collect more models which will complete our book.

As perks, you will get two high quality exclusive photo prints of two beautiful nude men, that will be the highlight of our photo book. Thank you.

The Impact

This fund raising project will accelerate the production of our photo book, and we think our unique artistic eye, rigorous technicial expertise along with the various talented models in New York City will make a great book.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also share this campaign page and follow us on facebook at www.facebook.com/CruzVisionnaire

We Appreciate Your Support Thank You!

story:
****All Books will ship within 48 hours of your Indiegogo order from Berlin, Germany :)***
 

Hello! My name is Brian Dowling and I am an American entertainment photographer working for Getty Images in Los Angeles and Berlin.

For the past three years, I have been photographing redheads around the world for my project "Redhead Beauty."  I wanted these images to show the natural beauty of women with red hair from almost 20 countries.  This project was done without make up artists, special lighting, and excessive Photoshop. I wanted it to be obvious these photos are real reflections of the model and for people to end their stereotypes of redheads. 

Natasha & Ruby from England


Dasha & Maria from St. Petersburg, Russia



 

Why Indiegogo?

I chose Indiegogo to help spread my message and show the world the images I have created. With your support, the book will be published and I will have the confidence to keep my journey moving forward to new countries such as Spain, Brazil, Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan, Israel, Mexico, Canada, and of course the US.

Have you photographed any famous Redheads?

I have photographed many famous celebrities such as Julia Roberts, Amy Adams, Jessica Chastain, Emma Stone, Sophie Turner, and Julianne Moore, but the book is more focused on non-celebrity Redheads, although Madelaine Petsch from Riverdale is on the cover! 

The Book


+ Hardcover Book 
+ 188+ pages 
+ HUGE 9x12 inches (22.9x 30.5cm) 
+ High quality 105lb matte paper  (150.5g/m2)
+ Shipped Worldwide from Philadelphia, USA


Elainna from Modesto, California



 

Risks & Challenges

All images for the book have been taken and edited. I have really enjoyed this journey so far, but the biggest challenge in my eyes is reaching the Kickstarter funding goal. So, if you enjoy my photographs and believe in our story, I would appreciate your help by backing this project and sharing my story.

Photographing over 130 models from 20 countries has been a fantastic journey! All monies requested for this Kickstarter are just for printing and shipping costs. All other expenses are from my pocket as I have enjoyed this project so much and the positive feedback it has gotten. If we go over this amount, it will be used to add more pages to the book and/or have a gallery showing to keep spreading our message. I have also spent numerous weeks talking to printers and viewing sample books, but know exactly who will be printing and shipping our books.

I look forward to your help and shipping out the books in June!

Press

story:
Why the project ?


There's a lot of amazing professional e-sports photographers out there, covering many events.

But while the number and size of e-sports events keep growing, tournament organizers and/or gaming websites do not always seem to be willing to hire those professionals photographers to provide us with memories from those events. 

One such example was during the Alliance run at World Cyber Arena in December 2015. Being a big fan of the Swedes, I have tried to find professional looking pictures of their victory at WCA on Dota community websites, WCA's official website and so on...and couldn't find any (and probably never will ?). It seems that what could have been my -potentially - favorite esport picture of 2015 never existed.

I don't know the reasons for this, nor do I pretend to, I can only assume they're either budgetary (professional photographers of course deserve to be paid for their hard work and some tournaments might have a tight budget) or that some event organizers or e-sports teams do not think photography is a great media to help cover and promote what they work so hard on. 

Whatever the reason may be, as an e-sports fan, gamer and amateur digital photographer, I sometimes find this situation disappointing (e.g. the WCA coverage mentioned above). 

It is a shame in my eyes if you think of how much everyone can benefit from good photographic work : the emotion it conveys, the memories it creates. 

Photography is what keeps memories alive.



Who are you?

My Name is David Van Elslande, I'm 40 year old guy and my main two hobbies are photography and gaming. 

Photography:  Some of my work can be seen here https://500px.com/davidvanelslande 


Gaming: I  played my first computer game about 30 years ago (played Frogger the year it came out, that's how old I am!), got instantly hooked, and I've been gaming ever since.  If I should list the top three games I've played  most during the past 10 years, it would probably be Unreal Tournament 2004, Starcraft 2 and Dota 2. 


What is this project about ?

Until a few months ago, I have never tried to mix my two passions, but I thought it'd be fun and interesting to try and do so. The purpose of the project is twofold : 

a) I'd like to travel to a few e-sports events  during the coming year, preferably going to smaller events, or events that will not have enough money in 2016 to hire the services of a professional e-sport photographer, and offer them to do portrait and reportage photography work there, free of charge for the events organizer.

b)Another part of the project would be to try and contact e-sports teams or e-sport personalities (casters etc) and try to organize portrait photo sessions with them, in the style of my previous work http://goo.gl/PQG6bo . I have my own favorite list of personalities whom I really would love to take portraits of and those I will contact first (but I'll keep it secret for now ;d), 

The project's intent is therefore not to improve the state of e-sport photography (I would be delirious to try and pretend doing this), but to offer more photography to the community, going to work at events that cannot afford to hire any established photographers this year and try and fill that gap. And by doing so, maybe help those organizers/esports teams/gaming news websites understand it is something they should absolutely spend more money on to promote their events, brands, teams, and so on in the close future...


Why are you crowdfunding?

For the reasons mentioned above : some tournaments in 2016 might not have the will or the money to spend on hiring an established e-sport photographer. This would be an easy way to provide them, and the community, with that service.

This being said, travelling to any of those events is expensive and, in order to do a proper job, I will also need to spend money on a couple of expensive lenses/camera, so.....




What will you do with the money?

All the money will obviously be spent on the project. I am not looking for a job : I have one (I'm mentioning this because I have heard this before and this irritated me, this is not the purpose of the project at all). I'm not trying to turn in a profit either : I don't need to, nor is it the long term purpose of the project. The purpose is to mix my two passions, gaming and photography, and do my best trying to take great pictures while doing it.  All the money gathered will be spent trying to do this. But I also would like to have my expenses covered while doing it. 

Lenses and camera: The 5D I own works well in an environment where I can control the lightning and be very close to my subject, but reportage in an e-sports arena will require something totally different (more isos, faster focus, etc). I probably can get one great camera and one or two lenses for 4k euros (new is better, second-hand if budget is tight). 


Travelling costs: I live in Belgium right now therefore I would focus on events that take place in Europe (and preferably central/northern Europe as they're easier to reach) in order to minimize travelling costs. 

Entrance tickets to the events, car rental (I'd drive if I can avoid flying), fuel, hotels, food would probably amount to a minimum of 750-1000 euros per event. Different events will have different costs, but the more money I can gather, the more/better events I'll be able to cover.

Website and paypal fees: roughly 10 percent of the project.

Taxes : I live in Belgium, there will be taxes, and probably heavy ones as we are pretty good in this category. I'll have to check how much they will amount to. I will do that once the project has been launched as I'll probably have to consult an tax advisor.
Contributor rewards: books, postcards, and so on. 

So all in all, my estimate is that 10K Euros should allow me to attend 3 or 4 events minimum (transport, housing, food, etc), buy the gear I would need to do a proper job, while covering all the other costs detailed above.

And of course, more money means more events/better gear, more chance to get good pictures and so on. And the other way around. 


Risks?

You don't like my work at all. It's hard to tell since I have so far no experience in e-sport photo. But I'm obviously very keen to learn about it. 

And I suggest you visit my galleries at 

http://eurekastreet.deviantart.com/gallery/ or https://500px.com/davidvanelslande

 and decide for yourself if you can trust me to do a good job at something slightly different, or not...





What the gaming community gets :

All the pictures worth showing will be edited/retouched by myself (which can be very time-consuming) and then of course I will post the pictures on gaming websites, forums etc. 

I'll also obviously will put the pictures on the project's blog : (https://esportphotography.wordpress.com/). 

And then there's the contributor perks!


What have you already done to work toward your objective?

Launching the project on this platform was the first step.

The blog, twitter account and facebook pages have been created as well (see link section for details)

The next steps, while the project is being funded, will be :

a) To start promoting the project

b) To create a list of events to attend in 2016 


Remarks:

Thanks a lot for reading this far. Any idea/suggestion/tip to help me move forward with the project is more than welcome. Don’t hesitate to get in touch!  And don't hesitate to share through one of the links hereunder, or retweet it, it is always helpful!
story_txt:
Why the project ?


There's a lot of amazing professional e-sports photographers out there, covering many events.
But while the number and size of e-sports events keep growing, tournament organizers and/or gaming websites do not always seem to be willing to hire those professionals photographers to provide us with memories from those events. 
One such example was during the Alliance run at World Cyber Arena in December 2015. Being a big fan of the Swedes, I have tried to find professional looking pictures of their victory at WCA on Dota community websites, WCA's official website and so on...and couldn't find any (and probably never will ?). It seems that what could have been my -potentially - favorite esport picture of 2015 never existed.
I don't know the reasons for this, nor do I pretend to, I can only assume they're either budgetary (professional photographers of course deserve to be paid for their hard work and some tournaments might have a tight budget) or that some event organizers or e-sports teams do not think photography is a great media to help cover and promote what they work so hard on. 
Whatever the reason may be, as an e-sports fan, gamer and amateur digital photographer, I sometimes find this situation disappointing (e.g. the WCA coverage mentioned above). 
It is a shame in my eyes if you think of how much everyone can benefit from good photographic work : the emotion it conveys, the memories it creates. 
Photography is what keeps memories alive.



Who are you?


My Name is David Van Elslande, I'm 40 year old guy and my main two hobbies are photography and gaming. 
Photography:  Some of my work can be seen here https://500px.com/davidvanelslande 




Gaming: I  played my first computer game about 30 years ago (played Frogger the year it came out, that's how old I am!), got instantly hooked, and I've been gaming ever since.  If I should list the top three games I've played  most during the past 10 years, it would probably be Unreal Tournament 2004, Starcraft 2 and Dota 2. 

What is this project about ?

Until a few months ago, I have never tried to mix my two passions, but I thought it'd be fun and interesting to try and do so. The purpose of the project is twofold : 
a) I'd like to travel to a few e-sports events  during the coming year, preferably going to smaller events, or events that will not have enough money in 2016 to hire the services of a professional e-sport photographer, and offer them to do portrait and reportage photography work there, free of charge for the events organizer.
b)Another part of the project would be to try and contact e-sports teams or e-sport personalities (casters etc) and try to organize portrait photo sessions with them, in the style of my previous work http://goo.gl/PQG6bo . I have my own favorite list of personalities whom I really would love to take portraits of and those I will contact first (but I'll keep it secret for now ;d), 
The project's intent is therefore not to improve the state of e-sport photography (I would be delirious to try and pretend doing this), but to offer more photography to the community, going to work at events that cannot afford to hire any established photographers this year and try and fill that gap. And by doing so, maybe help those organizers/esports teams/gaming news websites understand it is something they should absolutely spend more money on to promote their events, brands, teams, and so on in the close future...


Why are you crowdfunding?
For the reasons mentioned above : some tournaments in 2016 might not have the will or the money to spend on hiring an established e-sport photographer. This would be an easy way to provide them, and the community, with that service.
This being said, travelling to any of those events is expensive and, in order to do a proper job, I will also need to spend money on a couple of expensive lenses/camera, so.....






What will you do with the money?
All the money will obviously be spent on the project. I am not looking for a job : I have one (I'm mentioning this because I have heard this before and this irritated me, this is not the purpose of the project at all). I'm not trying to turn in a profit either : I don't need to, nor is it the long term purpose of the project. The purpose is to mix my two passions, gaming and photography, and do my best trying to take great pictures while doing it.  All the money gathered will be spent trying to do this. But I also would like to have my expenses covered while doing it. 
Lenses and camera: The 5D I own works well in an environment where I can control the lightning and be very close to my subject, but reportage in an e-sports arena will require something totally different (more isos, faster focus, etc). I probably can get one great camera and one or two lenses for 4k euros (new is better, second-hand if budget is tight). 
Travelling costs: I live in Belgium right now therefore I would focus on events that take place in Europe (and preferably central/northern Europe as they're easier to reach) in order to minimize travelling costs. 
Entrance tickets to the events, car rental (I'd drive if I can avoid flying), fuel, hotels, food would probably amount to a minimum of 750-1000 euros per event. Different events will have different costs, but the more money I can gather, the more/better events I'll be able to cover.
Website and paypal fees: roughly 10 percent of the project.

Taxes : I live in Belgium, there will be taxes, and probably heavy ones as we are pretty good in this category. I'll have to check how much they will amount to. I will do that once the project has been launched as I'll probably have to consult an tax advisor.
Contributor rewards: books, postcards, and so on. 

So all in all, my estimate is that 10K Euros should allow me to attend 3 or 4 events minimum (transport, housing, food, etc), buy the gear I would need to do a proper job, while covering all the other costs detailed above.
And of course, more money means more events/better gear, more chance to get good pictures and so on. And the other way around. 

Risks?You don't like my work at all. It's hard to tell since I have so far no experience in e-sport photo. But I'm obviously very keen to learn about it. And I suggest you visit my galleries at http://eurekastreet.deviantart.com/gallery/ or https://500px.com/davidvanelslande and decide for yourself if you can trust me to do a good job at something slightly different, or not...What the gaming community gets :All the pictures worth showing will be edited/retouched by myself (which can be very time-consuming) and then of course I will post the pictures on gaming websites, forums etc. I'll also obviously will put the pictures on the project's blog : (https://esportphotography.wordpress.com/). And then there's the contributor perks!What have you already done to work toward your objective?Launching the project on this platform was the first step.The blog, twitter account and facebook pages have been created as well (see link section for details)The next steps, while the project is being funded, will be :a) To start promoting the projectb) To create a list of events to attend in 2016 Remarks:Thanks a lot for reading this far. Any idea/suggestion/tip to help me move forward with the project is more than welcome. Don’t hesitate to get in touch!  And don't hesitate to share through one of the links hereunder, or retweet it, it is always helpful!

story:
Dear friends and supporters I would be so grateful for your donation of even 2 dollars for my biggest dream!
My name is Vetre. I am a photographer and this year have won the nomination award in the Humanity Photo Awards competition, which was held in China. Now, I am invited to the awards ceremony. The ceremony will be held in the Shangri-La, China in September. Organizers pay my hotel, but travel expenses must be paid by myself. The truth is that I participate in this competition for more than 10 years. Every time I win awards, but always fail to go to the awards ceremony. And every time I promise myself that next time I’ll go. 18 years ago I studied Chinese language at the University. China was the country of my dreams. I was going to go there to study, but still had to postpone the trip.

In China I’am going to attend the awards ceremony, to spend a week in northern Yunnan and shoot, and after return, if everything goes well, to organize the exhibition

winnings photos

works in World Folklore Photographers Association sight

Who I am

I started taking pictures when I was six when my father gave me his camera. Since that time, I never separate my camera. From 1994 I engage in artistic photography. I had won over 30 different international awards, including the International Federation of Art Photographers FIAP gold medal, gold medal in Venice, gold medal in Japan. This year, I have won the Golden Frame in Lithuanian Press Photo awards.  Three series of ethnic photographs won awards in China.

Supporting this project you can also get art photography prints.

You can choose photos in my website www.vetre-studio.com in portfolio gallery


Contributions
Your donation will be used for the purchase of tickets Vilnius-Helsinki - Chongqing - Lijiang - Shangri-La ,Shangri-La-Lijiang-Chongqing-Helsinki-Vilnius, days 14th to 22th of September 2015. One additional day hotel.

story:
I Am Key West

Hi folks, and thanks for stopping by.  My name is Michael Freas, a 34 year old aspiring photographer.  I have started this campaign in hopes that I can fund the resources to purchase new equipment for a project I am commencing on Key West Color.  FotoByFreas.com is a dream of mine that I am working hard towards making it a reality.  People might ask why equipment?  Well thats simple.  I currently work three jobs just to pay my bills, so I dont get to put much towards my passion and dream.

This new equipment, consisting of a more professional camera body, lenses, and accessories needed to capture the essence of the project.  Photography is not a cheap profession to get into, and I find that the affordability of what I have now is keeping me on a plateau and not helping me grow.  

Why fund me?  Thats probably what you are thinking right now.  Believe in me is what I say.  I have chosen to live a life of sobriety, and I want to document the past life, but give it the glamour it deserves, and show the local flavor and color it has to offer in Key West.  Dont lie, a bartender has been your best friend at one point in your life.  Helping fund me and this project, not only is believing in me, but also bringing a reachable dream, that much closer to a reality.  When I set my mind to something, I always get astounding results.

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for  you folks in more detail:

  • I am asking for $6500.  This will go towards a new Nikon D7100 camera body, 4 new Nikon & Sigma lenses (24mm, 80-200mm, 85mm, 10.5 fisheye), a professional monitor for editing photos (Asus BackLit LCD), lighting (flashes, tripod, memory cards) and accessories needed for the equipment

There are also perks to helping me fund my campaign.  You will get some of the following depending on your donation: a handwritten personal thank you, a print of one of your favorite photos (portfolio is at fotobyfreas.com), a signed copy of my photobook project, and a personal photoshoot.

If we dont reach the full campaign funding goal, the money raised will go immediately towards new equipment with me putting up as much as I can towards meeting the goal, and not defunding money set aside for publishing the photobook.

The Impact

The impact of your donation is HUGE!  I work 3 jobs just to make ends meet, so that I can live in a very inspirational place, Key West, that has inspired many people including Hunter S. Thompson, Ernest Hemmingway, Harry S Truman, Charles Kuralt, and Jimmy Buffet to name a few.  

I have chosen a life of sobriety, which in turn has made me focus and realize this dream of mine is not out of reach.  Your help is that extra step that hasnt been built yet.  I have a life of learned lessons, and now I want to convey those lessons with my lens, and paint my picture of life for you!

I have been published in a few magazines as a younger adult, but now want to take that step in making FotoByFreas a major force in the industry.  I put my mind to making things happen, and big things happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Make sure you use the Indiegogo share tools!

That sums this campaign up.  I thank you for taking the time to read and picture my dream.  Thank you for helping me create that lasting image and many more to come through my vision and lens!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Yasmin of yasminensorphotography.wordpress.com and I have an investigation to do!

Help me find out how the iPhone would have influenced the photography of the Victorian era, had it been invented in 1839 instead of traditional photography.

What We Need & What You Get

Ideally, I'd only need $150 but Indiegogo wont let you raise less than $500 :(

You'll be helping out with models, locations, props and costumes.

Rewards include:
A thankyou tweet
A moustache sent to your door!
An A4 print from my project

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, but still want to help spread the word, why not try taking your own #Wistagram photos and using the hastag?

story:
Hi everyone!

I've created this page in order to help raise money to send me on a medical mission at some point in 2014. I will know exactly where and when early on in January and will update this when I find out. 

Operation Smile is a non-profit medical charity that provides life changing surgeries in third world countries to both children and adults who have been born with facial deformities. This charity focuses primarily on cleft lips and cleft palates however they also have special mission sites focusing on helping burn victims. To date, Operation Smile operates in over 60 countries and has performed over 200,000 surgeries. 

I first became involved in Operation Smile when I was a Sophomore in High School. During my senior year I was selected to go on my first mission as a student volunteer to Can Tho, Vietnam. This experience changed my life and from then on I knew that volunteering with these types of organizations would be an enormous part of my life. 

I have recently been accepted to participate in the U-Voice program. This program is offered to college volunteers who are interested in participating in a medical mission. As a U-Voice journalist it will be my job to document the entire mission and collect stories from the patients, volunteers, and doctors. I will keep a blog where I post these stories and photos as well as video footage. After the mission these will all be sent to Operation Smile headquarters where they will be used to attract new supporters, donors and volunteers. 

I am currently attending the School of Visual Arts for a BFA in Photography and Photojournalism has always been at the top of my interests. I feel so incredibly lucky to have been chosen to go on a second mission and your donation will not only allow me to have an unforgettable experience that will enhance my future career, but you will also be helping an amazing organization.


If you are interested in viewing my photographs from my first mission you can see them here;

http://www.debra-reyes.com/#!vietnam/c1ec9

and my first mission video;

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=1130209745853&l=2538772131866530554



Thank you!

Debra Reyes

story:
CHARLIE FOXTROTTED

Hello, and welcome to the Senior Photo Class of 2017's page! 

We are so happy you're here, and we can't wait to share our experience with you. This is the final show before six eager photo students graduate into real life, and we are ready to put on a show in hopes of bringing the community together around art.

We strongly believe in art, and the impact it has on individuals from children, to adults. Art takes many forms, and art has the strength to bring together a community of people in such a unique way. Though it is tradition that the graduating photo seniors show their work at the end of the year, the six of us want to elevate the experience, and promote art in Champaign Urbana.

While we are asking for your generous donations to help us put on this community event, please consider donating, as we will be donating a percentage of the funds to local art programs, so we can play a small role in fostering the magic of art in others.

All donors are warmly invited to our photo show, Charlie Foxtrotted, in April so that we can celebrate art together!

story:
Short summary

The travel distance between West Coast, California and New York is 2572 miles. The duration of a direct fight is about 11 hours during which you can watch a nice trilogy to ease the boredom of watching white clouds passing outside of your windowpane. But why fly when you can drive? Alex and I left our home in San Francisco on August 3rd 2016. 23 days and 5900 miles later, having crossed 15 states, we reached East Coast and flew back to Europe. Now we are happy to share with you this Photo Book, “Έχουμε ακόμα ” /eçu:me akoma/, the story of what happened between the two coasts.

“ Έχουμε ακόμα ” /eçu:me akoma/ is a Greek phrase we had been repeating to comfort and encourage each other ever since we realized that we had to leave California and go back to Europe. It means “we've still got time” ex. to spend with friends, see more things, visit more places before we depart. It also means “we still have a long way to go” and this phrase kind of stuck in our heads as we were repeating it during the whole road trip.

This photo book is not meant as a guide for planning your own road trip nor an all inclusive book with content on United States. It is merely a collection of frozen scenes and an overview of our route in the hope to inspire people to travel more and explore. Because this way we understand each other and ourselves more. And it is easier than most people think of. You simply get in your car and drive of...

PS: You will not find in the book any personal photo moments guys :P . It’s merely our take on the classic American cross-country road trip. From Grand Canyon to post-hurricane Louisiana, from Georgia O'Keeffe's house to Elvis' Graceland and from Detroit's Techno Museum to the Niagara Falls. We think these photos carry a bit of the character of each place we visited; not what that place is or looks like but how it felt. 

About the book

Help us publish “ έχουμε ακόμα ” /eçu:me akoma/, a 240 pages photo book with perfect binding, including photographs, illustrated maps and info about the route and ORDER YOUR COPY.

Printing and binding are commissioned in a professional publishing house. Required Budget : $6500. As a supporter you will be the first to receive a signed copy of the book once they are printed. Estimated time of arrival of the copies to your mailing address: March 2017.

Book info:

Title: “έχουμε ακόμα” /eçu:me akoma/, from San Francisco to New York – από το Σαν Φρανσίσκο στη Νέα Υόρκη

Print Size: 192x240mm

Pages: 245

Languages: English, Ελληνικά

Soft-cover

Perfect Binding, Magnum matte volume 1.1  & Freelife vellum white paper

Photos, Text, Book design: Despoina Papadopoulou

ISBN: 978-960-93-8711-8
story_txt: Short summaryThe travel distance between West Coast, California and New York is 2572 miles. The duration of a direct fight is about 11 hours during which you can watch a nice trilogy to ease the boredom of watching white clouds passing outside of your windowpane. But why fly when you can drive? Alex and I left our home in San Francisco on August 3rd 2016. 23 days and 5900 miles later, having crossed 15 states, we reached East Coast and flew back to Europe. Now we are happy to share with you this Photo Book, “Έχουμε ακόμα ” /eçu:me akoma/, the story of what happened between the two coasts.“ Έχουμε ακόμα ” /eçu:me akoma/ is a Greek phrase we had been repeating to comfort and encourage each other ever since we realized that we had to leave California and go back to Europe. It means “we've still got time” ex. to spend with friends, see more things, visit more places before we depart. It also means “we still have a long way to go” and this phrase kind of stuck in our heads as we were repeating it during the whole road trip.This photo book is not meant as a guide for planning your own road trip nor an all inclusive book with content on United States. It is merely a collection of frozen scenes and an overview of our route in the hope to inspire people to travel more and explore. Because this way we understand each other and ourselves more. And it is easier than most people think of. You simply get in your car and drive of...PS: You will not find in the book any personal photo moments guys :P . It’s merely our take on the classic American cross-country road trip. From Grand Canyon to post-hurricane Louisiana, from Georgia O'Keeffe's house to Elvis' Graceland and from Detroit's Techno Museum to the Niagara Falls. We think these photos carry a bit of the character of each place we visited; not what that place is or looks like but how it felt. About the bookHelp us publish “ έχουμε ακόμα ” /eçu:me akoma/, a 240 pages photo book with perfect binding, including photographs, illustrated maps and info about the route and ORDER YOUR COPY.Printing and binding are commissioned in a professional publishing house. Required Budget : $6500. As a supporter you will be the first to receive a signed copy of the book once they are printed. Estimated time of arrival of the copies to your mailing address: March 2017.Book info:Title: “έχουμε ακόμα” /eçu:me akoma/, from San Francisco to New York – από το Σαν Φρανσίσκο στη Νέα ΥόρκηPrint Size: 192x240mmPages: 245Languages: English, ΕλληνικάSoft-coverPerfect Binding, Magnum matte volume 1.1  & Freelife vellum white paperPhotos, Text, Book design: Despoina PapadopoulouISBN: 978-960-93-8711-8

story:
*Update#1: We've hit 5,000$ ... now let's hit 10K! 

Hey guys we're absolutely thrilled how fast things have been going. The response to our project has been absolutely overwhelming. We could never have predicted how fast and how big of an impact it would have on so many people... Every day we receive countless emails and requests from artists, photographers, fans giving their support and love. Just starting this project (and showing that it is WORTH IT to chase your dreams) has already had people telling us how inspired they felt just watching us work relentlessly on this project. 

In one week here are a couple milestones we have managed to hit:

  • A travel blog with a brand new theme and category with updates, photos and videos - www.vonwong.com/blog/europe
  • Coordinate, skype and confirm photoshoots with the following artists (and more to come):
    1. Chester Van Bommel - Retoucher - www.artsome.be
    2. SX - Music band - www.sxmusic.be
    3. The Underwater Realm - Independant film group - http://www.theunderwaterrealm.com/
    4. Natasha Baker - Paraolympic Pardressage - http://www.natasha-baker.com/
    5. Andrey Das - Pyrotechnician - http://www.burncrewconcept.net/
    6. Ana Beschia (&co) - Ballerina from the National Slovakian Ballet - http://www.snd.sk/
    7. Cecilio Castrillo Martinez - Leather Mask Designer - http://www.leatherdesigns.es/
  • A music sponsor for the BTS soundtracks - www.triplescoopmusic.com
  • A facebook group to organize meetups with fans and supporters in Europe 
  • Framework for a free workshop in Paris for funders in collaboration with www.strobi.fr
  • Swing a major sponsorship with www.SLRLounge.com who have offered to feature our videos on the front page of their amazing website (no pressure) as well as providing us with some free equipment from UNDFIND
  • Got sponsored a set of Nasty Clamps to help us on our journey
  • Got sponsored a Phottix 7" Hector to help us increase the awesomeness of our videos
  • Designed and placed the order for the Sexy Von Wong silicon bracelets
  • Purchase a vintage yellow polaroid and 5 packs of polaroid (though now we definitely need to buy more!!)
 
So we're funded. Officially. We've hit (and exceeded) our target but we believe that this project is worth more than what we aimed for. We believe that we can  double, even triple in size. Why? Because this project is not about the money. it's about the dream and the inspiration. When you buy a polaroid from us, you don't buy a polaroid. You support a dream and prove that anything is possible. 
 
The additional money we earn now will be used to directly increase the value of the journey that we will be bringing you. For example, purchasing a solid data package to provide live updates of our shoots is now a possibility. Renting lights, equipment and special effects is now a possibility. Paying for additional luggage space to bring more gear to Europe is now a possibility. 
 
Thank YOU for making all of this possible. Sorry for the long update, we had a lot to say. 

Ben & Erwan
 
--


INTRO:

This May, Von Wong Photography plans to raise 5,000$ to support an international collaboration that would combine both the surreal vision of Von Wong with a variety of artists across Europe to create a series of inspirational and visually stunning photo and video portraits.  

Though 5,000$ would hardly be enough to support a pair of student backpackers for a month in Europe, those funds would help us get the financial boost we need to share our creativity and passion with not only the artists we plan on collaborating with but to also share their projects, motivations and innovative spirit with the rest of the world. 

To help raise this small amount of money, we have turned to the help of IndieGoGo to help crowdfund this project...

 

This adventure begins on MAY 1ST in Brussels and ends on MAY 31ST in Barcelona!

 

 

THE PROJECT:

What I have always found exciting about photography is the ability to create worlds... worlds that exist only in my mind until they are brought to reality. Expand that to include a multitude of artists to collaborate with and suddenly those worlds begin to grow, expand and breathe... 

Now take that to the next level. 

Imagine artists that are not only talented and unique...but that have also managed, despite all odds, to have the courage to find and pursue their dreams. Wouldn't you be interested in hearing their story?

Together with my videographer Erwan Cloarec, we have hunted for a range of exceptionally talented artists ranging from emerging music bands, leather mask designers, pyro-techniciens to independent film makers and more that have a story to tell, not only on photo... but also on video. 

We want to tell those stories.

 

WHAT WE'LL GIVE:

A travel blog with details of our adventures… of the excitement that comes with planning a spontaneous creative road trip including short video clips and photos. We want you to travel with us and hope that our journey will inspire you to do the same with your passions. 

Additionally, we will be putting out weekly passionately exciting documentaries of the artists we encounter as well as informative Behind The Scenes footage on the photoshoot process. 

We're bringing you over 200 man hours of work to make this possible. Why? Because we can. But most importantly because we love what we do and we want to share that love and passion with you. 

 

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:

In two word: support and money.

Share the word. Talk to your friends! Get them to support the project!

Without your support, we cannot afford to fund the entire project on our own. We have come up with a range of creative perks that you can purchase that will help us make this adventure a reality.  

Rather than take away from what we offer, we decided that we could offer MORE for those that help make this trip a reality. For example, we promise to provide exclusive lighting or photoshop tutorials and products for our backers such as eDVDs that would contain exclusively detailed BTS footage on how shots were lit, what gear was used, as well as the post-processing that goes into the entire project.

 

HOW IS THE MONEY GOING TO BE USED?

Plane tickets, Car rental, Gas, More Gas (~10,000 kms of driving!), food, lodging… the base necessities. It doesn't look like much but 25 euros a day per person, per day over a month comes up to about 2000$! Anything more, will directly go to getting additional gear or props to increase the quality of our final production (dolly, jib, helicopter, unicorns…!) 

 

OK! I'M CONVINCED! NOW WHAT?

Choose a perk on the right that interests you and follow the steps! Credit Card or Paypal, whichever works for you! Share it with your friends, family, social networks and more!

 

LAST WORDS

To us, this project is a challenge... a challenge to prove to the world that you don't have to follow the constraints that life imposes on you. That if you want, you can reach out and touch your dreams. It's never easy... to break away from the norm, to leave the safety of what's familiar and safe... and try something completely different but it can be done. 

Thank you all for your support. Without you, I wouldn't be here today.

story:
Welcome to my Vision


Hello everyone, my name is Jerry Lawson a freelance photographer who served over 20 years in the US. Army and now a recent disable retiree. I need your help in funding a fully functional Mobile Photography Studio (MPS) that will offer front door service to my customers. I am proposing an alternative that will revolutionize photography. My passion is to keep the past in the future by preserving those precious memories that can never be duplicated, at the same time save everyone time and money.

 Additionally, 10% of the funds received will be donated to the Wounded Warrior Association. Not only will you help me achieve my dream, you will also be giving back to those selfless Hero's who so desperately need our help. As a disabled veteran I know how important it is for these men and women to get the necessary care and treatment they need to resume any resemblance of a normal life, so with your help we can make this happen. Also once the project is completely funded I will offer all Active duty, reservist, retirees and their immediate family with a valid ID card 10% off on all services, products, or a free session.    

My goal is to make taking photos easy and inexpensive. When I pull up in front of my customer's house, I will take their pictures inside the MPS, allow them to view them on the spot, they will choose the pictures they want, either in wallets, 4x6, 5x7, 8x10, or package. I will print the pictures right there, and as they are walking up the driveway to their house they will have pictures in hand, no more dragging the family out of the house to Sears or the mall, I will provide front door service. 

If by chance the project is not fully funded, I will continue to pursue my dream and still donate 10% of the proceeds to the Wounded Warrior Association. 

Maybe you are not able to contribute, I ask that you get the word out to your family, friends, and co-workers by using the Indiegogo share tool.


Sincerely,

Jerry
