story:
El autor

Soy Jorge Panchoaga, fotógrafo y antropólogo colombiano. A lo largo de mi carrera, me he dado cuenta de que me interesa la construcción de redes y conocimientos que impulsen y empoderen a la fotografía y a los fotógrafos a nivel local y regional. Además, me interesa el desarrollo de la narración en diversas plataformas: exposiciones, intervenciones, libros o espacios digitales. En ese recorrido he trabajado durante los últimos siete años en el proyecto DULCE Y SALADA. Empecé a visitar esta población en el año 2010 y quise hacer un proyecto sobre la forma como los habitantes de este lugar convivían con el agua, viviendo sobre ella.

The author

I am Jorge Panchoaga, Colombian photographer. Throughout my career, I have realized that I am interested in building networks and knowledge that will boost and empower photography and photographers at a local and regional level. In addition, I am interested in the development of narration in various platforms: exhibitions, interventions, books or digital spaces. In this journey I have worked for the last seven years in the project DULCE Y SALADA. I started visiting this town in 2010 and I wanted to do a project about how the inhabitants of this place coexisted with the water they live on.

 

 

En el año 2010, en el marco de una labor que me había sido encomendada como fotógrafo, llegué a Nueva Venecia. Víctima de las fuertes lluvias, el pueblo que habita sobre el agua se había inundado, por encima de las tradicionales entradas del río Magdalena. Sin embargo y para sorpresa mía, que el río subiera un metro o casi dos por encima de los techos de tabla, resultaba motivo de festejo entre los habitantes del pueblo. Desde ese día, me propuse entender porque se festejaba la inundación con agua dulce de su pueblo, y porque la salinización que cíclicamente ocurre no los hacia tan felices. Durante ocho años he visitado Nueva Venecia y a los amigos y amigas que ahí hice, vi crecer y graduarse a varios niños, casarse a otros amigos y a algunas personas que retraté los acompañé en su sepelio años después. He seguido trabajando, intentando entender el agua, el río y la relación que como humanos construimos con estos cuerpos que nos traen vida y muerte. Y en ese trabajar constante y curioso he intentado entender como han convivido durante más de 150 años estos pobladores con un ambiente tan complejo y por qué insisten en vivir en medio del agua, donde lo que más escasea es que sea potable para el consumo diario. La máxima paradoja, rodeados de agua que no pueden consumir.

In 2010, in the framework of an assignment as a photographer, I arrived to Nueva Venecia. Victim of the heavy rains, the town that lives on the water had flooded, over the traditional entrances of the Magdalena River. However, to my surprise, that the river rose a meter or almost two above the roofs of the table, was a reason for celebration among the villagers. From that day on, I decided to understand why the flood with fresh water of his people was celebrated, and because the salinization that cyclically happens does not make them so happy. For eight years I have visited Nueva Venecia and the friends I made there, I saw several children grow and graduate, marry other friends, and accompany some people who I had portrayed at their burial years later. I have continued working, trying to understand the water, the river and the relationship that we as humans build with these bodies that bring us life and death. And in that constant and curious work I have tried to understand how these people have lived for more than 150 years with such a complex environment and why they insist in the middle of the water, where what is most scarce is that it is safe for daily consumption. The maximum paradox, surrounded by water that can not consume.

 

 

El libro

Este libro es una forma de conectar las diferentes historias que ocurren en Nueva Venecia con otros lugares y personas. Nueva Venecia está conformada por una comunidad que subsiste principalmente de la pesca. Poco a poco el deterioro del ecosistema lagunar y del daño generado a los principales ríos que alimentan estas aguas, plantean retos más grandes de subsistencia a las personas que habitan este lugar. Conocer y entender este libro y sus historias, quizás permita poner sobre la mesa temas que deben ser dialogados en diferentes escenarios, aportando y humanizando la discusión.

The book

This book is a way to connect the different stories that take place in Nueva Venecia with other places and people. Nueva Venecia is made up of a community that subsists mainly on fishing. Little by little the deterioration of the lagoon ecosystem and the damage generated to the main rivers that feed these waters, pose bigger challenges of subsistence to the people that inhabit this place. Knowing and understanding this book and its stories, perhaps allows putting on the table issues that should be discussed in different scenarios, contributing and humanizing the discussion.

 

 

La editorial

CROMA editorial fue creada con el interés de generar procesos de producción basados en procesos y conocimientos locales, fortaleciendo la industria a partir de publicaciones realizadas con alta calidad, fortaleciendo, educando y construyendo alianzas en toda la cadena de producción local. 

DULCE Y SALADA será publicado con el sello CROMA Editorial y será el tercer libro publicado por este sello independiente. EL equipo de trabajo para este proyecto está conformado por Zully Sotelo, Santiago Murillo, Alejandro Moreno y Jorge Panchoaga.

The publishing house

CROMA editorial was created with the interest of generating production processes based on local processes and knowledge, strengthening the industry from publications made with high quality, strengthening, educating and building alliances throughout the local production chain.

DULCE Y SALADA will be published with the CROMA Editorial seal and will be the third book published by this independent label. The work team for this project is made up of Zully Sotelo, Santiago Murillo, Alejandro Moreno and Jorge Panchoaga.

 


A partir de estas experiencias, de mi trabajo con la comunidad, decidimos construir un libro que plantea un recorrido onírico a través del agua y de los habitantes de Nueva Venecia, señalando diversos momentos significativos y marcados de la historia de estos habitantes y de mis propias vivencias. EL trabajo con Gonzalo Golpe como editor, me permitió apropiarme de lo que quería contar y ser guiado por un nuevo camino donde los mensajes de las imágenes surgían nuevamente como peces del agua, saltando a las canoas, casi volando por sobre el agua. El trabajo de varios meses tomo forma con un equipo de diseñadores Colombianos, Santiago Murillo y Alejandro Moreno, junto a ellos, iniciamos la labor de entender cada paso tomado, como el manual para ensamblar una canoa para recorrer las aguas; Zully Sotelo acompañándonos siempre con sus recomendaciones y comentarios, articulándose en este proceso para apoyarnos en la difusión. ​ Finalmente, la decisión de producir el libro totalmente en Colombia, fue el mayor impulso para aprender, para navegar y conquistar nuevos puertos de trabajo, para abrir puertas a nuevas posibilidades de colegas y amigos. Para creer que podemos construir en nuestras propias aguas.

From these experiences, from my work with the community, we decided to build a book that proposes an oniric journey through the water and the inhabitants of Nueva Venecia, pointing out various significant and marked moments in the history of these inhabitants and my own experiences Working with Gonzalo Golpe as editor, allowed me to appropriate what I wanted to tell and be guided by a new path where the messages of the images emerged again like fish from the water, jumping into the canoes, almost flying over the water. The work of several months took shape with a team of Colombian designers, Santiago Murillo and Alejandro Moreno, together with them, we began the task of understanding each step taken, as the manual to assemble a canoe to travel the waters; Zully Sotelo always accompanying us with her recommendations and comments, articulated to this process to support us with the diffusion. Finally, the decision to produce the book entirely in Colombia was the greatest impulse to learn, to navigate and conquer new work ports, to open doors to new possibilities for colleagues and friends. To believe that we can build in our own waters.

 

 

Las recompensas

Las recompensas que hemos diseñado para ustedes, tienen diferentes y buenos propósitos: el primero de ellos es que puedas comprar en preventa y con un precio especial el libro DULCE Y SALADA y ser uno de los primeros en tener esta publicación. El segundo, es ayudar a que varios de estos libros lleguen a las manos de pobladores de Nueva Venecia, con ello, tanto tu libro como el de habitantes de Nueva Venecia, serán aún más económicos. El tercero es que puedan adquirir otros títulos de mi autoría a un precio especial. Finalmente, hemos diseñado un paquete especial, para aquellos que quieren tener una edición especial de mi trabajo. En este paquete incluimos una foto impresa de 50x37 cm ó una fotoserigrafía de 50x70 cm a un precio realmente especial y que enviaremos a cualquier lugar del mundo junto con tu libro. 

 

 

The rewards

The rewards we have designed for you, have different and good purposes: the first one is that you can buy in presale and with a special price the DULCE Y SALADA book and be one of the first to have this publication. The second is to help several of these books reach the hands of New Venice residents, with this, both your book and the inhabitants of New Venice, will be even more economical. The third is that they can acquire other titles of my authorship at a special price. Finally, we have designed a special package for those who want to have a collectable edition of my work. In this package we include a 50x37 cm printed photo or a 50x70 cm photoserigraphy at a really special price and we will send it to anywhere in the world along with your book.

 

 

DULCE Y SALADA se encuentra listo para entrar a imprenta. Los apoyos que buscamos a partir de esta campaña, están destinados a pagar los gastos finales de impresión y están enfocados en hacer llegar el trabajo a más personas de Nueva Venecia. Creemos que compartiendo el trabajo realizado, aportamos en los procesos locales de empoderamiento, de trabajo comunitario y de fortalecimiento de redes colaborativas.

DULCE Y SALADA is ready to go to press. The supports that we seek from this campaign, are intended to pay the final printing costs and are focused on getting the work to more people in Nueva Venecia. We believe that by sharing the work done, we contribute to local processes of empowerment, community work and the strengthening of collaborative networks.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Jorge Panchoaga

Antropólogo y fotógrafo colombiano. Ganador de la beca SMArt Sustainable Mountain de creación fotográfica en Suiza (2017); del segundo premio del POYLatam categoría Nuestra Mirada (2017); ganador de la beca de emprendimiento artístico de tipo colaborativo, otorgada por el programa distrital de estímulos (2017); ganador del Emerging Talent Award 2016 de Lens Culture; de la beca de creación de artistas con trayectoria intermedia del Ministerio de Cultura (2016); ganador del Premio Iberoamericano de Fotografía NEXOFOTO (2015); ganador de la beca Crea Digital de coproducción de proyectos cross y transmedia otorgada por el Ministerio de cultural de Colombia (2014); el IX Premio Nacional Colombo Suizo de Fotografía del Ministerio de Cultura de Colombia (2013); del Sexto Salón De Arte Joven del Club el Nogal (2011), el III Premio Nacional de Fotografía del Patrimonio Cultural de la Nación (2012).

Su trabajo hace parte de colecciones como el fondo cultural Suizo en Colombia, la colección de fotografía internacional de Higashikawa Japón y diversas colecciones privadas en diferentes países. 

Ha sido editor del libro La Fotografía está en la Calle (2014); coautor de Fiestas de San Pacho (2014), autor del fotolibro SAVAGE (2018).  

Es fundador de CROMA Taller Visual y parte del colectivo +1. 
Actualmente es fotógrafo de Fujifilm.

Colombian anthropologist and photographer. Winner of the SMArt Sustainable Mountain photographic creation grant in Switzerland (2017); of the second prize of the POYLatam Nuestra mirada category (2017); winner of the collaborative artistic entrepreneurship grant, awarded by the district stimulus program (2017); winner of the Emerging Talent Award 2016 by Lens Culture; of the grant for the creation of artists with an intermediate trajectory of the Ministry of Culture (2016); winner of the Ibero-American Photography Award NEXOFOTO (2015); winner of the Crea Digital grant for coproduction of cross and transmedia projects granted by the Ministry of Culture of Colombia (2014); the IX National Colombo Swiss Photography Prize of the Ministry of Culture of Colombia (2013); of the Sixth Young Art Salon of Club el Nogal (2011), the III National Prize of Photography of the Cultural Patrimony of the Nation (2012).

His work is part of collections such as the Swiss cultural fund in Colombia, the international photography collection of Higashikawa Japan and various private collections in different countries.

He has been editor of the book La Fotografía está en la Calle (2014); co-author of Fiestas de San Pacho (2014), author of the photobook SAVAGE (2018).

He is the founder of CROMA Taller Visual and part of the +1 collective.
He is currently a Fujifilm photographer.

 

Te agradezco compartas esta información y este proyecto con tus familiares y amigos. 

Gracias.

I would appreciate if you share this project with your family and friends.

Thanks.
story_txt:
El autor
Soy Jorge Panchoaga, fotógrafo y antropólogo colombiano. A lo largo de mi carrera, me he dado cuenta de que me interesa la construcción de redes y conocimientos que impulsen y empoderen a la fotografía y a los fotógrafos a nivel local y regional. Además, me interesa el desarrollo de la narración en diversas plataformas: exposiciones, intervenciones, libros o espacios digitales. En ese recorrido he trabajado durante los últimos siete años en el proyecto DULCE Y SALADA. Empecé a visitar esta población en el año 2010 y quise hacer un proyecto sobre la forma como los habitantes de este lugar convivían con el agua, viviendo sobre ella.
The author
I am Jorge Panchoaga, Colombian photographer. Throughout my career, I have realized that I am interested in building networks and knowledge that will boost and empower photography and photographers at a local and regional level. In addition, I am interested in the development of narration in various platforms: exhibitions, interventions, books or digital spaces. In this journey I have worked for the last seven years in the project DULCE Y SALADA. I started visiting this town in 2010 and I wanted to do a project about how the inhabitants of this place coexisted with the water they live on.
 

 
En el año 2010, en el marco de una labor que me había sido encomendada como fotógrafo, llegué a Nueva Venecia. Víctima de las fuertes lluvias, el pueblo que habita sobre el agua se había inundado, por encima de las tradicionales entradas del río Magdalena. Sin embargo y para sorpresa mía, que el río subiera un metro o casi dos por encima de los techos de tabla, resultaba motivo de festejo entre los habitantes del pueblo. Desde ese día, me propuse entender porque se festejaba la inundación con agua dulce de su pueblo, y porque la salinización que cíclicamente ocurre no los hacia tan felices. Durante ocho años he visitado Nueva Venecia y a los amigos y amigas que ahí hice, vi crecer y graduarse a varios niños, casarse a otros amigos y a algunas personas que retraté los acompañé en su sepelio años después. He seguido trabajando, intentando entender el agua, el río y la relación que como humanos construimos con estos cuerpos que nos traen vida y muerte. Y en ese trabajar constante y curioso he intentado entender como han convivido durante más de 150 años estos pobladores con un ambiente tan complejo y por qué insisten en vivir en medio del agua, donde lo que más escasea es que sea potable para el consumo diario. La máxima paradoja, rodeados de agua que no pueden consumir.
In 2010, in the framework of an assignment as a photographer, I arrived to Nueva Venecia. Victim of the heavy rains, the town that lives on the water had flooded, over the traditional entrances of the Magdalena River. However, to my surprise, that the river rose a meter or almost two above the roofs of the table, was a reason for celebration among the villagers. From that day on, I decided to understand why the flood with fresh water of his people was celebrated, and because the salinization that cyclically happens does not make them so happy. For eight years I have visited Nueva Venecia and the friends I made there, I saw several children grow and graduate, marry other friends, and accompany some people who I had portrayed at their burial years later. I have continued working, trying to understand the water, the river and the relationship that we as humans build with these bodies that bring us life and death. And in that constant and curious work I have tried to understand how these people have lived for more than 150 years with such a complex environment and why they insist in the middle of the water, where what is most scarce is that it is safe for daily consumption. The maximum paradox, surrounded by water that can not consume.
 

 
El libro
Este libro es una forma de conectar las diferentes historias que ocurren en Nueva Venecia con otros lugares y personas. Nueva Venecia está conformada por una comunidad que subsiste principalmente de la pesca. Poco a poco el deterioro del ecosistema lagunar y del daño generado a los principales ríos que alimentan estas aguas, plantean retos más grandes de subsistencia a las personas que habitan este lugar. Conocer y entender este libro y sus historias, quizás permita poner sobre la mesa temas que deben ser dialogados en diferentes escenarios, aportando y humanizando la discusión.
The book
This book is a way to connect the different stories that take place in Nueva Venecia with other places and people. Nueva Venecia is made up of a community that subsists mainly on fishing. Little by little the deterioration of the lagoon ecosystem and the damage generated to the main rivers that feed these waters, pose bigger challenges of subsistence to the people that inhabit this place. Knowing and understanding this book and its stories, perhaps allows putting on the table issues that should be discussed in different scenarios, contributing and humanizing the discussion.
 

 
La editorial
CROMA editorial fue creada con el interés de generar procesos de producción basados en procesos y conocimientos locales, fortaleciendo la industria a partir de publicaciones realizadas con alta calidad, fortaleciendo, educando y construyendo alianzas en toda la cadena de producción local. 
DULCE Y SALADA será publicado con el sello CROMA Editorial y será el tercer libro publicado por este sello independiente. EL equipo de trabajo para este proyecto está conformado por Zully Sotelo, Santiago Murillo, Alejandro Moreno y Jorge Panchoaga.
The publishing house
CROMA editorial was created with the interest of generating production processes based on local processes and knowledge, strengthening the industry from publications made with high quality, strengthening, educating and building alliances throughout the local production chain.
DULCE Y SALADA will be published with the CROMA Editorial seal and will be the third book published by this independent label. The work team for this project is made up of Zully Sotelo, Santiago Murillo, Alejandro Moreno and Jorge Panchoaga.
 


A partir de estas experiencias, de mi trabajo con la comunidad, decidimos construir un libro que plantea un recorrido onírico a través del agua y de los habitantes de Nueva Venecia, señalando diversos momentos significativos y marcados de la historia de estos habitantes y de mis propias vivencias. EL trabajo con Gonzalo Golpe como editor, me permitió apropiarme de lo que quería contar y ser guiado por un nuevo camino donde los mensajes de las imágenes surgían nuevamente como peces del agua, saltando a las canoas, casi volando por sobre el agua. El trabajo de varios meses tomo forma con un equipo de diseñadores Colombianos, Santiago Murillo y Alejandro Moreno, junto a ellos, iniciamos la labor de entender cada paso tomado, como el manual para ensamblar una canoa para recorrer las aguas; Zully Sotelo acompañándonos siempre con sus recomendaciones y comentarios, articulándose en este proceso para apoyarnos en la difusión. ​ Finalmente, la decisión de producir el libro totalmente en Colombia, fue el mayor impulso para aprender, para navegar y conquistar nuevos puertos de trabajo, para abrir puertas a nuevas posibilidades de colegas y amigos. Para creer que podemos construir en nuestras propias aguas.
From these experiences, from my work with the community, we decided to build a book that proposes an oniric journey through the water and the inhabitants of Nueva Venecia, pointing out various significant and marked moments in the history of these inhabitants and my own experiences Working with Gonzalo Golpe as editor, allowed me to appropriate what I wanted to tell and be guided by a new path where the messages of the images emerged again like fish from the water, jumping into the canoes, almost flying over the water. The work of several months took shape with a team of Colombian designers, Santiago Murillo and Alejandro Moreno, together with them, we began the task of understanding each step taken, as the manual to assemble a canoe to travel the waters; Zully Sotelo always accompanying us with her recommendations and comments, articulated to this process to support us with the diffusion. Finally, the decision to produce the book entirely in Colombia was the greatest impulse to learn, to navigate and conquer new work ports, to open doors to new possibilities for colleagues and friends. To believe that we can build in our own waters.
 

 
Las recompensas
Las recompensas que hemos diseñado para ustedes, tienen diferentes y buenos propósitos: el primero de ellos es que puedas comprar en preventa y con un precio especial el libro DULCE Y SALADA y ser uno de los primeros en tener esta publicación. El segundo, es ayudar a que varios de estos libros lleguen a las manos de pobladores de Nueva Venecia, con ello, tanto tu libro como el de habitantes de Nueva Venecia, serán aún más económicos. El tercero es que puedan adquirir otros títulos de mi autoría a un precio especial. Finalmente, hemos diseñado un paquete especial, para aquellos que quieren tener una edición especial de mi trabajo. En este paquete incluimos una foto impresa de 50x37 cm ó una fotoserigrafía de 50x70 cm a un precio realmente especial y que enviaremos a cualquier lugar del mundo junto con tu libro. 
 


 
The rewards
The rewards we have designed for you, have different and good purposes: the first one is that you can buy in presale and with a special price the DULCE Y SALADA book and be one of the first to have this publication. The second is to help several of these books reach the hands of New Venice residents, with this, both your book and the inhabitants of New Venice, will be even more economical. The third is that they can acquire other titles of my authorship at a special price. Finally, we have designed a special package for those who want to have a collectable edition of my work. In this package we include a 50x37 cm printed photo or a 50x70 cm photoserigraphy at a really special price and we will send it to anywhere in the world along with your book.
 


 
DULCE Y SALADA se encuentra listo para entrar a imprenta. Los apoyos que buscamos a partir de esta campaña, están destinados a pagar los gastos finales de impresión y están enfocados en hacer llegar el trabajo a más personas de Nueva Venecia. Creemos que compartiendo el trabajo realizado, aportamos en los procesos locales de empoderamiento, de trabajo comunitario y de fortalecimiento de redes colaborativas.
DULCE Y SALADA is ready to go to press. The supports that we seek from this campaign, are intended to pay the final printing costs and are focused on getting the work to more people in Nueva Venecia. We believe that by sharing the work done, we contribute to local processes of empowerment, community work and the strengthening of collaborative networks.
 

 

 

 

 

 
Jorge Panchoaga
Antropólogo y fotógrafo colombiano. Ganador de la beca SMArt Sustainable Mountain de creación fotográfica en Suiza (2017); del segundo premio del POYLatam categoría Nuestra Mirada (2017); ganador de la beca de emprendimiento artístico de tipo colaborativo, otorgada por el programa distrital de estímulos (2017); ganador del Emerging Talent Award 2016 de Lens Culture; de la beca de creación de artistas con trayectoria intermedia del Ministerio de Cultura (2016); ganador del Premio Iberoamericano de Fotografía NEXOFOTO (2015); ganador de la beca Crea Digital de coproducción de proyectos cross y transmedia otorgada por el Ministerio de cultural de Colombia (2014); el IX Premio Nacional Colombo Suizo de Fotografía del Ministerio de Cultura de Colombia (2013); del Sexto Salón De Arte Joven del Club el Nogal (2011), el III Premio Nacional de Fotografía del Patrimonio Cultural de la Nación (2012).
Su trabajo hace parte de colecciones como el fondo cultural Suizo en Colombia, la colección de fotografía internacional de Higashikawa Japón y diversas colecciones privadas en diferentes países. 
Ha sido editor del libro La Fotografía está en la Calle (2014); coautor de Fiestas de San Pacho (2014), autor del fotolibro SAVAGE (2018).  
Es fundador de CROMA Taller Visual y parte del colectivo +1. Actualmente es fotógrafo de Fujifilm.
Colombian anthropologist and photographer. Winner of the SMArt Sustainable Mountain photographic creation grant in Switzerland (2017); of the second prize of the POYLatam Nuestra mirada category (2017); winner of the collaborative artistic entrepreneurship grant, awarded by the district stimulus program (2017); winner of the Emerging Talent Award 2016 by Lens Culture; of the grant for the creation of artists with an intermediate trajectory of the Ministry of Culture (2016); winner of the Ibero-American Photography Award NEXOFOTO (2015); winner of the Crea Digital grant for coproduction of cross and transmedia projects granted by the Ministry of Culture of Colombia (2014); the IX National Colombo Swiss Photography Prize of the Ministry of Culture of Colombia (2013); of the Sixth Young Art Salon of Club el Nogal (2011), the III National Prize of Photography of the Cultural Patrimony of the Nation (2012).
His work is part of collections such as the Swiss cultural fund in Colombia, the international photography collection of Higashikawa Japan and various private collections in different countries.
He has been editor of the book La Fotografía está en la Calle (2014); co-author of Fiestas de San Pacho (2014), author of the photobook SAVAGE (2018).
He is the founder of CROMA Taller Visual and part of the +1 collective.He is currently a Fujifilm photographer.
 
Te agradezco compartas esta información y este proyecto con tus familiares y amigos. 
Gracias.
I would appreciate if you share this project with your family and friends.
Thanks.

story:
Since the original success of the Pinhole Pro, our backers have been asking us to release a wide angle version of the professional pinhole lens. We heard you, loud and clear!

Today we have happy to announce two new wide angle lenses to the Pinhole Pro family: the Pinhole Pro S11 (11mm) and Pinhole Pro S37 (37mm).











 

Pinhole photography predates any form of modern photography as the most fundamental form of photographic art. The forerunner to the photographic camera was the camera obscura — a permeative photographic device with no lens but a single pinhole aperture.


 

Contemporary cameras use state-of-the-art lenses, mirrors, mounts, AF/MF techniques, and endlessly higher pixel density to deliver amazing images, but those images are too life-like, lacking the charm of raw, naturally vintage look of pinhole photos boasting the most original saturated colours.








 

In the early 20th century, the development of high speed films and mass production of glass lens almost made pinhole photography forgotten. It’s a lost art form, only to be kept alive by the few enthusiasts.

 

Photographers turned to the endless pursuit of sharpness, resolution and speed. That trend still dominates today. However many photographers like yourself have started to realize that high resolution and high specs can not replace the authenticity of analogue photography that’s more personal, original, unfiltered with a timeless 'point of view'. Pinhole photography provides exactly that. After all it is the closest to what a human eye can see.





 

Create photos and videos exactly the same way photos were taken hundreds of years ago, and pair that with modern high speed, high ISO technologies. The result is stunning and timeless.

 

















 

Create photos and videos exactly the same way photos were taken hundreds of years ago, and pair that with modern high speed, high ISO technologies. The result is stunning and timeless.

Experiment and have fun!





 

Pinhole photography is great for printing out. Paper gives pinhole photos timeless feeling.
















 

Never before, is professional pinhole motion pictures so easy and achievable. The vivid yet stunningly unique look of the pinhole cinema is something that’s simply non-reproducible by digital.

Instead of charging over $1500 for a professional made pinhole lens for cinematography, we offer a much more affordable option for movie makers and video artists with a much more dramatic offering:




 

What lies in every Pinhole Pro lens, is the secret of how each tiniest yet perfectly precious pinhole aperture is made. The shape and edge smoothness of the pinhole aperture is one of the most critical factors in image quality and sharpness.



Unlike most DIY and commercial pinhole cameras and pinhole lenses that use either mechanical pin punching, chemical etching or laser etching, Thingyfy uses a robotic controlled tiny micro-drill that is only 0.05mm in diameter, to preciously drill a perfectly round and smooth pinhole aperture. This process requires state-of-the-art environmental control and vibration reduction, in order to produce the stunning quality of each Pinhole Pro in mass production. Below is a table that compares the attributes of each pinhole production method:



The first three methods result in an imperfect pinhole, with pinhole apertures that are either too large, not round in shape, thick walls of the pinhole or with fuzzy edges — each of which will result in poor image quality.

 







 

One of the biggest challenges to create a super wide angle pinhole lens is the innovative engineering of the lens structure itself at a microscopic scale.

In order to achieve a whopping 120° field of view at an aperture less than 0.15mm, the pinhole wall has to be leas than 0.1mm to eliminate the tunnel effect, or dark corners on the picture.



This is no easy task, as if the wall is too thin, the aperture plane of the Pinhole lens will be as thin as a tin foil, therefore easy to penetrate and warp. Thingyfy’s engineer has developed an ingenious design x allows the aperture plain to stay as thick as 1mm, ensuring its strength and durability, while by precisely machining two opening funnels at opposite orientation, both allows a 120° opening on each side, to let light rays pass through with no obstruction.







 

Pinhole Pro and Pinhole Pro S offer seven different lens mounts and four focal lengths, ranging from 11mm to 55mm. With the extension tubes that are widely available for each lens mount, it’s possible to covert the Pinhole Pro to a wide range of focal lengths, taking advantages of the unique multi-aperture design.





























 

In case you are pledging for Pinhole Pro S as a present for your loved ones and the event will take place soon. We prepared a series of postcards which you can print in your local print-house or at home. Just find the right paper.

story:
In Short

I'm just a Russian girl who fell in love with figure skating a couple years ago and quickly discovered how much I loved taking photos at the events. Since then, I've been working hard to improve, visiting as many competitions as I can. I'm working on becoming an official press photographer so I can access even more events, have better angles and more opportunities to take photos. In the meantime, I need to upgrade my equipment, but all my funds are going towards travel expenses & event tickets. This is where you come in!

My Goal And Your Rewards

My main goal for now is to upgrade to Canon f/2.8 70-200 IS. Currently I can regularly borrow a better body (Canon 5D) but not a lens that would allow me to take pictures of better quality. So that's my main priority!

This is how the funding is going to be distributed:

  • I'm planning to buy a used lens which costs around 50k RUB (~740 USD).
  • Around 15k RUB (~220 USD) is what I'll need for printing the physical rewards.
  • Around 7k-8k RUB (104-120 USD) is going towards shipping.
  • About 5k RUB (~75 USD) + 25 USD (since I'm using a non-US bank account) will cover the platform fees

As thanks for your contributions, I've prepared a range of rewards, including digital-only and physical! The highlights include:

  • figure skating calendars with my favourite photos from 2017-2018 season and the dates of the most important competitions coming up in 2019
  • two special calendars dedicated to my favourite skaters: Shoma Uno and Wakaba Higuchi, as well as an option for you to create your own, custom calendar made of any photos I have!*
  • your own special collection of photos of any skater or team participating at a competition I'm going to in 2018-2019 season (currently: Lombardia Trophy 2018, Grand Prix Helsinki 2018, Rostelecom Cup 2018, more tba)
  • 10x15 photo cards with any photo of your choosing
  • and more :)

*Except for some photos from Lombardia Trophy 2017, since I've lost some of the original files from there. Please inquire for details.

Stretch Goals

In case I reach 1600$, I'll be able to buy Canon f/2.8 70-200 IS II! I will also send a photo card to every backer starting from 5$ (in which case I will require your mail address if you haven't provided one yet)!

Risks & Challenges

In case I don't reach my goal, I will still use the money to save up and buy the lens I need – it will just take a bit longer. I will still send out all the rewards, as well. I will continue to try and bring you the best photos I can, as much as I'm able to!

This is my first campaign, but I have a lot of experience with printed materials and shipping thanks to my previous work, so I am confident we'll be able to do this! I am always open for questions in the comments here or on my Twitter.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute directly, that's okay. Consider visiting my website, subscribing to my instagram account for the newest photos, retweeting photos I share on my Twitter account. And please share information about the campaign! If you want to translate this into other languages to share with more fans, I will be eternally grateful & send you a photo card as a thanks. Please get in touch on Twitter or send me an e-mail.

日本語

こんにちは！私はルダコヴァ ダリア (verit). このページを訪問していただきありがとうございます。

ロシアのフィギュアスケーティングの写真家です、さまざまなイベントへの旅を楽しみです、皆さんと写真をオンラインで共有しています。

私はより良くなり、正式な写真家になりたいです。 私のもう一つの目標は、より良い写真を撮るためにカメラレンズをアップグレードすることです。

あなたの助けを借りて、私はより良いフィギュアスケート写真家になることを目指しています。

応援よろしくお願いします！

and more :)

*Except for some photos from Lombardia Trophy 2017, since I've lost some of the original files from there. Please inquire for details.
Stretch Goals
In case I reach 1600$, I'll be able to buy Canon f/2.8 70-200 IS II! I will also send a photo card to every backer starting from 5$ (in which case I will require your mail address if you haven't provided one yet)!

Risks & Challenges
In case I don't reach my goal, I will still use the money to save up and buy the lens I need – it will just take a bit longer. I will still send out all the rewards, as well. I will continue to try and bring you the best photos I can, as much as I'm able to!
This is my first campaign, but I have a lot of experience with printed materials and shipping thanks to my previous work, so I am confident we'll be able to do this! I am always open for questions in the comments here or on my Twitter.


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute directly, that's okay. Consider visiting my website, subscribing to my instagram account for the newest photos, retweeting photos I share on my Twitter account. And please share information about the campaign! If you want to translate this into other languages to share with more fans, I will be eternally grateful & send you a photo card as a thanks. Please get in touch on Twitter or send me an e-mail.
日本語
こんにちは！私はルダコヴァ ダリア (verit). このページを訪問していただきありがとうございます。
ロシアのフィギュアスケーティングの写真家です、さまざまなイベントへの旅を楽しみです、皆さんと写真をオンラインで共有しています。
私はより良くなり、正式な写真家になりたいです。 私のもう一つの目標は、より良い写真を撮るためにカメラレンズをアップグレードすることです。
あなたの助けを借りて、私はより良いフィギュアスケート写真家になることを目指しています。
応援よろしくお願いします！

story:
Short Summary

Brian Parton is a 37 year old disabled Army Infantry veteran of Kosovo, Afghanistan and Iraq. After injuring his back and undergoing back surgery in 2006, he was medically discharged and began taking his hobby of photography more seriously.

Photography soon became a huge part of his life, and helped provide him with a sense of purpose and direction in his life after his unexpected injuries and discharge. He became very skilled in several genres of photography, including portraiture, fashion and modeling, commercial and advertizing, concerts, weddings, and artistic photography. To see some of his previous work, check out www.brianparton.com.

Over the last few years however, a combination of factors have made continuing his passion much more difficult. His injuries worsened, and he underwent a knee surgery in 2011 and a second back surgery in May of this year. The economy tanked. His equipment, being seven yeas old, has become worn, broken and outdated and he wasn't able to fix/upgrade as needed. He currently doesn't have a functioning camera system.

What We Need & What You Get

Brian Parton is looking to repair existing equipment and purchase updated equipment and software to be able to continue following his photographic passion effectively. Some of the things needed include, but aren't limited to:
  • Repair LCD screen of current Canon DSLR camera body
  • Purchase newer Canon DSLR camera body
  • Purchase newer/additional lenses to allow for a wider array of photography situations
  • Purchase additional storage media for image library
  • Make upgrades to computer and photo editing software

In return for donations to this project, Brian Parton will be offering a variety of perks to donors based on the amount donated and the donor's geographic location and ability to travel. Some of the perks include prints of selected images from Brian's portfolio, personal one-on-one tutorial/mentoring with Brian, or even a photoshoot with Brian!

The Impact

Without this campaign being successful, it will take much, much longer (if ever) for Brian to be able to get the necessary repairs and equipment needed to continue with his photography.

Brian is a disabled veteran and is on a fixed income. Supplemental income from his photography would make a night and day difference in his ability to support himself and his family. Having the ability to earn this supplemental income will not only help financial, but mentally and emotionally as well.

Risks & Challenges

Risks with this project are very low. If funding is received, the equipment will be fixed/bought and the printed photo perks will be printed and delivered to donors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, there are other ways to help. The first way is simply by sharing this with others who might be able to contribute! The more eyes that see this, the better chance it has of being successful!

The other way to help would be with donated equipment. Even if it isn't in the best shape, if it is functional, it can still be useful! Any lenses would need to be for Canon EOS mount. Other items that could be useful would be lighting equipment/modifiers, SD and CF cards, and many other photography equipment/supplies. Email james.brian.parton@gmail.com if you have something you'd be willing to donate and the details can be worked out!

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! My name’s Jushin Gonzalez, and I'm a photographer based in Jersey City and have been shooting for almost four years now. When I began, my main focus was on landscapes and cityscapes, but it wasn't until a friend convinced me to photograph her that I found my passion. It amazed me how beauty can be captured in a single moment, and from there I was hooked. Since then, I've shot portraits because I love the many ways you can portray someone by a simple movement or change of gesture.

My campaign is called "Poetry: The Brave and The Bold." It's a lingerie photo-series of women of different shapes, sizes, and tones. I want women that lack confidence in their own bodies and other physical attributes to be able to identify with the women being featured in my series. I want them to think, "Wow, this girl looks like me and she's beautiful--just like I am." 

Regardless of their physical attributes, throughout time, women have inspired some of the greatest poetry in existence based on the intangibles that inspired the writer. It was my love of comic books that inspired the title and the meaning behind "The Brave and The Bold." "The Brave" are the women who are hesitant to pose for this project but have bravely accepted the challenge. "The Bold" are the women who proudly pose for the project, most of whom overcame views of their self-image. Both The Brave and The Bold portray self-love. My hope with this project is to inspire body positivity and self-love.

In order to shoot this project, I need to raise enough money to rent out a studio. I have about three dozen models posing, and would like an hour of studio time each. As some of you may know, studio rentals are not cheap. Combined with the amount of models, it adds up to a lot monetarily. Another portion of the funds will go to obtaining prints of the models to put up in art gallery showings. I consider myself a perfectionist and would like to print on high-quality paper and proper framing. Also, as mentioned, I would love for this to be shown in art galleries which is another cost. I'd like to show this project in as many galleries as possible, which will also take up a portion of the funds.

What We Need & What You Get

I set my goal at $3000 and will be broken down as such:

- $1,200 towards studio time

- $500 towards prints & frames

- $1,000 toward gallery rentals & promotionals

- $300 toward food for the 30+ models, Makeup Artists, & everyone involved (I'm shooting this all in a span of 2 days)

The perks offered range from a 'thank you' in the pamphlet to various types of photoshoots throughout Hudson County. They will range from single person portraits, to multi person portraits, with as much creativity involved as you wish. The higher packages are ideal for entertainment groups, or even if you want to take cool pictures with your friends. All perks include a featured 'thank you' in the pamphlet when displayed at any art galleries.

This project will be shot regardless of whether or not I meet my goal. All of the money raised will go toward the project, and I'd have to pay the rest out of pocket. This may push it further back, but I'm so passionate about the message behind "Beauty: The Brave and The Bold", that I WILL shoot it despite any financial setbacks.

The Impact

This project can be an inspiration to women who are battling low confidence and self-esteem from body negativity. I want them to know that they truly are beautiful, regardless of the media's beauty standards. The amount of bravery it will take for a lot of these women to pose in front of a camera in lingerie is very admirable. I want to throw away the notion that beauty is what the media says, so women of all types can embrace their existing beauty.

This is my most ambitious project to date, and one that I hold very close to heart. I have many female friends who don't think that they’re beautiful because they have cellulite, they don't measure the same as the women featured on tv and in magazines, or they don’t see women that look like them in positions of social influence. These women are some of the most beautiful women I know both inside and out. This project is dedicated to all my friends with these beliefs; I want them to be aware of the beauty they possess.

Risks & Challenges

The risks on this project are high for me. I've sold some of my possessions to have some sort of budget to make this project happen. Also, I'm in between jobs, but when I accomplish all the goals for this project, everything will be worth it. The greatest risks are financial, but if it means that I can accomplish my dreams, then so be it. My challenges are getting the final project to take off. I can have it shown but I would like to market it better. Luckily, I have a very good friend who works in the the art industry who's going to help so much with the promotional things.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate money, that’s not a problem. Just spreading the word about this project and sharing my Indiegogo page helps out a lot. Any kind of support for my project, "Poetry: The Brave & The Bold", is very much appreciated.

story:
PLEASE CHECK OUT OUR GALLERY FOR UPDATES AND IMAGES OF HOW IT IS ALL GOING!!

Firstly, thank you for visiting our indiegogo page for WEARd! We really appreciate you taking the time to check out our project.

We hope you watched our pitch video above! Here is a little more about the project and about us.

ABOUT US

WEARd is a group of final year Photography students at Sunderland University creating a degree show exhibition.

For our final submission of our degree we have to put together an exhibition containing everyones final project. We are looking to raise money in order to help with production costs of our exhibition catalogue containing a piece of everyone's work and a small statement. These catalogues will help advertise the exhibition but will also help in the future as an example of what we have been able to create. We also need funds to be able to make the opening night of our exhibition a night to remember, to purchase things such as beverages and nibbles. Other things we need funding for are things such as posters to get the word out about our exhibition to make sure it gets as much publicity as possible.

As this is our last ever submission and event at University together we are wanting to go out with a bang. We are a talented, ambitious group of people and with your help we will be able to create an exhibition we are capable of doing. 

HELPING US OUT

We are very grateful for any penny donated to us but even if you are unable to donate money, you are still able to help us by sharing our indiegogo page, following us on Twitter and Facebook and even attending our exhibition on Friday 13th June.

WHAT YOU COULD RECEIVE

Every little helps and you can donate as little as £1 to help us on our journey. From as little as £5 you will receive a memento create by us to thank you for your support and funds. The items you could receive are things such as a poster, an exhibition catalogue, a copy of one of our prints (of your choice), acknowledgements on our website for your kind donations, and even a photoshoot with one of our talented photographers plus a canvas print of one of your chosen images from the shoot. Each donation comes with a free drink at opening night of our exhibitioin if you are able to attend.


Thanks for checking us out and we hope to see you at our exhibition in June :).

story:
On the 17th December 2012 our new home based business opened to the public. Bella Leigha Hair, Beauty & Photography Srudio.

This business is unique in the fact that we have combined a photography studio with hair & beauty. All three services actually compliment each other quite well. Clients can come in and have their hair & make-up done and if they so choose, can have a photo shoot or portait done before leaving the premises. Our clients love the concept and find it very convenient too We have been operating now for 6 months and have been steadily growing our client base from scratch. The feedback from our clients has been quite positive and inspiring. We love making our clients feel welcome & happy.

However, our joy has been short lived with one of our neighbours complaining to our local council about us running this business from our home. The council has issued us with a show cause notice as to why they shouldn't close us down. When I contacted the council in October last year I was told I did not need any permits or neighbour consent/notifications and it was fine to continue with the project, now 6 months later they are saying I am in breech of the by-laws associated with running a home based business and even if I do apply for a permit there are no guarantees that they will approve the business being run from the house. This has been quite a blow to our dedicated team.

What makes us stand out from other hair salons is; the service we provide, our low prices, we are kid friendly & we offer our clients affordable hair, beauty & photography products and packages that no other salon can offer. Our friendly helpful staff make it a pleasurable experience for everyone. We even offer to mind babies while our customers get pampered as well (no one else offers this service), 

We'd like to continue offering this unique service to new & existing customers, so after discussing recent events with the staff, we all agreed that to grow the business further and to stop the council closing us down, we have to relocate the business to a suitable retail outlet. 

To acheive this we need to find a suitable premises (which has been found), complete a shop fit-out,  advertise our new location and erect new signage. All of this requires a large amount of money, money that unfortunately I have already spent on the home based studio.

We need to purchase things like; work stations, wash basins, erect partition walls, paint walls in our theme colours, new flooring, plumbing and electrical work. Some furniture will be transfered to the new studio, however some items (like the wash basins & work stations) can't be removed without breaking them so we need to purchase new ones.

We would like to ask you for your assistance in helping us relocate our unique business. Any amount of financial assistance would be greatly appreciated, but if you can't help us financially you can still assist us by spreading the word about our campaign, please use Indiegogo's share tools to help spread the word.

If you are from interstate or overseas and would like to contribute to our campaign, we will reward your contribution with unique gifts to show our appreciation. If you live in Townsville or surrounding areas and would like to contribute, then you will get the opportunity to experience our services first hand or save even more money on our services if you are an existing customer, please check out our perks for more details.

With your support you will enable us to grow and expand Bella Leigha to be the best value for money studio in Australia. We invite you to visit our facebook page and our website at www.bellaleigha.com

Thank you for your support and allowing us the opportunity to continue building our dream xxx

story:
Hi, I'm Ed Thompson, an independant documentary photographer who lives and works in London. On the 15th of October I photographed a group trying to Occupy the London Stock Exchange in Central London and had no idea what I was getting into. Normally the police enforce a kettle (containment area) as a form of crowd control and protesters wait for hours until they can leave, but on that day something changed, when the protesters were surrounded they set up tents and built a city. I ended up photographing Occupy London for the next five months, the photographs I took were used on the OccupyLSX facebook page, on the Occupylsx.org website and on the Occupy livestream. In November 2011 an edit of the series went viral online as a multimedia piece with poetry by a young occupier, J.J, with the help of OccupyLSX, Occupy Wall St, Anonymous and a host of photography critics/editors/bloggers it was shared to over 500,000 people in a week.
 
Having photographed OccupyLSX since the 15th October 2011 I have a large body of work. I was present for the OccupyLSX eviction and was the only journalist/photojournalist inside the Bank of Ideas eviction. I aim to produce a low-cost 100 page photography book containing an edit of five months of photographs and interviews to create a historical document.
 
You can see more of the series that has already been published online at the following websites:
 
Foto8
Telephoto
VICE
Self Publish Be Happy
 
In eight years of being a freelance photographer I've never received any funding or grants, so it is great that Indiegogo allows a platform for true independant media to be produced. I plan on donating 50 of the books to regional libraries and colleges in the U.K.
 
Thank You,
Ed

story:
What is the project?

Print and publish a photography essay about classic cars, shot during the 2012 World of Speed, on the Salt Flats of Bonneville, Utah.

Watch the video to learn more!

Who are we?

We are a French couple living in New York, 2 passionate photographers, curious to document and share America’s hidden gems.

When will the project be released?

The digital version of the book is ready.  However, we need your help to print it! By engaging in this project, you are only a few weeks away from holding your own copy! 

Why you should participate?

  • Because you're a good friend or a loving family member :) 
  • Because you’d better get a piece of Mr Roubinet before he becomes super famous!
  • Because you need a change of display on your coffee table
  • But hopefully mostly because you think our work deserves to be published, and you want to be part of this creative adventure!

The cost for printing 200 high quality books is $6,400.

This is not cheap but this is what it takes to make a great book, one that you can keep for years, give for a special occasion and get lost into for a change of scenery.

For all these reasons, we need your help and support.

How can you get involved?

If you can, please inject a few $$$ and get awesome rewards (all are signed and limited editions, take a further look at the gallery for a preview!!!)

If you are short on cash, you can still help! Spread the word and share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, website etc...!

Enjoy, share and donate! THANK YOU, THANKS and THANKS AGAIN!!!
Pauline & Julien

Check back for more pictures to be uploaded!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Quel est le projet?

Imprimer et publier un essai photographique créé lors du World of Speed 2012, une course de vitesse de voitures de collection sur les lacs salés de Bonneville, Utah.

Regardez la vidéo pour en savoir plus!

Qui sommes-nous?

Pauline & Julien, un couple de photographes passionnés vivant à New York, curieux de documenter et partager les trésors cachés de l'Amerique!

Quand sort le livre?

La version digitale du livre est prête. Mais nous avons besoin de votre aide pour l'imprimer! En participant à cette aventure, vous recevrez votre copie en quelques semaines!

Pourquoi participer?

  • Parce que vous êtes des potes sympas ou une famille pleine d'amour :)
  • Parce que vous devriez vous procurer une oeuvre de Mr Roubinet avant qu'il ne devienne super célèbre!
  • Parce que vous avez besoin d'un nouveau bouquin pour votre table basse
  • Mais surtout parce que vous croyez en notre projet et que vous souhaitez participer à cette aventure créative!

Les frais d'impression pour 200 exemplaires sont de $6,400.

Oui c'est cher! Mais c'est ce qu'il faut pour faire un beau livre, que l'on garde des années, que l'on offre, et dans lequel on peut s'évader.

Pour toutes ces raisons, nous avons besoin de votre aide.

Comment participer?

Si vous le pouvez, partagez quelques $$$ et recevez des récompenses personalisées (toutes signées et en édition limitée, cliquez sur la Gallery pour un aperçu des photos à imprimer).

Si les temps sont durs, partagez le projet sur votre site, blog, Twitter, Facebook etc... Ca ne coute rien mais ça nous aidera!

Partagez et donnez! MERCI, MERCI BEAUCOUP et MERCI ENCORE!!!

Pauline & Julien

Revenez visiter cette page pour de nouvelles photos!

story:
It seems we are taking more pictures than ever, and we all know that we should be printing our pictures that we take and putting them into photo books. Because pictures printed pictures look better, and photographs on any electronic device are easily deletable and easily losable.

Hard drives crash. Pictures get deleted. And people steal electronics. Photo books protect your once in a lifetime pictures from these threats. So if you have pictures that you want to keep, forever... Photobook'em!

Think about it, when's the last time you:

  • heard someone say: "Aww man, my photo book just crashed and I lost ALL of my pictures!"
  • accidentally deleted your pictures from a photo book?
  • had someone steal your photo book, taking all of your irreplaceable pictures with them forever?

Photo books are the best way to permanently store your pictures. Once pictures are in a photo book, they are a lot less susceptable to being deleted, corrupted or stolen.

What other reasons are there to make photo books?

  • Printed pictures are clearer and sharper than ones on a screen and show the true colors of images
  • There's still something special about holding a real photo book in your hands and going through the pages, either alone or with other people, such as like friends or family
  • They are a great tool for photographers to showcase their work to potential clients

 

Why use Photobook'em to make them?

Photobook'em advantages:

  • Faster & Easier than the traditional way
  • Do it right from your home - or anywhere
  • Be finished in as little as 5 minutes!
  • Costs about half as much as doing it the old, traditional way
  • Pictures can never fall out since they're printed onto the pages inside
  • Infinite cover options, use any of your own pictures or 20 other options that we have
  • Option to add your own comments or captions under the pictures

 

Now, we need your help to make it even easier to make photo books!

Now that we have the basic product done and the process working well, we want to make it possible to use pictures from more sources, and to make photo books from anywhere, so you will no longer have to sit at a computer to do it.

 

Our campaign has two separate stages:

Stage 1

If we can raise $3,800 we can make it so people can add pictures from social networks such as like Facebook, Picasa, Flickr and Instagram into their photo books! This is our primary goal! Social networks fade and go away, anyone still have pictures on Myspace? Believe it or not Facebook may die out too. Nobody thought it would happen to Myspace, but it did. If you put your pictures into photo books you will always have them.

$3,800 goal is to add the capability to our software that will allow printing of pictures from social networks into real hardcover photo books!

 

Stage 2

Looking at pictures on a little 3 inch phone screen is definitely not the best way to see them. So we'd love to make it possible for everyone to make nice photo books from anywhere, at any time, using a custom App we’re going to develop!

The App will send us the photos from your phone or tablet and we'll send you the printed hardcover photo book!

$12,000 stretch goal is to help us make an App to make photo books right from iPhones & iPads and all Android devices. turning the pictures you take on your phone and tablets into durable and long lasting photo books!

 

 

 

 

 

Here's a rendering of the new App and some of the capabilities that will be built in to it if we're funded:

 

In addition to helping us make this possible you also get very nice hardcover photo books as perks!

 

 

FAQ

Can I give a photo book as a gift?

Holiday Gift Special!

We have made a special holiday reward! For only $20 you can get anyone a custom made 8" x 11" photo book, that includes up to 160 pictures printed inside! When you do the math, if you were to print out all of those pictures at 25 cents each that would cost $40.00, plus the additional cost of the cover of $5-$10. This way for 20 bucks (half as much) you can get someone a gift they can enjoy looking at for years.  

Please note: Image shown is only for illustration purposes, you can have any of YOUR pictures as the cover.

How it works: As soon as you contribute and select the perk "Holiday Gift Special!" we'll immediately send you out two gift certificates with a special code on them that can be redeemed for the photo book. One certificate you can hold on to, the other you can give to the person you're giving the photo book to.

That way, if you want to make the photo book for them you can. If they want to make it themselves they can. Or you can sit together and both make the photo book! You can choose which pictures to add, and funny, cute or touching captions to add under each picture, together. Or you can make it for them. Or they can make it. It's up to you!

 

Are all of your photo books offered in hard cover?

Yes, all of our photo books are made with hard covers. We want to make sure that you have something for years to come. In our research we found that softcover prototypes became damaged much more quickly in stress tests, such as the soft cover being bent or accidentally folded over. So we made the decision to only offer photo books the right way, in hardcover format. 

 

What sizes of photo books do you offer?

  • 8" x 8" (holds up to 80 pictures)
  • 8" x 11" (holds up to 160 pictures)
  • 12" x 12" (holds up to 240 pictures)

 

What cover options can I have?

  • Solid Color - 10 solid colors that include all primary colors, and every color of the rainbow.
  • Designer Cover - 10 options that our designers came up with that range from contemporary to classic.
  • Use Your Own Image - Here's where you can really get creative! You can use any of your images. The options are limited only by your imagination.

 

What are the specs of your photo books?

  • The pages are thick gloss finish paper, making them look great and making it easy to turn the pages.
  • The hard covers are also thick and are made from reinforced card stock which is approximately 1/8th inch thick, ensuring durability!
  • Our photo books are hand bound using side-sewn stitching to help them lay flat when opened, for easier viewing.

 

Do you offer storage of pictures?

Yes! Our customers and backers of this campaign receive free storage. This off site storage will preserve a high-quality copy of your favorite pictures, in case of things like hard drive crashes, home fires, burglary, etc. There are no monthly recurring fees for the storage, it's yours!

 

Will you be developing a Blackberry App?

Yes! If and when our first two goals are met, we will set a stretch goal so that we can also develop an App for Blackberry devices, so that people with Blackberry devices can also make photo books quickly and easily from their phones!

 

Still have a question? Email us at hello@photobookem.com

story:
The Gurkhas are Nepalese elite soldiers who have been fighting for the British Army for almost 200 years.
Thousands of hopeful young men compete each year in Nepal for fewer than 200 places in the British Gurkha Battalions. The Gurkhas' reputation as fearless, tough gentlemen warriors is the stuff of legends, but despite having made very significant contributions in war zones such as Borneo, the Falklands, Kosovo, Sierra Leone, Iraq and Afghanistan in the past 50 years alone, gathering Victoria Crosses and military gallantry medals along the way, their achievements are fading in the minds of today's society.

There are numerous books about the Gurkhas.

Some of them contain photos, but no one has yet photographically documented
an entire Gurkha career.
No one has portrayed the individual soldiers and has asked them about their backgrounds, their lives and their thoughts – essentially what it means for a Gurkha to be a Gurkha.

THE ARC OF THE GURKHA is a photo book covering the entire arc of a Gurkha career from recruitment through to training and deployment up to post-military employment and retirement. It will show, for the first time, every single aspect of a Gurkha life with portraits and little personal stories dotted in between.

The book will be published to coincide with the 200 year anniversary of Gurkha service in the British Army in 2015 and 50% of the sales profits will go to a Gurkha charity.

This project will have taken over 3 years when it is finished and although I have had some help funding the huge amount of flights, material and development costs as well as insurance/contract/ location fees, the book needs some more support for the final push.

Please donate, if you can, and share this page and the project Facebook page with as many people as possible: https://www.facebook.com/arcofthegurkha

For each donation, you will get a little piece of the project (they're called perks and are listed on the right hand side of your screen) and help create a unique photographic record of these amazing warriors.

Thank you.

story:
hello world. 

my name is erica, and i am a photographer.  

i love the world.  i love life.  i love to take polaroids.  

i want to make a hard cover book - a journaled collection of polaroids - to share with the world.

please take three minutes and watch my video.  

this hard cover book will be a polaroid journal that is intended to be the first in a series of journals that document my journey and love for this unique form of analog magic.  it's hard to articulate the butterflies in my stomach that certain moments in life have left me with.  this journal is my way of sharing the feelings and emotions i've associated with these moments with the world, without uttering the 1000 words that it might take to do them justice.  the images are quite literally my flutters in utterance.

there are so many different ways of contributing, so if you are stoked on the project but lack the funds to help monetarily make it happen, please help me spread the word!  i will also be offering other opportunities to get the book on my facebook page and blog, so stay tuned in.  i'm a huge fan of being in touch, so please don't be a stranger!  i love being in contact with people.  it helps keep me feeling grounded, close to amazing people, and feel like i'm a part of something huge in this world. 

thank you for your support in helping spread the word about my project!  

and let me say an even bigger thank you, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!!!! a million times over for your interest in this project.  it truly means the world to me!  i know, with your help, together we can create and share something beautiful with the world!

erica.

ps.  ** to view images of the individual polaroids perks that are up for grabs, check out the gallery.  they are all up there, as well as a copy of the polaroid poster that will be made specifically for this project. 

pps.  ** there may be small additional shipping charges added to overseas orders, but i will be in touch before sending anything to make sure everything is clear and acceptable.

story:
To contribute without selecting a perk, click "Back It" and enter any amount. *Note: Indiegogo accepts dollar entries only, without the cents.*
 

About The Halide Project Community Darkroom


The Halide Project is thrilled to announce that, after a thoughtful search, we’ve found the perfect space to open our community darkroom. Located in the growing arts neighborhood of South Kensington in Philadelphia, the 2500 sq ft suite of rooms on the ground floor of the Putnam Building will be home to The Halide Project’s own office, gallery, classroom, photo book collection, photographic equipment lending library, and a well-maintained, professional grade darkroom for traditional printing, film development, and alternative processes.

The Halide Project was founded in 2015 to foster the continued practice and appreciation of traditional and alternative process photography. In an increasingly virtual age, practitioners of the analog arts value the immersive, tactile process and the unique quality of a handcrafted, one-of-a-kind print. We strive to support and further connect this community. Our network of friends and followers is in the hundreds and growing. A 501(c)(3) non-profit run by a volunteer board of directors, THP has successfully served its mission through special exhibitions, artist-led workshops, public events, and online resources—all along with the dream of ultimately opening a new community darkroom in Philadelphia.

It's happening. We’ve signed the lease and we’ve started moving in. All that’s needed in order to proceed is the necessary funding for the initial build-out. We have a team ready to install plumbing, ventilation, sinks, enlarger stations, drying racks, and more. And while we have gratefully received truckloads of donated equipment, there is still some gear to get to ensure a fully stocked, well-functioning darkroom.

We have the passion, the people, and the plan. With the support of the community, we can open this new darkroom, showcase even more contemporary photographic works, continue to present educational public programming, and nurture an environment where artists can connect and exchange ideas for years to come.

Please join us in creating this space by making a tax-deductible contribution of any amount or choose from the listed perks including membership, original artwork, and more! Our campaign continues through January 18th.

If you would like to support in other ways, we welcome the gift of your time, darkroom supplies, photographic equipment, and photo books. Simply contact us through our website at www.thehalideproject.org. Lastly, please help us spread the word by sharing the exciting news with your friends and colleagues!

 

Photos by CJ Harker

A 501(c)(3) non-profit run by a volunteer board of directors, THP has successfully served its mission through special exhibitions, artist-led workshops, public events, and online resources—all along with the dream of ultimately opening a new community darkroom in Philadelphia.It's happening. We’ve signed the lease and we’ve started moving in. All that’s needed in order to proceed is the necessary funding for the initial build-out. We have a team ready to install plumbing, ventilation, sinks, enlarger stations, drying racks, and more. And while we have gratefully received truckloads of donated equipment, there is still some gear to get to ensure a fully stocked, well-functioning darkroom.We have the passion, the people, and the plan. With the support of the community, we can open this new darkroom, showcase even more contemporary photographic works, continue to present educational public programming, and nurture an environment where artists can connect and exchange ideas for years to come.Please join us in creating this space by making a tax-deductible contribution of any amount or choose from the listed perks including membership, original artwork, and more! Our campaign continues through January 18th.If you would like to support in other ways, we welcome the gift of your time, darkroom supplies, photographic equipment, and photo books. Simply contact us through our website at www.thehalideproject.org. Lastly, please help us spread the word by sharing the exciting news with your friends and colleagues! Photos by CJ Harker

story:
The Background

The idea for this project arose in the aftermath of a series of exhibitions of photographs produced by Palestinian children during a two week workshop that Phil ran together with a Palestinian colleague Ahmad Al-Bazz in 2011. The exhibition was shown in four Scottish cities and was displayed simultaneously in Bethlehem and Glasgow. We also staged live video links between Gaza, Dundee and Edinburgh. A more detailed report of the final exhibition in the Scottish Parliament in Edinburgh can be found here:   http://electronicintifada.net/content/palestinian-childrens-photography-showcased-scottish-parliament/12067

The exhibitions are estimated to have been viewed by upwards of 3,000 people and the live discussions undoubtedly brought home to those present the harsh realities faced by Palestinians.It is our experience that most of the world is kept ignorant of the true nature of Palestinian life by politicians and media with a vested interest in keeping the situation obscured.Please help us bear witness to some of the realities of the Palestinian experience by contributing to this project. Having collaborated with Rafat in Gaza, Moussa in Bethlehem and Ahmad in Nablus , it was quite clear that the model we had used of image sharing on the Internet and live video events was both feasible and successful.

The Network

We have therefore started to build a Network of Photographers for Palestine with the intention of sharing both our photographic and curatorial skills. As well as promoting photographic events our longer term goals include:

  • Facilitating photography visits to Palestine
  • Facilitating photography visits for Palestinians to other parts of the world
  • Sharing advice and experience of promoting photography in Palestine.

We now have contacts in all the main cities in Palestine, and in Brussels,Milan, Kuwait, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Manchester, London and Dublin. 

The Project

Our first joint project for which we now seek funding is the development of an exhibition to commemorate the work of two international solidarity workers, Tom Hurndall, Rachel Corrie,who lost their lives in the service of the people of Gaza. The exhibition will document the lives of these two outstanding individuals and examine current conditions in a Gaza still under siege.We are aiming to launch the exhibition on January, 13th 2014, the 10th anniversary of Tom Hurndall's death.

Our exhibition will also seek to forge links between solidarity workers throughout the world and the people of Palestine. We will therefore be displaying the exhibition simultaneously in at least three cities - Edinburgh, London and Gaza City. Of course, if you would like to join us in putting on the exhibition in your area we will gladly assist in sharing images and advising on various aspect of organisation.We will also be launching the exhibition with a live link-up between the centres and a discussion on "Gaza - Then and Now". This appeal is for funds to cover the following costs:

printing; £600

framing; £1000

venue hire; 1 week/venue £2,000

hospitality; £1000

publicity: posters and leaflets £1000

 

If you can't fund us - join us !

If you have a passion for photography or for Palestine, or both - COME AND JOIN US.You don't have to be a super-duper snapper to be part of the Network. All we ask is that you work with us to organise shows about Palestine in your area. We can supply the images and advise you on organising the shows. You will find it a fun experience that will help to build a circle of pro-Palestinian sympathisers around you. 


You can get more information from Phil @ philchetwynd@yahoo.co.uk 

or Rafat @ rafat@zaitoontree.com

Rafat is a mean Arabic speaker so no need to worry if you wish to stay in your native tongue.
