story:
Support Your Local Drag Community!

***A QUICK CLARIFYING NOTE: Any purchase/donation in the amount of $12 OR MORE qualifies you to receive a calendar!***

As 2020 comes to a close, production is well underway on the second installment of the Seattle Drag Calendar: 2021 edition. Conceived of & organized by Jonah St. Croix & Stephen Anunson, & photographed in local grassroots venue Studio Current by Stephen Anunson, the 2020 calendar was a last-minute whirlwind of inspiration & fast execution, paid for out-of-pocket by the two creators. Nonetheless, the project was a success, making back all the capital put into it, with enough profit to make a loving donation to Studio Current.

For 2021, we are bringing you an entirely new lineup of Seattle drag icons. Shot entirely in Anunson's home studio with the greatest consideration for social distancing & individual health, this calendar features 12 original collaborations between artists & photographer. 2021's featured artists are:

  • January - The Diors
  • February - Cookie Couture
  • March - Lasaveona Hunt
  • April - Mona Real
  • May - Cherdonna Shinatra
  • June - LüChi
  • July - Solana Solstice
  • August - Cannoli/Salvador
  • September - Saira Barbaric
  • October - Bosco
  • November - Vincent Milay w/Peach E. Mogee
  • December - Rosa Marchita & Intim@

Amidst all of the changes & complications that 2020 has brought, we have a single burning goal for our sophomore swing at calendar-making: Put profits in the pockets of artists & creators!

Here's where you come in:

What We Need & What You Get

After much research & price comparison, the cost of a reasonably-sized batch printing lands near the $1,000 mark. Additional shipping costs increase that price tag to about $1,200. A successful preorder campaign like this can inform the creators on the demand for the calendar while also knocking out the overhead cost: You are helping the calendar pay for itself, & moving the profit line into the black to put dollars in the pockets of the artists you love.  All you have to do is order your calendar in advance - at a 25% discount! - & invite these local queer icons into your very own home or office (or home office) for all of 2021.

But wait - there's more!

Elevate yourself from the noble realm of "advance purchaser" to the lofty & righteous heights of "benevolent donor"  & you can receive a range of tangible tokens of gratitude (in addition to the deeply fulfilling emotional/spiritual gratitude of calendar artists & creators):

  • Get your name printed in the calendar "thank you" section.
  • Receive a second, smaller version of the 2021 calendar, suitable for adorning your desk, boudoir, powder room, or second, smaller salon. Also makes a fantastic gift.
  • Receive a custom, poster-sized art print of your favorite artist from either the 2020 or 2021 Seattle Drag Calendar. In addition to this years artists, listed above, options include: Betty Wetter & Butylene O'Kipple; Cranberry & Killer Bunny; Sugar Darling; Miss Texas 1988 & Strawberry Shartcake; One; Beau Degas & Bitch Hazel; Angel Baby Kill Kill Kill, & Arson Nicki. (Consult with creators for prices on additional/multiple prints.)
  • Receive your own one hour portrait session with calendar creator & photographer Stephen Anunson.

The Impact

In the 2020 absence of a nightlife scene economy - no weekly gigs, no cash-in-hand tips to get artists over the next financial hurdle - it is more important than ever that we extend our dollars toward our beloved drag performers. Reaching our goal will practically ensure the profit necessary to give everyone involved just a little financial boost before the holidays. 

Stephen & Jonah are veterans of behind-the-scenes Seattle drag, both with years-long résumés for bringing artists & community together in new & exciting ways. Earning funding for their sophomore calendar makes it that much easier to bring it to you again in 2022 with a whole new iconic lineup.

Risks & Challenges

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

One way or another, the calendar will reach the hands of all who order it during presale! Not meeting our goal here may mean we go out-of-pocket a bit at the end of the day, but the real risks of not getting there are twofold:

  • It stifles the opportunity to offer the calendar to a broader audience over a longer time period at regular price.
  • It vastly diminishes the opportunity for artists & creators to financially profit from their work on the calendar. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the cash on-hand for a calendar or a wall to hang it on? Believe us, we understand. Please take a moment to promote our fundraiser by sharing the link to all of your socials. A little bit of promotion goes a long way!

Another thing you can do is follow & support these & other local drag & LGBTQ artists on your own terms & as your budget allows. Venmo or CashApp are a great way to show you care this holiday season.

story:
La raccolta che stiamo promuovendo è per il nostro amico Pino, un fotografo appassionato e di lungo corso a cui, nella notte di domenica 24 maggio in zona Boccea, hanno rubato tutta l'attrezzatura dalla macchina. Questo l'elenco delle cose rubate:

- Corpo macchina Canon EOS 5D Mark III n. serie 073024011298 con cinghia Rossa/Nera Op/Tech
- Corpo macchina Canon EOS 1D X n. serie 043011000532...
- Obiettivo Canon EF 24-70mm f/2.8L USM n. serie 157455 con borsa morbida grigio /nero
- Obiettivo Canon EF 300mm f/2.8L USM n. serie 23000 sul paraluce striscia neoprene colore mimetico
- Obiettivo Canon EF 70-200mm f/4.0L USM n. serie 580211 con borsa morbida grigio /nero
- Obiettivo Tokina 11/17

- Notebook Macbook Air 13" n. serie C02JD135DRVF
- Zaino Think Tank Airport Accelerator nero
- Porta Schede Think Tank pee wee pixel pocket rocket Rosso/grigio scuro
contenente 3 schede compact flash ( 2 Sandisk 1 Lexar ) 3 SD sandisk) al cui interno
foto concorso piazza di siena e partite di rugby
- Borsetta Canon Nera (10cmx10cm circa) contente :
lettore schede Compact flash Lexar
Modem MiFi Vodafone r212 con all’interno SIM Dati 3 numero +393924185556
- 2 Custodie neoprene porta corpo macchina LensCoat ( 1 nera 1 mimetica )
- Monopiede Sirui P326
- Flash shanny sn600sc

Chi conosce il mondo della fotografia sa bene quanto questo genere di attrezzatura non si possa ricomprare in poco tempo e quanti sacrifici si devono fare per poterla avere sempre aggiornata e manutenuta.

Questo episodio è una dura tegola per Pino e per chi lo conosce. Sappiamo bene che questa raccolta non gli potrà restituire tutto il materiale rubato, ma vogliamo che non smetta il suo lavoro. Da qualche parte bisogna ricominciare, soprattutto perché un campo di rugby senza il suo fotografo di riferimento non ha senso. Sostegno è la parola d'ordine nel mondo della palla ovale, ognuno può donare la somma che si può permettere, chiediamo solo la massima diffusione a chi conosce Pino e ha sempre amato le sue foto. Pino siamo tutti con te!

Questo l'elenco delle cose rubate:- Corpo macchina Canon EOS 5D Mark III n. serie 073024011298 con cinghia Rossa/Nera Op/Tech  - Corpo macchina Canon EOS 1D X n. serie 043011000532...  - Obiettivo Canon EF 24-70mm f/2.8L USM n. serie 157455 con borsa morbida grigio /nero  - Obiettivo Canon EF 300mm f/2.8L USM n. serie 23000 sul paraluce striscia neoprene colore mimetico  - Obiettivo Canon EF 70-200mm f/4.0L USM n. serie 580211 con borsa morbida grigio /nero  - Obiettivo Tokina 11/17 - Notebook Macbook Air 13" n. serie C02JD135DRVF  - Zaino Think Tank Airport Accelerator nero  - Porta Schede Think Tank pee wee pixel pocket rocket Rosso/grigio scuro   contenente 3 schede compact flash ( 2 Sandisk 1 Lexar ) 3 SD sandisk) al cui interno   foto concorso piazza di siena e partite di rugby  - Borsetta Canon Nera (10cmx10cm circa) contente :  lettore schede Compact flash Lexar   Modem MiFi Vodafone r212 con all’interno SIM Dati 3 numero +393924185556  - 2 Custodie neoprene porta corpo macchina LensCoat ( 1 nera 1 mimetica )  - Monopiede Sirui P326  - Flash shanny sn600scChi conosce il mondo della fotografia sa bene quanto questo genere di attrezzatura non si possa ricomprare in poco tempo e quanti sacrifici si devono fare per poterla avere sempre aggiornata e manutenuta.Questo episodio è una dura tegola per Pino e per chi lo conosce. Sappiamo bene che questa raccolta non gli potrà restituire tutto il materiale rubato, ma vogliamo che non smetta il suo lavoro. Da qualche parte bisogna ricominciare, soprattutto perché un campo di rugby senza il suo fotografo di riferimento non ha senso. Sostegno è la parola d'ordine nel mondo della palla ovale, ognuno può donare la somma che si può permettere, chiediamo solo la massima diffusione a chi conosce Pino e ha sempre amato le sue foto. Pino siamo tutti con te!

story:
Last summer I took an expedition to Cambodia, having wanted to explore the far East for years,  and discovered that that journey would leave me with something that goes beyond its beautiful landscapes. I met so many people, every one of them made a very strong impression on me, with their optimism, hope for a better future, through their hard work and efforts. I spent a long month travelling around the country taking photographs with my old film camera.

Thanks to your enthusiastic support we can help Oxfam carry out a concrete project (see next paragraphs). For a country with the majority of the population living on less than $2 a day, every little help can go a long way. Together we can make a difference!


I grew up in a small village near Florence, where you can still roam in the countryside watching old men cultivating the land. For me film photography is the best way to find the soul of a place, to explore it, to reflect it. Besides shooting and inhaling chemicals in the darkroom, I’m also an engineer and thanks to this I had the opportunity to go travelling in Cambodia.
All the photos were taken with my Canon T70 film camera, Canon FD 50mm standard lens, on IlFord HP5 Plus film.


Oxfam was among the first group of NGO’s to provide aid to Cambodia after the collapse of the Khmer Rouge in 1979. They work with partners on the promotion and protection of human rights, women’s economic empowerment, building community micro-finance institutions, responsible management of natural resources.

Your help will go to fund, through Oxfam, a project that’s been submitted and approved by the European Union. 42k Euros are needed to complete all the activities planned by 2014!

What we can achieve thanks to your contribution:

The founds will be managed by Oxfam, so projects may differ. If you can’t contribute doesn’t mean they can’t help! Get the word out and make some noise about the "CAMBODIA 2014: Photography makes the difference" Project , we will be  grateful!


The idea was initially born thanks to Luca and Barbara, trusted friends and fellow travelers. We had decided to organize, in their small and beautiful new home, a charity cocktail with friends. Soon many people have asked us to participate, to do something concrete together. Many friends are joining and thanks to all of you and to the support of Oxfam, the project is coming to life.
Special Thanks to Elena, Barbara, Luca, Iacopo, Ilaria, Penny.. I'll update the list, I promise!

Together we can turn many small actions in a great result!

The exhibition will run in Florence, Italy, about December/January and will consist of both exhibition quality photographic prints and large format installations. An evening event is going to be organized, beside other shows in other cities. Stay tuned, forthcoming news are arriving!


As a sincere thank you for your pledges we're offering a variety of gifts. These include calendars, signed fine art prints and the fantastic opportunity to become our beloved partner.

There will also be the opportunity for all pledge givers to come along to the exhibition, soak up the atmosphere, have a glass of wine (or two!) and receive the our personal thanks for your contribution!

A closer look to the Calendar..


Imagine them on baryta paper, with the unique look of traditional silver halide photo paper: creamy whites and velvety blacks.
Choose your favourite!

story:
My Journey… So Far

I am currently a student at Northern Illinois University (GO Huskies!!!) getting a degree in electrical engineering. Even though most of my background is in the engineering field, one of my passions I truly enjoy is photography. I’ve been given the opportunity to join the Northern Star (school newspaper) as a photographer for the past two years taking photos at a variety of events from sports and student club and organization events to events that happen in our community. I was even awarded photographer of the year my first year with the Northern Star, which was voted on by everyone who worked at the Star.

Being that I used the Northern Star equipment, I owned none of my photos and was permitted to use their equipment only when shooting events for the newspaper. Now wanting to be able to branch out and doing other things outside the newspaper, I could really use my own equipment. I still enjoy and will continue being a part of the Northern Star, I now want to start doing events that are not necessarily going into the newspaper as well as be able to create memories like putting together scrapbooks and framework people in the community. I’m also very big into nature and love taking pictures of animals.

Any contribution will go a long way to get me started with getting my first camera and equipment. This way I will not be restricted to only doing events going in the newspaper. 

What I Need & What You Get

What I need is as follows:

·  Canon EOS Rebel T6i Digital Camera w/ 2 Lenses, Case, SD Card, and 3-year drop and spill coverage: $1500

·  Adobe Photoshop & Premiere Elements 13: $150

My unique perks are as follows:

·  Thank you post card with my original photo: $25

·  16x20 Canvas photo of my original photo and thank you post card: $100

·  16x24 Canvas photo of my original photo and thank you post card: $250

·  20x30 Canvas photo of my original photo and thank you post card: $500

·  30x40 Canvas photo of my original photo and thank you post card: $1,000

Funds that I raise whether I reach my goal or not, will go towards me purchasing my first camera and equipment.

Your Impact

Your contribution is valuable to my campaign because it will help me create priceless memories for my community that we will be able to treasure forever. As things began to grow and I start to cover bigger events like weddings and anniversaries, I will also be able to hire and work with other photographers in my community. I also want to give back to my community through my photography by donating a portion of my proceeds to a scholarship fund to help students go to college.

My only experience I have with photography is working at the Northern Star, but through this journey I gained a lot technical skills, won an award, and really increased my passion for photography.

Risks & Challenges

Being that my only experience I have is working at my school’s newspaper, one of my biggest obstacles I would have to overcome is proving to people I have enough experience to create priceless memories at their event or gathering. I know I can overcome this challenge because of the type of person I am. I’m very outgoing and confident in my abilities even though I know I have much to learn. Another obstacle I can see myself facing is getting the word out that I am a photographer. To overcome this challenge, I will be able to use social media (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.) to get my name and my skills out so people can see my talent. I can also have my friends and family be my first clients and showcase the events I do for them. I also plan on creating a website where people can see my work and book events. 

Other Ways to Help Me on My Journey

If you want to help, but can’t contribute financially, any advice on how to move forward as far as getting my business started and any photography tips are welcomed. Also you could share my campaign on Indiegogo and let people know about my journey.
story_txt:
My Journey… So Far
I am currently a student at Northern Illinois University (GO
Huskies!!!) getting a degree in electrical engineering. Even though most of my
background is in the engineering field, one of my passions I truly enjoy is
photography. I’ve been given the opportunity to join the Northern Star (school
newspaper) as a photographer for the past two years taking photos at a variety
of events from sports and student club and organization events to events that
happen in our community. I was even awarded photographer of the year my first year
with the Northern Star, which was voted on by everyone who worked at the Star.
Being that I used the Northern Star equipment, I owned none of
my photos and was permitted to use their equipment only when shooting events
for the newspaper. Now wanting to be able to branch out and doing other things
outside the newspaper, I could really use my own equipment. I still enjoy and
will continue being a part of the Northern Star, I now want to start doing
events that are not necessarily going into the newspaper as well as be able to
create memories like putting together scrapbooks and framework people in the
community. I’m also very big into nature and love taking pictures of animals.
Any contribution will go a long way to get me started with
getting my first camera and equipment. This way I will not be restricted to
only doing events going in the newspaper. 
   
What I Need & What You Get
What I need is as
follows:
· 
Canon EOS Rebel T6i Digital
Camera w/ 2 Lenses, Case, SD Card, and 3-year drop and spill coverage:
$1500
· 
Adobe Photoshop & Premiere
Elements 13: $150
My unique perks are as follows:
· 
Thank you post card with my
original photo: $25
· 
16x20 Canvas photo of my
original photo and thank you post card: $100
· 
16x24 Canvas photo of my
original photo and thank you post card: $250
· 
20x30 Canvas photo of my
original photo and thank you post card: $500
· 
30x40 Canvas photo of my
original photo and thank you post card: $1,000
Funds that I raise whether I reach my goal
or not, will go towards me purchasing my first camera and equipment.   
Your Impact

Your contribution
is valuable to my campaign because it will help me create priceless memories
for my community that we will be able to treasure forever. As things began to grow
and I start to cover bigger events like weddings and anniversaries, I will also
be able to hire and work with other photographers in my community. I also want
to give back to my community through my photography by donating a portion of my proceeds to a scholarship fund to help students go to college.
My
only experience I have with photography is working at the Northern Star, but
through this journey I gained a lot technical skills, won an award, and really
increased my passion for photography.   
Risks & Challenges


Being
that my only experience I have is working at my school’s newspaper, one of my
biggest obstacles I would have to overcome is proving to people I have enough experience
to create priceless memories at their event or gathering. I know I can overcome
this challenge because of the type of person I am. I’m very outgoing and confident
in my abilities even though I know I have much to learn. Another obstacle I can
see myself facing is getting the word out that I am a photographer. To overcome
this challenge, I will be able to use social media (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest,
etc.) to get my name and my skills out so people can see my talent. I can also
have my friends and family be my first clients and showcase the events I do for
them. I also plan on creating a website where people can see my work and book
events.    
Other Ways to Help Me on My Journey

If you want to
help, but can’t contribute financially, any advice on how to move forward as
far as getting my business started and any photography tips are welcomed. Also you
could share my campaign on Indiegogo and let people know about my journey.

story:
UPDATE!
Website mock up! 

Take a look and get a sense of what it will look like!



New video:




Who Are We?

HI! We are Jessie and Courtney Pozzolo of Undiscovered Photography and we specialize in Cosplay, Geek and Glamour photography.


Why Do We Specialize In It?

Our journey from traditional photography into a Geek specialization began with our 3 Cosplay obsessed children. They are rarely out of costume and they even stay dressed up when we go out grocery shopping. It goes so deep into their genes, our littlest daughter's first words were actually "Iron Man". Their love of Cosplay is so strong that they convinced us to take our photography in a new direction! Needless to say we share their passion for their heroes both in fantasy and Cosplay!

What Did We Discover?

We couldn’t understand how we had to do a style of photography that we were not passionate about to fund the style we were. What was stopping us? With much discussion, we leapt in with everything, re-branded our entire business into Geek photography and have had the time of our lives since! This website is intended to offer Cosplayers and Cosplay Photographers, these amazing people who put so much energy and care into what they do, the ability to see a return from the things they are passionate about too! It is expensive on both sides but we can help remove all of the costs and risks associated with selling prints and the spent shipping.


How We Want To Change Cosplay!

We have spent the last 6 months researching, developing, and talking to the community and it has lead us to a single driving goal. The goal is to create a website that will allow any Cosplayer and/or Cosplay Photographer, from newbie to professional, the ability to sell prints at no risk, no cost and remove the shipping hassle. When a print is sold it gets produced, shipped and the Cosplayer/ Photographer gets paid!  It will be branded as CosplayPrintsOf.me, and targeted at the 155,000 people searching for Cosplay every day. We even get contacted through our business website about buying prints of the Cosplayers we have photographed and we are not marketing it! It will most importantly be quality controlled to ensure that every images is it's very best and the quality will be consistent. We intend to bring the ability to sell prints to everyone and don’t worry, we have a plan for signed prints as well!  


Why You Matter!

Ultimately with your help, we can create a new reality with in the Cosplay community for you as Cosplayers and as Cosplay Photographers.  If we go to financial investors, we are obligated to charge more to be able to pay them in return for the funds they provided. This would reduce the profit for the websites users. With your investment instead, the website will be able to keep it's costs lowered and pay that money back out to you on your print sales!


With the ability to sell prints and make money available to all Cosplayers and Cosplay Photographers there will be a world of new opportunities. Just imagine the possibilities! Cosplayers will be able to fund new costumes, new props, attend more conventions, gain more photographs, gain more fans and drive the prestige of everyone up. Cosplay Photographers will gain new ability to buy equipment, learn new lighting styles, purchase new lenses and camera bodies, pay for travel, studios, hire Cosplayers to model and be able to pay them for their work!


What We Need

We need your help to raise the $50,000 dollars required to pay for the website, the printing equipment and ink, shipping materials, a computer to authorize and manage images, online advertising and long term hosting.

By using Indiegogo to raise the funds, we can completely remove the need for investors. Ultimately, we want to funnel as much money back into the Cosplay community as possible and this makes that a reality!

We want to be as transparent as possible and so here are our costs:

$21,000 dollars to create the website

$9,000 for printers and initial printing materials

$5,000 for advertising

$3,000 in shipping

$2,000 in computers

$5,000 in expenses (ie. rent, power, internet, hosting)

$5,000 in other costs including Indiegogo's % and accounts that will not be able to fund in the end.

Arriving at a total of $50,000

We do have stretch goals of adding options like:
Launching with Contracts for Cosplayer's and Cosplay Photographers Specifically
Apps on IOS, Android, and Windows
An Ambassador program

If we can break our goal we can make these an reality!

How It Will Work Exactly

As a vendor through Cosplayprintsof.me, you will choose an image, upload it and set your profit splitting. The image will then go through an approval process to ensure it meets the standards of the website (basic image quality, non pornographic, not a duplicate or stolen) and then be posted. Free accounts will be to choose the print size, be able to share links directly to that image on their social media and keyword it for easy searching. Premium accounts can set a maximum print total to sell, organize their offerings on their vanity site, offer an optional signature on the print, be able to view statistics and see where the views are coming from. You can even  choose this image to appear in the front page feature rotation.


The moment it is available for sale, it can be printed and sold!


Signed Prints Are Why People Buy Prints Of Cosplay!


We are aware that signatures and personalization add value to a print and to some it is seen as the only reason people buy Cosplay prints. To ensure this is not lost, we have created a system to allow you to sign your posters if you choose, but with all the ease of use and cost reductions we want this website to provide. 

Here's how:

The Cosplayer or Photographer sets a time period, lets say every 2 weeks, and as orders come in the fan is notified of the estimated shipping date on signed copies. When the order arrives and is paid for, we produce the requested prints for that Cosplayer or Photographer, organize them and provide the name/request of each purchaser. Once the 2 weeks are up, we ship the prints ready to be personalized to the Cosplayer or Photographer. They will arrive complete with all the materials required to send it on it's way after it's signed. We will include all the packaging and shipping labels, so you just sign and ship away.  


Why We Created Our Tiers

To be able to put as much money into making this dream a reality we have opted to offer the premium membership at an increasing discount to early adopters and to offer limited time discounts on prints for fans. We have also created tiers to allow companies and websites that support and love Cosplay the ability to connect with fans through advertising. The higher the tier you buy, the better the deal we can offer on discounts! Premium members will always have a special feature on the front page, where members will be randomly selected and displayed to promote them to the 155,000 people searching for Cosplay everyday.


Buying in starting at the 2 year tier for only $95 ($25 off the price when the site is live) gets you the special Founder status. Founder status comes with the perk of having a single image appearing on the front page, chosen by you, so that visitors to the website will be greeted by your work and directed to your page. The website will also be able to run ads by Cosplayers and Photographers to drive traffic to their Facebook pages, websites, and Tumblr. To get this happening right off the start, the higher tiers have an advertising credit built right in for a seriously discounted rate. You don't have to activate it at launch though, as you will be able to save your credit and it can be activated any time.


Cosplay/Photographer tiers:

$25 (6 month subscription)

A 6 month premium subscription ($30) to the website for a discounted rate to the website offering a vanity Url, featured placement in a section for members, unlimited photo's, fans can order signed prints, and more.

$50 (1 year subscription)

A 1 year premium subscription ($60) to the website for a discounted rate to the website offering a vanity Url, featured placement in a section for members, unlimited photo's, fans can order signed prints, and more.

$95 (2 year subscription)

A 2 year premium subscription ($120) to the website for a discounted rate to the website offering a vanity Url, featured placement in a section for members, unlimited photo's, fans can order signed prints, a special permanent advertisement on the front page promoting members with Founding status

$130 (3 year subscription)

A 3 year premium subscription ($180) to the website for a discounted rate to the website offering a vanity Url, featured placement in a section for members, unlimited photo's, fans can order signed prints, a special permanent advertisement on the front page promoting members with Founding status

$190 (5 year subscription)

A 5 year premium subscription ($300) to the website for a discounted rate to the website offering a vanity Url, featured placement in a section for members, unlimited photo's, fans can order signed prints, a special permanent advertisement on the front page promoting members with Founding status

$325 (5 year + 250 dollar advertising credit)

Valued at $550 this tier has a 5 year premium subscription ($300) and a credit for $250 in advertising on the website to promote yourself, a special permanent advertisement on the front page promoting only members with Founding status plus all the other perks of membership.

$500 (Lifetime subscription plus $500 advertising credit)

Valued at $1100 this tier has a lifetime premium subscription ($600) and a credit for $500 in advertising on the website to promote you, a special permanent advertisement on the front page promoting only members with Founding status plus all the other perks of membership.

$1000 (Lifetime subscription plus $1500 advertising credit)

Valued at $2100 this tier has a lifetime premium subscription ($600) PLUS this tier comes with a credit for $1500 in advertising on the website to promote you,  Founding status plus all the other perks of membership.


Fan Tiers:

We decided to include 3 Fan Tier's so that Cosplayer's can encourage their fans to help support Cosplayprintsof.me and still be able to make this a reality. We have tailored the tiers to offering discounts on prints for a limited number of print sales and once these run out they will not be refillable nor will they be transferable.


$25 (Fan Tier 1)

$2.00 discount on each print purchased up to 15
Total Value in print: $30
You helped make this a reality! Your favorite Cosplayer or Photographer loves you!

$50 (Fan Tier 2)

$2.50 discount on each print purchased up to 30
Total Value in print: $70
You helped make this a reality! Your favorite Cosplayer or Photographer loves you!


$75 (Fan Tier 3)

$3.50 discount on each print purchased up to 35
Total Value: $122.50
You helped make this a reality! Your favorite Cosplayer or Photographer loves you!


Advertiser Tiers:

We are including this high end tier as it is designed for any company interested in supporting the website while promoting their own Cosplay or Video game related industry. Advertise your up coming game and call out for Cosplayers to help promote it in costume!
 

$6,000  (A 6 Month Advertising Package)

This tier offers a lifetime subscription, plus a complete market 6 month advertising package designed for any company interested in Cosplay or related industries.


$10,000 (A 1 Year Advertising Package)

This tier offers a lifetime subscription, plus a complete market 1 year advertising package designed for any company interested in Cosplay or related industries.


If we can not fully fund this project, we will take the remaining costs to investors and return to seeking an external company to handle printing. We believe in this project however investors and outside printing will change costs, impacting how much we will be able to return to the community. We will still make it a reality and continue to work towards our original goal of giving as much back as possible.


The Impact

This project will enable anyone to develop their fame, make new connections and earn an income while striving to be better at what they love. It can offer compelling reasons for Cosplayers and Photographers to collaborate and create new works of art, and grow the community we love so much. It will destroy the expectation that one has to be famous or sponsored to even have a chance at selling prints and developing fame. It will connect you to new fans, friends and lovers of creativity. It will change the face of Cosplay for everyone.

For us, as photographers, this will open new streams of revenue and help bring the Geek specialty of photography even further into the mainstream. As parents it will allow us to introduce our children to more amazing Cosplayers and Photographers and help them realize their dream of meeting them all.

We have over the last 6 months poured all of our time, effort and money into creating this website and now we are counting on you to help us bring it into reality. We can not thank you enough for reading, watching and sharing this passion with us.

Sincerely and Thankfully,
Jessie and Courtney Pozzolo

Ps.

Aria, Tevye and Kyrene say: Thank you! We can't wait to see what you are Cosplaying!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, could you make some noise about our campaign?
Tell your friends, family, neighbors, anime club or local Youtuber about us! Know someone at Kotaku? Get them excited too!
Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Google + or Pintrest. Any place you can! Don't forget Indiegogo has sharing features right on this page!

story:
Who's Jack then?

I'm a 25 year old professional wildlife photographer and cameraman though I seem to be appearing in front of the lens more often recently! I'm from Nottingham but have had the fortune to travel to most corners of the UK with my job. I'm mostly known for my underwater work, particularly with fish, being dubbed 'The Fish Twitcher' by the BBC (careful searching “fish twitcher” on Google, other things may appear). Although fish are a central interest for me,I'm passionate about all aspects of natural history, getting excited about everything from slime mould to orcas, and everything in-between. 

 

I use photography as a tool (or excuse) to engage with wildlife and help in my own way with conservation. I also teach photography at Nottingham Trent University & University of Nottingham not to mention my own courses. I see that theres a huge demand for people wanting to learn more about wildlife photography and a TV show seemed like a no brainer to me, hence why your reading this.

Why Wildlife Photography?

There hasn't been a wildlife photography show on TV a while so we are definitely due one, I'm aiming to showcase the brilliant wildlife of the UK for the first season but the format could go much further afield if its a success. I want to show simple techniques and helpful advice that anyone can put to use in there own work no matter what lever they are at. As well as the photographic side I want to show how photography can be used to benefit conservation.

By donating your helping make this a reality and getting this pilot done professionally and the time and effort it deserves.

 

The Rewards and who's involved.

We have been quite fortunate that a few groups have stepped forward to donate rewards and help with the campaign including -

  • Affinity who are the campaign's principle sponsors who have already funded most of the project. Affinity is a fantastic piece of photographic software ideal for editing, enhancing and organising your workflow. The additional £3000 we are asking for is to help pay for sound recording equipment, travel to Shetland and editing the final film. 
  • THE FIRST 30 BACKERS OF ANY PERK WILL RECEIVE A FREE COPY OF AFFINITY FOR MAC OR WINDOWS

   

  • We've got some great perks (not me the incentives) on offer including discounts on brands like Weird Fish clothing, Opticron and Fotospeed. Also a one off, unique, 3 day workshop with myself and cameraman Josh Jaggard with the choice of location in Norfolk, or the Peak District. 

  • Shetland Nature have very kindly agreed to help with finding species when filming in Shetland. They are a premiere tour company on the islands.

The Impact

  • Wildlife in the UK is in a worrying decline. The 2016 “State of Nature” report says; over the last 50 years 56% of species have declined, while 15% are at risk of disappearing from our shores altogether. If we can generate some interest in people actively searching out more wildlife people may be more likely to care about what happens to it. Wildlife photography is the perfect activity to generate this interest.

  • I successfully crowdfunded a film in 2013 called 'Beneath the Waterline', raising £3,500 to film a short documentary on freshwater fish.

  • We are going to be posting on social media regularly from behind the scenes, so do get in touch if you have suggestions, ideas, or want to take part in some way! #wildexpo 
    Facebook Page
    Twitter 

Risks & Challenges

Shetland was always my first choice for a place to film this pilot, as it really is a stunning part of the country, but being so remote it has its challenges, with rough weather, and animals not always playing ball. To minimise the risk I'm spending three weeks on the island of Unst to give me lots of time to allow for bad weather days. As with any wildlife nothing is ever guaranteed so exact content for the show won't be released until we've got some sequences in the bag.

We have put dates for sending out merchandise and prints and while we will try to stick to the dates provided delays may occur though unlikely. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone will have the funds to help financially, but you can share the project around for nothing which would be greatly appreciated! Indiegogo has share tools at the top of the page, and we also have our Twitter and Facebook pages.
story_txt:
Who's Jack then?
I'm a 25 year old professional wildlife photographer and cameraman though I seem to be appearing in front of the lens more often recently! I'm from Nottingham but have had the fortune to travel to most corners of the UK with my job. I'm mostly known for my underwater work, particularly with fish, being dubbed 'The Fish Twitcher' by the BBC (careful searching “fish twitcher” on Google, other things may appear). Although fish are a central interest for me,I'm passionate about all aspects of natural history, getting excited about everything from slime mould to orcas, and everything in-between. 
 

I use photography as a tool (or excuse) to engage with wildlife and help in my own way with conservation. I also teach photography at Nottingham Trent University & University of Nottingham not to mention my own courses. I see that theres a huge demand for people wanting to learn more about wildlife photography and a TV show seemed like a no brainer to me, hence why your reading this.
Why Wildlife Photography?
There hasn't been a wildlife photography show on TV a while so we are definitely due one, I'm aiming to showcase the brilliant wildlife of the UK for the first season but the format could go much further afield if its a success. I want to show simple techniques and helpful advice that anyone can put to use in there own work no matter what lever they are at. As well as the photographic side I want to show how photography can be used to benefit conservation.

By donating your helping make this a reality and getting this pilot done professionally and the time and effort it deserves.
 

The Rewards and who's involved.
We have been quite fortunate that a few groups have stepped forward to donate rewards and help with the campaign including -



Affinity who are the campaign's principle sponsors who have already funded most of the project. Affinity is a fantastic piece of photographic software ideal for editing, enhancing and organising your workflow. The additional £3000 we are asking for is to help pay for sound recording equipment, travel to Shetland and editing the final film. 
THE FIRST 30 BACKERS OF ANY PERK WILL RECEIVE A FREE COPY OF AFFINITY FOR MAC OR WINDOWS

   
We've got some great perks (not me the incentives) on offer including discounts on brands like Weird Fish clothing, Opticron and Fotospeed. Also a one off, unique, 3 day workshop with myself and cameraman Josh Jaggard with the choice of location in Norfolk, or the Peak District. 


Shetland Nature have very kindly agreed to help with finding species when filming in Shetland. They are a premiere tour company on the islands.

The Impact

Wildlife in the UK is in a worrying decline. The 2016 “State of Nature” report says; over the last 50 years 56% of species have declined, while 15% are at risk of disappearing from our shores altogether. If we can generate some interest in people actively searching out more wildlife people may be more likely to care about what happens to it. Wildlife photography is the perfect activity to generate this interest.
I successfully crowdfunded a film in 2013 called 'Beneath the Waterline', raising £3,500 to film a short documentary on freshwater fish.
We are going to be posting on social media regularly from behind the scenes, so do get in touch if you have suggestions, ideas, or want to take part in some way! #wildexpo Facebook PageTwitter 


Risks & Challenges
Shetland was always my first choice for a place to film this pilot, as it really is a stunning part of the country, but being so remote it has its challenges, with rough weather, and animals not always playing ball. To minimise the risk I'm spending three weeks on the island of Unst to give me lots of time to allow for bad weather days. As with any wildlife nothing is ever guaranteed so exact content for the show won't be released until we've got some sequences in the bag.
We have put dates for sending out merchandise and prints and while we will try to stick to the dates provided delays may occur though unlikely. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that not everyone will have the funds to help financially, but you can share the project around for nothing which would be greatly appreciated! Indiegogo has share tools at the top of the page, and we also have our Twitter and Facebook pages.

story:
Hi,

I am Daryl Banks, I am a professional photographer and I came out as being transgender this past November to all my friends, family and clients. Coming out in the public forum was not an easy choice to make but after a long conversation with my father I was reminded of the importance of doing the right thing even if it makes things harder for me.

That is why I am here looking for your help.

I am looking to raise funds for a conceptual photography project about the experience of crossing over from one expression of gender to another.

Crossing The Gender Barrier

My Photography Project on Being Trans

My new photography project is about what it means to "pass" as a trans person and the varying degrees of tolerance and acceptance that is granted to transgender persons based on how well they meet the stereotypes and desired psychical characteristics of their target gender. Society may be tolerant of trans people but this is usually when no one can tell they are trans and unfortunately this leaves a lot of people sitting out in the dark who might not "pass" well enough to feel that tolerance. Unfortunately how well one "passes" in their target gender is very contingent on how much money they have.

Through raising visibility and dialogue I hope we can move pass tolerance and into open acceptance for all transgender people in all stages and degrees of gender expression.

I will be exploring issues such as passing, gender archetypes and the process of transitioning from one gender role to another through two separate but intertwining photo projects.

Part One

The main component of the series will be using the visual narrative of tableaux (staged) photography to express the ideas and feelings I have towards my own transition and the conflict I have with socially constructed gender norms in what I see as a very narrow and limiting gender binary system. Specifically I am going to focus on archetypes of male and female gender roles in contemporary western society and what expectations and roles come along with that. It is my hope that I will be able to work with people from various backgrounds and classes. It is also my intention to stay clear from overly sexualized imagery that only celebrates trans people if they have sex appeal or can be fetishized. The photos will be taken in studio and on location over the next several months. With tableaux photography the importance of the scene, location, lighting, props and wardrobe are an important part of the visual language and essential to the story being told.

Part Two

The second component of my project will be a series of portraits that will be manipulated through the process of traditional polaroid transfers. Polaroid transfers work by peeling apart the negative image from the photo paper before the print is finished developing and then applying that same negative image with the emulsion to a different surface of your choosing. The symbolic use of polaroid transfers for this project comes from the ability to pull the negative image away from the receiving paper and transfer that negative image (and the emulsion) to a surface of my choice for a look of my choosing. Thus the process of polarid transfers have come to represent my gender transition from a presumed surface and outcome to one that I can choose to play with for my own desired outcome and aesthetic taste. The lack of clarity and hence mysterious charm of polaroid transfers will also serve as a visual representation of the misconceptions and confusion the general public has about trans people.


By helping to fund my project you are helping me bring about visibility to the various trans communities and hopefully bring about more acceptance of trans people.


List of Expenses

Polaroid Film                          $500

Camera Rental                       $300

Lighting Equip.                       $300

Studio Rental                         $2000

Props                                   $1000

Assistant                                $300

Costume + Wardrobe              $1000

Makeup Artist                        $1000

Printing                                 $1500

Funding cost                           $400

Misc                                     $1700

Total                                 $10, 000


What If I Don't Raise The Bling?

It would be awesome if I can raise the funds to see my vision through but I realize I might be dreaming pretty big.

The project will continue regardless of how much money is raised and I would simply scale the project down to accommodate a smaller budget. I have a pretty clear vision of what I want to do and it would be amazing to have access to the costumes, props and tools I need in order to share my vision with others as accurately as possible.

Scroll down to see all the cool perks and deals I am offering like prints, postcards and even photo sessions!

The Impact

While I am looking at raising question about the confinements and structure of a narrow binary gender system my main goal is raise awareness around the various trans communities that need much more support, and a louder voice.

My photography has been published on the covers and pages of several international magazines and my work has been displayed in art galleries from Canada to Holland. For the last few years I have worked as a wedding photographer and before that I worked as a studio photographer and photo assistant to several commercial photographers. I have a lot of experience lighting sets in studio and on location and I believe I have a solid track record as a professional and creative photographer to pull this project off. When the series is near completion I will begin looking for a gallery to show the work. In addition to a gallery show I will also be building a blog in the new year to act as a hub for my transgender related projects. The blog will feature works in progress, outtakes, some writings, and several smaller series of photo essays.

Even if you can't help with money please help me spread the word about what I am doing by sharing on your blog, twitter, facebook, wherever. It is all greatly appreciated and will help me immensely with my own project and also with keeping a dialog going. Trans rights have come along way but there is still a long road ahead.

Follow these links to see my photography portfolio's

Wedding Photography

Personal Photography 

Warm regards,

Daryl

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Catherine Harwick, I am a 3rd semister student at The Southeast Center for Photographic Studies at Daytona State College. I am earning my Assiciates Degree and my dream is to own my own photography business. Providing family's with quality discounted on location portrait packages.
My husband and I will head the business. He will take care of the Graphic Arts (video, website, editing) and I will capture unique slices of the life to create lasting memorries.
Currently, we are a one income house hold and times are hard. The sooner I can get my home based LLC off the ground, get my name (Slice of Life Photoz) registered with the Small Business Administration, I can start contrubuting to my famiy.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

We need $2000.00 to pay for start up costs, including registring my business name, obtaining LLC, and purchising supplies. If my goal is not reached I will use all of what is graciously contributed to atleast obtain the rights to my business name. I would love to honor each contributer individually by posting Thank You's to Face Book and on my personal blog.

 

The Impact

You will be helping us change our lives for the better. To be able to afford to open my own business is like winning the lottery.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my website and like my facebook page.
FB: www.facebook.com/sliceoflifephotoz
 
Website: http://catherine-harwick.wix.com/sliceoflifephotoz

story:
BlueHour Photo Ventures - Travel Photography Workshop Business

We are Lauren Chagaris and Paul Nguyen, two photographers who started a business ten months ago called BlueHour Photo Ventures with the mission of creating affordable hands-on learning opportunities for beginner to intermediate photographers in the most pristine natural environments around the world. These on-location workshops offer an immersive multi-day experience in very personal group settings. We hope to offer our students an array of photo destinations to choose from, but this cannot be done simply overnight.

Research and development of workshops starts at least one year prior, as we always scout a location at the same time of year that we would offer the workshop, to ensure consistency in climate, lighting angles, and floral and faunal composition.

Planning and scouting is hard work. We arrive at a location prepared, having virtually “pre-scouted” the terrain, moon/sun cycles, and angles of sunlight through mapping and surveying programs. Then, on location, we visually determine the best compositions, and confirm the ideal shooting times for creating the most impactful images of a certain landmark, which we can then incorporate into the curriculum for the workshop we create for the following year. 

With your help, our next scouting trip will take place in the Northern Rocky Mountains of Alberta, British Columbia, and Montana immediately following our Mount Rainier and Olympic National Park workshop this August 2015. Your pledge will not only make it possible for us to conduct our scouting with the level of professionalism that we insist on, but could even give you the opportunity to participate in the workshop we create in the Northern Rockies for 2016, or any of our others being offered. At the very least, you’ll have a beautiful photo to decorate your home with. 

Though our first teaching experience as a business was just last September, we’ve since already fully booked several workshops to Maine, South Carolina and Oregon. Guiding our students in gaining confidence in photography has proven to us that we have the formula for success, and now all we need is the financial means to make our dreams for this business a reality. 

The Future of BlueHour Photo Ventures

There are many other locations that we would like our clients to experience and photograph. Workshop locations must always be scouted beforehand in order to know when and where to take the best shots, creating a fabulous learning experience for our clients. However, we are limited by time, as we both have full-time careers that we cannot simply neglect if we want to eat and pay rent. Research and development of the workshops is absolutely key, and we would be able to do more of this if funded.

Your Donation

What would your donation mean to us? It would essentially buy us the time we need, as well as make it possible financially, to research and scout locations that have been beyond our reach. In particular, the northern rockies is a stunningly beautiful area and is a must for anyone interested in nature photography. With your help, we plan to scout Banff and Yoho national parks in Alberta and Glacier National Park in Montana. Through this, we will design a thorough and cohesive educational experiences in this location for potential future workshops. Let us help you photograph the most amazing nature location and create your most beautiful and unique shots. Overall, your funding would give us a headstart in making BlueHour Photo Ventures the focus of our careers.

Our Itinerary

August 13: Fly from Seattle, WA to Calgary, AB

August 14-17: Scouting Banff National Park

  • Moraine Lake
  • Lake Minnewanka
  • Lake Louise
  • Vermillion Lakes
  • Johnston Canyon
  • Mistaya Canyon 

August 18-21: Scouting Yoho National Park, BC

  • Emerald Lake
  • Takakkaw Falls
  • Lake OHara
  • Burgess Shale Formation - Fossil Field
  • Wapta Falls Natural Bridge

August 22: Fly from Calgary, AB to Kalispell, MT (near Glacier National Park)

August 23-27: Scouting Glacier National Park

  • St. Mary Lake
  • Swiftcurrent Lake
  • Lake McDonald
  • Grinnell Glacier
  • Two Medicine Lake 
  • Hidden Lake 
  • Iceberg Lake Trail 
  • Cracker Lake 
  • Virginia Falls
  • Garden Wall 
  • Logan Pass

Reasons for Funding - Breakdown of Expenses

  • Airfare Seattle to Calgary: $80-100 x 2 = $160-200
  • Airfare Calgary to Kalispell, MT: $110-125 x 2 = $220-250
  • Airfare Kalispell to Boston: $260 x 2 = $520

Total Airfare: $900-$970

  • Rental Car Banff & Yoho (from Calgary): $60 x 8= $480
  • Rental Car Glacier (from Kalispell): $60/day x 5 = $300

Total Rental Car: $780

  • Miles/(Miles/Gallon)x(Cost/Gallon) - using 20 miles/gallon
  • Gas Calgary airport to Banff & Yoho and back: $2.87 x 120 Miles = $17.22
  • Gas Banff & Yoho: $2.87/Gallon x 600 Miles = $86.10
  • Gas Kalispell airport to Glacier and back: $2.30/Gallon x 86 Miles = $9.89
  • Gas Glacier: $2.30/Gallon x 500 = $57.50

Total Gas: Approx. $170

  • Canada National Park Pass (entry to Canada parks for all days for both of us): $108
  • Banff Campsite: $25/night x 5 = $125
  • Yoho Campsite: $20/night x 4 = $80
  • Glacier Campsite: $20/night x 5 = $100

*We will already have a US National Park Pass to cover Glacier.

Total Passes & Campsites: $413 

Total Food: $15 x 14 days x 2 people= $420

Total known Expenses: $2733 - 2803

*Other expenses:

Living expenses, in which we are swallowing the cost for rent, etc. while away

Kickstarter Fee: 5% of earnings

Taxes: Depends on our accounting details

Credit Card Fee: 3-5% of earnings

Rewards, but we won't know exactly how much that will be until the end.

*Any funding beyond our goal will go towards better rewards, backup and upgraded equipment, and the scouting of new photography destinations.

Current Workshop Locations (some of your potential prints by Paul Nguyen)

Please click HERE to view other prints to choose from!

Photos of our Workshops

Gas Kalispell airport to Glacier and back: $2.30/Gallon x 86 Miles = $9.89
Gas Glacier: $2.30/Gallon x 500 = $57.50
Total Gas: Approx. $170
Canada National Park Pass (entry to Canada parks for all days for both of us): $108
Banff Campsite: $25/night x 5 = $125
Yoho Campsite: $20/night x 4 = $80
Glacier Campsite: $20/night x 5 = $100
*We will already have a US National Park Pass to cover Glacier.Total Passes & Campsites: $413 Total Food: $15 x 14 days x 2 people= $420Total known Expenses: $2733 - 2803*Other expenses:Living expenses, in which we are swallowing the cost for rent, etc. while awayKickstarter Fee: 5% of earningsTaxes: Depends on our accounting detailsCredit Card Fee: 3-5% of earningsRewards, but we won't know exactly how much that will be until the end.*Any funding beyond our goal will go towards better rewards, backup and upgraded equipment, and the scouting of new photography destinations.Current Workshop Locations (some of your potential prints by Paul Nguyen)

 Mount Rainier and Olympic National Park, Washington

 Coastal Oregon and Columbia River Gorge

story:
Welcome to Sucker Punched 4!

We had so much success with Sucker Punched 3 (105% Funded!) and got so many requests to run another series, we had to bring things back for another go 'round. 

What is Sucker Punched?

I'm glad you asked! Sucker Punched is a photography series, wherein we take some of the many amazing, talented, inspiring women we know and we give them the SP treatment, a transformation into an original action hero. These women, in cooperation with our creative team, become badass, dangerous, gorgeous, iconic figures to match anything you'd find in a comic book or action movie. A character of their own making, an alter ego they get to become. 

Sucker Punched was primarily inspired by the 2011  Zack Snyder film, Sucker Punch. When we started doing a few test shoots,matching the tone and style, the project later grew and took on a sense of empowerment and agency. We had a lot of models interested in doing a shoot of this style and a lot of fans interested in seeing more. With great power came great responsibility, and as people shared their stories with us, we felt compelled to create something with a social statement and give to an organization that's given so much to so many, RAINN.

Our goal with Sucker Punched is to present original characters created in the style of powerful archetypes. We've got designs drawn from the best of fiction, local and regional models who will knock it out of the park,  fine photographic skills, and the costumes/hair/makeup/props to bring it all together. The models involved are presented as a celebration of powerful women, dangerous and strong. 

More than just a traditional "ladies with weapons in skimpy outfits" project, Sucker Punched is looking to showcase women at their strongest. There is no need to sacrifice femininity for strength. The women of this work are strong, powerful, beautiful and deadly. By subverting and reworking the stereotypical archetypes of "sexy girls" into powerful icons, we create a world where women aren't powerful in spite of their gender, but because of it. The goal is the celebration of empowerment, not debasement.

Drawing from sources large and small - the Valkyrie, Sarah Connor, Johanna Dark, Aeon Flux, Kill Bill, Tomb Raider, Firefly, Appleseed, Resident Evil, Underworld, Mad Max: Fury Road, The Matrix,Wonder Woman, Black Widow, Legend of The Seeker, Xena: Warrior Princess, and many more - we've crafted a series of characters and set ups that we think showcase a strong, solid and fun concept.

The "bad guys", as it were, are all off screen. They're the everyday struggles of the world. They're the perpetrators of abuse, discrimination, prejudice, assault. The foes you can't physically strike at, but must battle everyday nonetheless. Sucker Punched creates a photographic kick to the face to all these dark forces. We show the women of this project at their strongest, a fighter, a warrior of light. While the last few years have seen a sharp uptick in female heroes, we still have a long way to go. The women warriors of Sucker Punched are nobody's love interest, nobody's sidekick, nobody's damsel-in-distress. They are the hero of the story. 

 

What We Need

Why are we crowdfunding? Good question

  • We need help offsetting our expenses. Money is required for studio time, costumes, prop weapons, hair products, makeup,  and travel. We're also keen on paying the artists who share their talents with us. 
  • We're also giving 10% of our funding to RAINN, and any additional revenue generated from these shoots will also be sent that way. Remember, that's not 10% of our proceeds, or 10% of what's left, that's 10% off the top. The first place we send money is RAINN. 
  • Additionally, we buy a lot of costumes and accessories from small business owners, to help support them. 
  • For your support, you get access to exclusive merch, prints, photobooks, and much more from the series. 

Our first time doing this, we raised $2176 to put towards this project (less Indiegogo's fees). $217.60 immediately went to RAINN. The second time, we raised $1863 (less IGG fees) and $183.30 immediately went to RAINN. The *third time*, we raised 5,325 (less IGG fees) and $532.50 immediately went to RAINN. 

 After RAINN gets their cut, we pour the rest into making the magic happen. 10 characters in series  1,  12 characters in series 2 , and 13 characters in series 3, were created, built, refined and photographed. We produced prints, calendars, a photo book, mugs, and posters and shipped them all over the country to eager fans. 

This year, for Sucker Punched 4....we're going to blow the lid off this ride. The goal this year is to make 20 new characters, and have 6 returning characters from previous seasons. Crazy? Maybe? But I think we can make it happen. 

What You Get

We're offering some fantastic perks with this season! We've trimmed a few unpopular ones, and added a few new ones. As always, we've got lots of great options for prints and images of our SP4 photos. We've got our 16 month calendar (Our most popular perk!).  We've also got some merch (Coffee Mug and Pocket Knife) for those who aren't into prints. We've got our portrait session with FightGuy Photography! We've got hand made artwork from the members of the team! We've got a 95% delivery rate on our perks in previous series, and people love them! Also, every year we've always thrown in a few extra surprises, so you'll get more than you expect!

** Perks will be highlighted in upcoming spotlight posts as the campaign counts down, we're stuck with a 500 character limit on the spaces you see to the right**

Special Military Perk

For any of our backers who are active or former military, we offer a special bonus of an additional print and a personal thank you letter from our team. Please let us know when you submit your perk. 

How are we doing things differently this time around? 

That's an excellent question! First and foremost, we've almost doubled the number of models and characters we will be working with. When we ran our casting call, we received over 80 applications to be in this project. Almost triple what we were expecting. So we're taking a chance and seeing if we can handle so much more. 

Secondly, and we did this a bit in series 3, we're going to open the field up a little bit more, take a bigger step away from the source material, the film Sucker Punch. Because that film was very firearm centric, we made an effort to keep that artistic choice in our work. In the last few years, the national conversation around guns has been lively, to say the least. While we at FightGuy Photography have always held the belief that the world of fantasy violence is distinctly different from the world of actual violence, we recognize the discomfort and the tension around this topic. To that end, this year many of our characters will feature additional weapons and abilities, to take things away from our gun-centric past. Superpowers, Sci-fi weapons, and lots more are all on the list. 

The Impact

What is this project all about? Well, first, it's a heck of a lot of fun. Moreover, it's a project that creates and promotes a positive message. These characters are feminine and powerful. They have full agency over who they are and what they're doing. In today's world, we can't get enough of that.  Additionally you'll help provide exposure and experience to a number of talented young professionals, dancers, actresses, models, makeup artists and costume designers. And of course, I can't mention this enough, you'll be helping us help RAINN. 

The models in these photo series have told us time and time again how healing this process is for them. How strong and heroic they feel. How they think back to their character when times are tough and that keeps them moving. It's really magical and I'm thrilled we have a project that lets us create and share that with our fans. 

Risks & Challenges

What are we risking? Well if we can't pull this off, if we can't raise the money and make this happen, well, that's a bummer. We love this project with all our hearts and we love seeing it fly. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing to this project is not your thing, that's totally ok! Not to worry. We appreciate you being here, watching our videos and reading this post about it. 

Still want to help, but not sure how? Not to worry!

  • You can share this project with your social circles. Tell them the work we're putting in and what caught your attention. Indiegogo provides loads of tools to share with all the major social networks. 
  • You can follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram at FightGuyPhoto
  • You can donate directly to RAINN. They make it as painless as possible and you'll be giving to an organization that fights for and saves people every day. 

Thank you for checking out this project, we do hope you'll take a moment to sign up, become a part of our beloved backer team, and share the project with your friends. 

Our backers get detailed, behind-the-scenes access, but you can also follow along with us on Facebook (at FightGuy Photography and in our fan group), and on Instagram. 

 

Be sure to check out our Updates tab to see the latest news and more details about our models and perks!

story:
Thank you all so much for helping me raise the minimum goal of $1,000! This campaign will remain open until August 15th, so there is still time to contribute and pick your favorite perk.  If you will peruse the trip budget below, you will see why my ultimate fundraising goal is $5,000+.  Thank you again for your current and future support!


My goal is to produce a meaningful, visual story about the volunteer tourism opportunities in Peru that will be published in a photo book and online.  Peru is a country with vastly different landscapes from desert coastlines to grand mountain ranges and Amazon River jungles.  I have chosen volunteer organizations in differing regions to demonstrate the diversity of geography and volunteer opportunities available to those who would like to add meaning to their travel experience.  Images produced will range from capturing aspects of everyday life and culture, volunteer activities, and the grandeur of the ever-changing earth.


Can I do it? Can I hack it in the jungle? Can I survive the incredible altitudes of the Andes Mountains? Can I learn from the experiences there and teach others through the visual work I produce?


Conquering fear is another big thing of mine. Fear stops us all from being happy and experiencing things that may enrich us or may teach us a valuable lesson! Although I fell in love with rain forests many years ago when traveling in Costa Rica, I admit that I am a bit apprehensive about spending a month in the jungle with no electricity and no roads, but because I fear it, I must face it. Giant tarantulas and all!!!!! Aieeeeeeee!


I live to travel, because travel feels like the best way to learn about others, as well as about myself, and each trip helps me determine areas in my life which need adjustment. I want to ask questions and learn how we are the same, how we are different and why? Understanding is the key to peace. In this ever-more-connected world, I want to learn how different cultures deal with their similar problems.  I do not go there with the idea that I can fix it, but rather I offer the ability to photograph and demonstrate what I observe. It's an exchange, through sharing thoughts and ideas, perhaps better options will be within our reach. Visually telling the stories is a goal, but being fully involved in the experience, not always making photos, is also a goal. Just learning and understanding and contributing what I can, wherever I can. There is much for everyone to gain when we try to really get beyond the surface of things when we travel, so this project is to share the experiences I have while doing what has become known as volunteer tourism. I picked Peru for many reasons, but I picked the broader category of a Spanish-speaking country first. I've found that language can be one of the biggest barriers during my travels. Communication is still possible and wonderful, but true depth comes when there is a common language. My Spanish is rusty at the moment, so a lengthier stay to rectify that is in order.


Project Itinerary

Arrive in Lima, Peru.
Take a flight from Lima to Pucallpa.
Hire a driver to take me to Neshuya, and an additional driver to take me to Curimana.
Travel by boat to Bello Horizonte and on to Esperanza Verde.
Spend one month at Esperanza Verde, the first wildlife rescue center/rain forest conservation group in Ucayali, Peru. Work will include:

  • Assisting with animal care-taking, including feeding and cage cleaning.
  • Reforestation, planting seeds and seedlings at the tree nursery as well as planting fruit trees for the future animals in the rescue center.
  • Collecting an inventory of the various species of fauna and flora existing on the land.

From Esperanza Verde, make trek back to Lima.
Fly from Lima to Cusco.
In Cusco, check into local hostel, and attend orientation at Aldea Yanapay.
Spend one month volunteering with local underprivileged youth.  Tutoring and activities with the kids are based at the Cultural Center Aldea Yanapay and the Yanapay School, tasks will include:

  • Assisting with homework.
  • Teaching English.
  • Teaching arts and cultural classes.
  • Playing educational games.
  • Assisting with projects such as their Cinema Project, which involves watching films with the kids and using the films as a tool for analyzing and understanding diverse facts, ways of thinking, and ways of living as represented through films. 

While in Cusco, it is also a goal to walk the Inca Trail and see Machu Picchu, as these ruins are a key cultural and scenic component to the people living in Cusco.
Fly from Cusco back to Lima.
Take bus from Lima to Huaraz in the Andes Mountains.
In Huaraz, I will spend one month volunteering with Seeds of Hope, a small NGO that works with around 60 children aged between 6 and 18 who are at high risk of dropping out of public school and with a small number of children who do not attend public school, in order to raise the standard of their reading and writing to enable them to enter the education system. A supportive educational environment to assist with homework is provided, which is crucial because most of the kids come from families where the parents have to work long hours to support the family and often cannot read or write themselves. Educating the parents about the importance of their children staying in schools and the long-term benefits this will bring to the children and family is another aspect of the work. As a volunteer I will tutor students in a variety of subjects, as well as teach a variety of subjects to help enrich the student's educational experience.

From Huaraz I will return to Lima, and spend between 2-4 weeks in the desert coastal region, photographing the landscape as well as the culture.  There is a tentative volunteer option for this region, as well, but details are not finalized.


Your Funding & Perks

I'm asking for a minimum of $1,000 in funding because while the trip will cost me at least $6k (see general trip budget below), the $1,000 or more you provide will solidify the need for me to complete the project despite any and all challenges faced along the way. I won't be earning any income for the months while I'm there, but this is my life's calling, finding and photographing the good in the world, so the risk is worth it. There is no limit on how much money may be raised above the minimum during this time. Think of it this way, you're funding the creation of your future art collection piece! My time period for being in Peru will be for the months of August-November.  This campaign will be ongoing during part of the time I am in Peru, and although I will not have access to electricity or communication while in the jungle, at any point when I have access, I will certainly provide trip updates along the way.


It would, of course, rock my socks right off if you generous souls out there funded the entire travel period of the project in Peru, and it would cause me to weep and grovel at your feet in absolute gratitude if you somehow pooled together to additionally sustain me financially upon my return when I will be spending additional months putting all the work together on websites, in the coffee table book and making prints. With additional time funded, a multi-media documentary could be produced as well. But that's the blue sky big picture! Anything from the goal of $1,000 and above will be amazingly helpful, will have my deepest thanks, and will be rewarded as described in the Perks section of this page! Hand-written postcards from Peru, archival-quality signed prints, photo books, my stuffed monkey and a personalized video message from me - with trip footage - potentially with me handling the dreaded tarantula - are amongst the perks available!


Is there a perk I've not listed that would inspire you to fund? By all means, let me know what you would like, and I will try to accommodate! 


General Trip Budget (No post-production time/costs are included)

  • Yellow Fever & Rabies Vaccinations for Jungle Travel - $865
  • Round-trip airfare Memphis - Lima - Memphis - $1,400
    Jason generously covered this with his airline mileage!
  • Round-trip airfare Lima - Pucallpa - Lima - $215
  • One month's room & board at Esperanza Verde - $300
  • Round-trip airfare Lima - Cusco - Lima - $320
  • One month's room & board in Cusco - approx $500
  • 4-day Inca Trail Trek - approx $400
  • Round-trip bus fare Lima - Huaraz - Lima - approx $50
  • One month's room & board in Huaraz - approx $500
  • Travel expenses in desert coastal region for 2-4 weeks - Approx $500
  • Fixed expenses back home (which must continue to be paid in my absence) - $400/month - so, at 4 months = $1,600

Total (minus unexpected and/or unplanned costs - which there always are): $6,615 now $5,250. 


I thank you for your time in reviewing my proposal, and for any support you may provide! Don't forget to check out the Perks, and If you know anyone else who may be interested in this project, please spread the word!


-Amie

Playing educational games.
