 watching films with the kids and using the films as a tool for 
analyzing and understanding diverse facts, ways of thinking, and ways of
 living as represented through films. 
While in Cusco, it is also a goal to walk the Inca Trail and see
 Machu Picchu, as these ruins are a key cultural and scenic component to
 the people living in Cusco.Fly from Cusco back to Lima.Take bus from Lima to Huaraz in the Andes Mountains.In
 Huaraz, I will spend one month volunteering with Seeds of Hope, a small
 NGO that works with around 60 children aged between 6 and 18 who are at
 high risk of 
dropping out of public school and with a small number of children who do
 not 
attend public school, in order to raise the standard of their reading 
and writing to enable them to enter the education system. A supportive 
educational environment to assist with homework is provided, which is 
crucial because most of the kids come from families where the parents 
have to work long hours to support the family and often cannot read or 
write themselves. Educating the parents about the importance of their 
children staying in schools and the long-term benefits this will bring 
to the children and family is another aspect of the work. As a volunteer
 I will tutor students in a variety of subjects, as well as teach a 
variety of subjects to help enrich the student's educational experience.
 From Huaraz I will return to Lima, and spend between 2-4 
weeks in the desert coastal region, photographing the landscape as well 
as the culture.  There is a tentative volunteer option for this region, 
as well, but details are not finalized. Your Funding & PerksI'm asking for a minimum of $1,000 in funding because while the trip will cost me at least $6k (see general trip budget below), the
 $1,000 or more you provide will solidify the need for me to complete 
the project despite any and all challenges faced along the way. I 
won't be earning any 
income for the months while I'm there, but this is my life's calling, finding and photographing the good in the world, so
 the risk is worth it. There is no limit 
on how much money may be raised above the minimum during this time. 
Think of it this way, you're funding the creation of your future art 
collection piece! My time period for being in Peru will be for the months of August-November.  This campaign will be ongoing during part of the time I am in Peru, and although I will not have access to electricity or communication while in the jungle, at any point when I have access, I will certainly provide trip updates along the way.It
 would, of course, rock my 
socks right off if you generous souls out there funded the entire travel
 period of the project in Peru, and it would cause me to weep and grovel
 at your feet in absolute 
gratitude if you somehow pooled together to additionally sustain me 
financially upon my return when I 
will be spending additional months putting all the work together on 
websites, in the coffee table book and making prints. With additional 
time funded, 
a multi-media documentary could be produced as well. But that's 
the blue sky big picture! Anything from the goal of $1,000 and above 
will be 
amazingly helpful, will have my deepest thanks, and will be rewarded as 
described in the Perks section of this page! Hand-written postcards 
from Peru, archival-quality signed prints, photo books, my stuffed 
monkey and a personalized video message from me - with trip footage - 
potentially with me handling the dreaded tarantula - are amongst the perks available! Is there a perk I've not listed 
that would inspire you to fund? By all means, let me know what you 
would like, and I will try to accommodate! General Trip Budget (No post-production time/costs are included)
Yellow Fever & Rabies Vaccinations for Jungle Travel - $865


Round-trip airfare Memphis - Lima - Memphis - $1,400Jason generously covered this with his airline mileage!

Round-trip airfare Lima - Pucallpa - Lima - $215
One month's room & board at Esperanza Verde - $300
Round-trip airfare Lima - Cusco - Lima - $320
One month's room & board in Cusco - approx $500 

4-day Inca Trail Trek - approx $400

Round-trip bus fare Lima - Huaraz - Lima - approx $50
One month's room & board in Huaraz - approx $500
Travel expenses in desert coastal region for 2-4 weeks - Approx $500
Fixed expenses back home (which must continue to be paid in my absence) - $400/month - so, at 4 months = $1,600
Total (minus unexpected and/or unplanned costs - which there always are): $6,615 now $5,250. I thank you for your time in reviewing my proposal, and for any support
 you may provide! Don't forget to check out the Perks, and If you know anyone else who may be interested in 
this project, please spread the word!-Amie

story:
We are a group of students from Swansea Metropolitan University, graduating from the BA (Hons) Photography in the Arts & BA (Hons) Photojournalism courses this summer. This we want to do with a bang. We want to raise money for our end of year degree show in London, part of the Free Range Art & Design Show at the Old Truman Brewery. This is a yearly graduate summer show taking place from the 29th May – 16th July 2012, showcasing some of the hottest new talent in art and design. Our show is taking place from the 21st - 25th of June, with a private opening on Thursday 21st. 

As photography students from Swansea, being able to exhibit in London is not only a great opportunity, but also a luxury, and as with most luxuries it must be paid for. The students are themselves responsible for getting the funds needed, and normally this money comes straight from the students’ pockets and traditional means of fundraising. There are many positive aspects of the traditional ways of fundraising, but we find there are also limitations to it. For example, to donate it often requires you to physically be at the event, and this is not needed with crowd-funding, which gives our family, friends and the general public an easy way to donate.

A photography degree can be very expensive, and especially in the third year, with the graduate show etc., many students struggle to make the ends meet financially, so this year we have decided to try new ways of funding to ensure we leave with the best possible graduate show for all of us.

In total we need to raise £ 13 000 (a small amount of this money will go to the graduate show held in Swansea). So far we have raised £ 12 355, but we need to raise at least £645. This is the minimum amount needed, and we are hoping to raise at least $1000 (approximately £ 630) with 'indiegogo'. 

By raising this money, we can create a show, which begins, to not only put our work, but ourselves into a professional creative industry. 

The work we have produced and developed over the last 3 years culminates in this exhibition. The money will contribute towards creating a visually stimulating and exciting show, as the more funds we can raise, the better quality of the show we can produce. We want to create a quality show to present our work in the best way possible.

Having the London Show will also widen our opportunity to network, and start the process of having our work seen by the current professionals in the field. This is the most important time, as once we become graduates, it is critical we begin to get our names, and work known and recognized as it is tough for every new graduate to survive in such a talented and competitive area.

With every financial input we will be extremely grateful, and would appreciate people spreading our cause by any means, facebook, blogs, word of mouth etc. Any donation we recieve would mean a big thank you from us and goes towards a show of great work.

story:
About me

My name is Gerrit. I am a 33 year old photographer and I am currently living in Berlin. I started my photographic career 13 years ago and worked as a freelance photographer for the last 8 years. I am mainly focused on documentary portraiture as I am interested in other peoples lives and a curious person. Taking a portrait of someone makes the encounter last for a long time for me.

 

I traveled to South Afrika and other African countries several times and on different missions and I started getting more involved with the topic of gender based violence, sexual violence and rape after a trip so South Africa and Namibia in 2011.

About sexual violence in South Africa

The numbers that describe the situation are shocking: regarding to different surveys about 30% of the women in South Africa are victims of sexual violence while depending on sources between 25% and 40% of men admit having committed sexual violence or raped a woman.

What I want to do

I want to find out more about how these numbers did arise. So I will be in Johannesburg from May 3rd to June 3rd to create a body of work that consists of photography and text mainly. It is more a humanistic approach and not going to be a academic social study, it will be an artistic-documentary work more than a journalistic work. Maybe it is more about asking questions than actually finding answers.

 

My research started quite some time ago, I have a strong concept and am well prepared. As it is difficult to foresee what will happen or not and how exactly it looks like eventually, I don't want to be too detailed about the concept at this point.

 

My goal is to create content that can be published and exhibited, I think it is important to create more attention and a discussion to be able to change this horrible situation.

Why Indiegogo and what you can do

I financed this whole trip in advance with my own money, so I am independent, what is very important for my work. I decided to start a campaign here to see if I can speed up the work after I am back from South Africa: Film has to be developed and scanned, pictures have to be edited and worked on. Text has to be written, proofread, maybe translated. Different parts of content need to be linked and connected. So a big part of the work actually happens after the content is produced. The money I raise now will push that process, I will be able to see results much quicker. Also I can decide to produce more content or shoot more on film than digitally.

 

I will shoot footage for a picture-diary to document my trip. These pictures will be the base for the perks. You can buy prints from that picture diary. I will shoot analog and digital, colour as well as black and white.

 

The images will be a surprise for all of us, as they have not been made yet, and they will show you my Johannesburg experience. If you buy a print it doesn't only support this work financially but also shows me that you trust in my work and I appreciate that a lot.

 

If you can't afford to buy a print you are of course invited to look at my online diary, spread the word, ask me questions about this project or support me in whatever other way you want!

 


Here are some examples of my work

you can visit my website http://www.gerrithahn.com

story:
It's as simple as this: The photo budget for Women Who Surf  needs help.

Not a ton of help, but a little help. There is a tsunami of great surf photography of women out there - especially after the El Nino winter of 2015/2016 went loco. But book publishing is tough these days and photo budgets are scanty. 

This Indiegogo hopes to boost that photo budget and pay a good price for the best stuff.

(Also, the book still needs a foreword and the publisher - Falcon Guides - hopes to entice Kelly Slater or Lisa Andersen or someone illustrious to write it. Funds could go toward that, too)

Ben Marcus has written profiles on these surfers: 79-year-old "surfagenarian" Janet Macpherson, yoga black belt Alex Westmore, charging pro pioneer Rochelle Ballard, Aussie sensation Sally Fitzgibbons, beginner Rachel Pettit, New Jersey to North Shore charger Wrenna Delgado, the miraculous Bethany Hamilton, ripper Alana Blanchard, death-defying Maya Gabeira, super gnar Keala Kennelly, Maui waterwoman Andrea Moller, soul stylist Leah Dawson, French phenom Pauline Ado, North Shore activist Karen Gallagher, environmental warrior Nancy Hastings, charger and concussion-sufferer Mercedes Maidana, Mullachmore maiden Easkey Britton, Mavericks pioneer Sarah Gerhardt, adventuress Alison Teal, Nor Cal Valkyrie Bianca Valenti, Pe'ahi dominatrix Paige Alms, the charming and glamorous Rosy Hodge, Hawaii's favorite daughter Kelia Moniz and at the end, a love story featuring Florencia Gomez Gerbi and ISA President Fernando Aguerre - the man who will bring surfing to the Tokyo Olympics in 2020.

Speaking of Pauline Ado, check out her video Pauline a la Plage '01.

Fooled ya! Sexism in women's surfing is one of the issues in this book.

Still hoping to get Carissa Moore and Steph Gilmore into the book, but they're both busy getting hitched and taking names.

That's the list now, although the publisher will have their say on who should stay and who should go now.

All of these women have great stories. They have all gotten their butts kicked and suffered a variety of physical, emotional and spiritual traumas: Losing an arm to a shark, almost losing a face to Teahupoo, almost drowning at Nazare, being homeschooled in New Jersey, broken heads, broken Jet Skis, broken boards, broken homes, broken hearts.

Sexism, towism, broism.

Or in the case of Brazilian charger Maya Gabeira: Being raised by a brave, radical leftist father who kidnapped the American ambassador, went to jail, inspired a movie (Four Days in September) and wore a green thong bikini on the beach at Ipanema that even shocked Rio.

Read about Maya's dear old dad and you will understand why Maya is so brave from Chopes to Nazare. It's a great story.

Women Who Surf offers a tidal wave of drama, but all of these women have persevered, drawing their strength from the ocean - and giving it back with style and courage from Malibu  to Mavericks to Maui.

The stories are written, but the photo budget needs pumping up. Simple as that. There is a lot of great photography out there from the likes of Lucia Griggi, Erik Aeder, Fred Pompermayer, Elizabeth Pepin-Silva, Jim Russi, John Bilderback, Jeff Divine, Gordinho, GoPro Selfie and a lot of talented pro and hobby photographers.

Sachi Cunningham has stellar photos of Bianca Valenti at Mavericks and Ocean Beach. Sachi risked frostbite, shark attacks and severe poundings to capture these photos, and we want to pay her properly.

It would be nice to pay all these photographers full price for their hard work.

Women Who Surf is going to be an energized book that could be the first in a series.

A lot of women are going to feel left out, and we will let them in the sequel(s).

Mahalo for your kokua.

story:
A long journey into the heart of a struggling country

                                                  

Who was behind the lens ?

At 29, I have a BA in geography and a Master degree in Risks management. I've always been fascinated by photography, geopolitics and Human Rights issues. After having worked for French Ministries, I wish to start a new chapter in my professional life.

As a matter of fact, the photographic project conducted was a real eye-opener. It became crystal-clear I should henceforth focus on the living conditions of citizens in war zones as well as the freedom of speech in struggling countries.


Why did I choose a risky destination?

I wanted to emphasize the changes of opinions during the course of my journey and thus highlight differences existing between the European countries and those in the Eastern part of Europe. This project has been carefully planned months before leaving.

I wanted to understand the conflict and the differing opinions better by doing fieldwork, and to be History's witness by getting involved myself. And in fact, my experience in Ukraine was truly rewarding despite the risks taken.

It was crucial to me to meet citizens who didn't share the same opinion in order to get a neutral point of view myself regarding the issue. Hence, after having met several young citizens, who had or had not been present during the tragic nights of clashes in Kiev, I decided to go to the heart of the conflict in the Donbass region and particularly to Donetsk.

Despite the daily threats, I got the chance to document citizens’ daily lives in a struggling Ukrainian region and to understand the country’s unease.

Why do I need your donations?

Your donation will allow me to partly fund my exhibition that has been close to my heart for several months now. Having met throughout my journey people who have more than once moved me thanks to their generosity, I would now like to ask for yours.

My determination and ambition carried me through several difficult situations but all the same I never gave up. My passion means it was worth taking risks to reach my set goals:

The Ukrainian conflict has been over-covered by medias worldwide, but the living conditions of citizens haven't. I wish to underline this human aspect and exhibit it in a gallery which raises, among others, awareness regarding international issues.

If you're keen on funding my project, your donation will help me bear costs such as:

Sharing the project through social networks is also a major way of supporting my project.

For what it all comes down to in the end is the following:
Conflict zones are raging all over the world, and while medias relay the number of casualties, citizens’ daily living conditions are often silenced.

By supporting my work you can play a part in opposing these pratices.

story:
My Story

Hi my name is Joshua Gordon I am currently a Photography Student at Tunxis Community College in Farmington, CT, graduating in the Spring of 2012. Come this fall I will be flying out to Israel to take part in Oranim's "Tel Aviv Internship Experience" Living in Tel Aviv for Six Months while working at a Photography Studio. While working on a Photo Essay of "The Children of Israel"


Why I Want to Take Part in the "Tel Aviv Internship Experience" 

In the Winter of 08, 09 I took part in Taglit-Birthright Israel. The experience I had was Incredible. When I got back to the States I could not wait to return. I began looking for post birthright programs on MASA ISRAEL. I found Oranim's "Tel Aviv Internship Experience", thinking it would be the perfect fit for me. Living in the land that I love, while launching my career in photography.  Working on on the Photo Essay "The Children of Israel", witch I intended to self publish and have display in small and local galleries in The States when I return. 

My Work as a Photographer and My Photo Essay "The Children of Israel" 

My work as a photographer goes from traditional commercial and fashion photography to incredible original pieces of art. My work is both still life and portraits, capturing them  as if they were film stills.  Please take a look at my Portfolio 

For "The Children of Israel" I would be photographing the many different people of Israel. Breaking down the stereotypes, by telling their story in a portrait. When I first went to Israel I discover this meeting all types of people, all of whom have a great story to tell. Although I work in both still life, commercial, studio portrait, and environmental portraits. My love is for environmental portraits; to be able to get great emanations out of people with just a look, and sometimes a simple prop.

My love is for environmental portraits; to be able to get great emanations out of people with just a look, and sometimes a simple prop.

story:
Afterschoolgirls is a Japanese gravure inspired photobook, and is a tribute to Japanese schoolgirl culture. I've been photographing schoolgirl themes for over a year and curated my favorite photos into this collection.

Right now, Afterschoolgirls is only a digital layout. Besides being a photographer, I'm a professional graphic designer who works in print, so it would be a shame to not have a physical copy of my passion project photobook!

If I were to print a few copies of Afterschoolgirls for myself, it would be unreasonably expensive. For those who aren't familiar with the print industry, costs drop drastically when more copies of the same thing are printed at one time. That is why I created this campaign, so I can print more books and share the costs, along with the benefits, with the supporters!

This campaign, with a modest goal, will fund the professional printing of Afterschoolgirls so that others, who also appreciate Japanese schoolgirl culture, can have their own tangible copy of the book. So if you are as passionate about schoolgirls, photography and bookmaking as I am, please support this endeavor!

 

Here's a quick rundown of the Afterschoolgirls photobook:

  • 7x10" softcover
  • 32 full color pages + cover
  • 59 photos
  • 15 exclusive photos
  • 8 featured schoolgirls
  • 15 outfits

To get your own copy of the book, back the campaign through one of the various perks! But don't delay, this crowdfunding campaign will be the only opportunity to get a copy of Afterschoolgirls! I'm not planning on re-printing the book!
 

Exclusive Photos
You may have seen some Afterschoolgirls photos on Instagram that the models and I have posted, but I've saved the best shots for the book! 15 out of the 59 photos are book exclusive and no one other than the models and I have seen them. Pick up a copy of Afterschoolgirls to see what you're missing!
 

School Portraits
Don't forget to pick up a signed 7x10" print of your favorite schoolgirl! There are six available, featuring five of the girls! They'll fit perfectly into the book, so consider them bonus pages!

You can add the ones you want to your book order during check out, or you can choose one of the themed perks that include two of the prints. You can also add any missing prints you want to a themed perk during check out. If you're not interested in the photobook, you can still support the campaign and pick up the prints on their own!

 

Perk Bundles
You can go with the Back to School or Early Enrollment perks to pick up a photobook, but you can also get the book with a couple of prints through one of the themed perks at a great price!

The Wholesome Homeroom perk includes wholesome, yet cute, portraits of Zekia and 卵 (Tamago). Pretend that Zekia is handing you her confession!

Leap Through Time is a special perk that comes with prints from photosets not featured in the book, but will be in the next one. The two prints are of Rabbittrixs and Tsikyo. Unfortunately there wasn't time or room to include Tsikyo in the first photobook, so I'm offering a print of her to make up for it!

If you're a fan of Miso Tokki, then Spicy MIso is your perk! It comes with a print from our iconic strawberry sailor uniform set and a print from the popular blue PE uniform set! There is also the Maximum Miso, an upgraded version of the bundle, that includes a custom Instax photo of Miso Tokki in a schoolgirl related outfit, and with your choice of pose! They're limited so get one while they're available!

The Honor Roll perk includes the book and all six of the prints in one bundle! It's also the most cost effective way to get every print!

The ほ Package is a special perk that will complete the campaign with one contribution! This is the most comprehensive bundle, and also the most ridiculous, but if you feel inclined, then choose this one of a kind perk!

 

Although it isn't necessary, additional funding would greatly help the campaign! The first amount of extra funds will go towards upgrading Afterschoolgirls with better/thicker paper stock.

I'd also like to print copies for the models who graciously contributed to the project. The shoots were trade-for-print (TFP) so it would be nice to give a little more back to them.

Any funds beyond this will go towards the next volume of Afterschoolgirls. It'll help offset future photoshoot costs like studio rental, transportation, purchasing outfits/props, and many other expenses. 

Here are some Stretch Goal Rewards to help raise additional funds! Let's "ganbaru" and see how many are reached! 


 


$1200 - Upgrade paper stock for the photobook!


$1500 - Release book exclusive photos on social media!


Every $200 after $1500 - Perk upgrade for two lucky backers!
Two backers, chosen at random, who contributed to a perk that included a photobook, get upgraded to Honor Roll! For perks that already include prints, the missing prints will be added. For those who already added all six prints or contributed to the Honor Roll perk will receive a custom Miso Tokki Instax photo, instead of duplicate prints. Remember, you can't join this reward if you don't get a book!


$2000 - Exclusive Afterschoolgirls vinyl stickers!
Every backer, who contributed $20 or more, will receive a sticker illustrated by James Valle (@kentaropjj) exclusively for Afterschoolgirls! James is a friend who happens to be an amazing artist. You may have seen his work at comic and anime convention artist alleys . These will be high quality scratch, sun, and waterproof clear vinyl stickers about 2x3" in size. Put them on your car, laptop, or water bottle to show the world your appreciation for schoolgirls!

 

Afterschoolgirls wouldn't be possible without the talented models that fill its pages. Like me, these girls originated from the cosplay community, and share an interested in Japanese schoolgirl culture. I'd like to introduce you to these talented cosplayers, models, artists, creatives, and influencers:

Cat - From the blue beaches of SoCal to the pink sakura canopies of Japan; our schoolgirl photoshoots have taken us to some fantastic locations across the world!

Hanakima - An expert cosplayer, model, and seamstress; she's the full package!

Miso Tokki - She doesn't fit in any of the Asian sized schoolgirl outfits we get for the photoshoots, but she sure looks good in them!

오유진 (Oh Yujin) - A talented fine artist, who cosplays and models!

Rabbittrixs - A long-time friend who shares similar interests in Japanese culture. She's always up for interesting schoolgirl photoshoots!

卵 (Tamago) - According to her, she's into lewd themed cosplays, and that is why we're friends and enjoy working together!

Tia - A cosplayer and professional fashion designer. She and Cat are friends and make a great schoolgirl pair!

Zekia - She oozes with wholesome schoolgirl! I'm so happy that she's part of the project, making it a more rounded photobook!

Transfer Student Tsikyo - One of the nicest cosplayers I know! We met during an anime convention when I tried to plan a shoot with her. At first her schedule was too packed to shoot,  but the next day she DMed me back and asked if I wanted to do a schoolgirl PE uniform shoot!

 

September 16 - Campaign Launch!

  • All perks will be available.
  • Early Enrollment will be available until quantities or time runs out.

 

During the Campaign

  • I'll continue going over and refining the photobook until I'm 100% satisfied with the design and layout.
  • I've looked into a handful of online printers. One will be chosen and contacted about the photobook order.
  • I'll look into where to print the school portrait rewards.
  • If/when the contributions are nearing the sticker stretch goal: I'll coordinate with the artist on the design.

 

⁠October 11 - Campaign Ends (25 days)
Depending on interest, I may extend the end date.

If the campaign ends successfully:

  • I'll put in the order for the photobooks and the school portrait prints.
    • Photobook will be proofed to make sure nothing goes wrong.
    • If things go smoothly, photobooks should be completed in two to three weeks, and prints should be ready well before then.
  • After rewards are printed, they'll be signed by the schoolgirls.
  • If stretch goals are met:
    • Keep an eye on social media for book exclusive photos!
    • If perk upgrade goals are reached: I'll announce the winners and contact them.
    • If the sticker goal is reached: I'll send out the order for the stickers.

 

Early November

  • Hopefully all the rewards will be ready and shipped out to backers!


I've already contributed my own time and money to get this passion project to where it is now. The photoshoots are in the bag, the layout is complete, and the book is ready for the press! So don't worry about your contribution being wasted on things like research or development; your funds will go directly towards getting Afterschoolgirls into your hands!

But fair warning: Since it is a fixed goal, all contributions will be refunded if the minimum funds are not raised. Unfortunately, that means the photobook will not get printed and none of the rewards will be sent out. I chose to go with a fixed campaign because I rather not receive backers' contributions without giving them a physical copy of the photobook in return.

story:
Short Summary

Il mondo è un luogo magico e vogliamo mostrarvelo.

Kokparbrothers è un team che riunisce due appassionati di vita, viaggi, avventure e, soprattutto, fotografia e video.

Ci definiamo fratelli che condividono la stessa sensibilità e gli stessi interessi. Ognuno ha un talento diverso, personalità diverse, ma siamo uniti da grande affetto reciproco e passione, siamo nel cuore "brothers". Ognuno ha la propria storia e i propri obiettivi, il proprio impegno verso se stesso e per la squadra.

Insieme abbiamo deciso di partecipare al Mongol Rally2019, un viaggio che ci porterà attraverso 26 paesi, per 18.000 km, a bordo di una FIAT 500.

Vogliamo ritrarre questo cammino, dalla terra e dal cielo: 60 giorni sulle rotte carovaniere della Via della Seta mostrando al mondo le culture e i luoghi.

What We Need & What You Get

Il Mongol Rally è un rally non competitivo che ha principalmente scopo benefico.

Vogliamo quindi che il nostro viaggio e la nostra professionalità fotografica si uniscano per realizzare un libro di immagini e racconti.

La realizzazione del libro ci permetterà di dare un valore visuale al contributo che doneremo alle ONG, di ringraziare con un oggetto tangibile i nostri sostenitori e di avere memoria con la bellezza di un'avventura che è dono per noi e per gli altri.

Risks & Challenges

Il viaggio, che dura due mesi e mezzo, sarà sicuramente ricco di meraviglie, ma ci riserverà qualche rischio. Non è un viaggio semplice: le regole impongono un percorso libero ma anche di viaggiare su un mezzo poco potente, senza l'aiuto di navigatori o di tecnologie moderne. Un viaggio alla vecchia maniera, cartina e bussola alla mano, niente autostrade, nessun privilegio, nessuna assistenza. Ci stiamo preparando da un anno agli imprevisti e faremo in modo che tutti possano seguirci attraverso i canali social ma anche con interviste radio e dirette.

Vogliamo che ci sia dialogo e interazione in tempo reale con tutti coloro che seguiranno la nostra avventura. Sarà appassionante accompagnarci con una presenza virtuale nelle nostre sfide quotidiane e si potrà avere un assaggio dell'atmosfera che vogliamo includere nel libro.

Other Ways You Can Help

Se alcune persone pensano di non poterci aiutare economicamente possono fare molto anche condividendo la nostra campagna o le nostre pagina social. Più siamo a conoscere progetto e meglio è!!!

story:
What the heck is this wacky project?

The Unchronicled Explorations is a multi-genre art and fiction project conceived and created by Missy Washington and Caitlin Strom.  Through photographs, writing, illustration and other miscellaneous methods, It tells the story of two quirky characters named Dr. Slobek and Professor Vostrüm.  Deep in undocumented forests, high in unverified mountains, these two adventurers are on an inscrutable journey.  It is unclear exactly what they hope to prove, but these objectives seem clear:

  • to live life as a never-ending exploration (as opposed to a path to accomplishment.)

  • to value curiosity over the amassing of knowledge.

  • to investigate a more fluid and indeterminate (as opposed to linear) experience of time, especially in relation to old-growth forests.

  • to undermine certain dualistic paradigms including (but not limited to): gender distinctions, goal and path, past and future, right and wrong, right and left, science and art.

To find out more, please watch the video and check out our website.


Why do we need money?

Last year, we created the first series of photographs in the forests of Northern California.  Since then we have been creating other elements of the project like maps, biographies, and herbarium specimens. Jentel Arts Foundation has offered us a one month residency to complete a second series of photographs in the dramatic and wintery landscape of northeastern Wyoming.  Jentel is providing us with housing, studio space, and a small stipend for food.  But we still need to pay for travel costs, costumes, props, and fine art photo printing costs.  That's why we need your help!  

We're trying to raise at least $5000 to cover these costs.  If you are able to donate, we are offering some great perks like stickers, posters, limited edition prints, and unique custom made pieces of art created by our characters.  If we don't reach our goal, don't worry, we'll still go to Wyoming and use whatever we do raise to great effect. 


What happens after Wyoming?

The next step is to create an exhibition and a book!  If you donate we will keep you fully updated on the progress of both of these things.  

This is really cool, but I'm broke - how else can I help?

You can still be of great help: please share share share and spread the word on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, playground, office break room, dog park etc.  The more buzz, the more support we get!

Arborealcant
Photograph

Sub Specie Aeternitatis: Duel of Wit
Photograph

story:
Short Summary

  • Between working a full time day job, spending time with my wife and two children, and working as a freelance photographer, I still manage to squeeze in my passion of capturing the outdoors in the form of photographs of nature, sunsets, and the night sky. 
  • I booked this trip with the primary goal of photographing the Northern Lights.
  • Since childhood, I have dreamed of visiting Alaska to see the bald eagles, orca whales, and witness the great wilderness Alaska has to offer with my own eyes. Now as an avid landscape photographer and workshop instructor, my plane ticket is purchased and I am Alaska bound!
  • This adventure does not come without its obvious costs, and I would like to go on a helicopter photo tour, but that will not be possible without your help!
  • As much as I'd love to be a full-time photographer going on a sponsored trip, this is simply an out-of-my-own-pocket passion adventure.
  • Between missing my wages from my day job, lens rental fees, and travel expenses, the financial burden of the trip is adding up. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are some more details:

  • Every level of your support receives a perk, no matter if my campaign gets fully funded or not!
  • Ideally I can recoup the cost of the trip, including travel expenses, meals, missed wages, and do slightly better than break even. If I reach my goal, I plan to book an helicopter photo tour!
  • Depending on your level of support, I am offering everything from smartphone wallpapers, to canvas prints, to future workshops!
  • If I do not reach my goal, I will still fulfill all perks and the excess funds will go to help off-set the costs of my trip.

The Impact

  • Being able to photograph the Northern Lights is a great, obvious next step for me as an astrophotographer and teacher.
  • As a fledgling photography business, photo trips can break the bank, but they can be crucial for sparking renewed creative energy.
  • Photographing these new-to-me environments means fresh photos that I can share with all of you!

Risks & Challenges

  • The plane ticket is already purchased, so I am committed.
  • If my goal is not reached, the show will go on, but this is a significant financial setback for my business and my family, and each contribution means so much to me!

Financial Breakdown (estimated)

  • Missed wages: $800
  • Travel expenses (plane/car/gas): $500
  • Food: $300
  • Lens Rental: $200
  • Aerial tour: $300
  • Total cost: $2,100
  • Note about lodging: fortunately I will be able to stay with family in Anchorage

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to financially contribute, I would be ecstatic if you shared my story!
story_txt:
Short Summary  Between working a full time day job, spending time with my wife and two children, and working as a freelance photographer, I still manage to squeeze in my passion of capturing the outdoors in the form of photographs of nature, sunsets, and the night sky.  

I booked this trip with the primary goal of photographing the Northern Lights.
 Since childhood, I have dreamed of visiting Alaska to see the bald eagles, orca whales, and witness the great wilderness Alaska has to offer with my own eyes. Now as an avid landscape photographer and workshop instructor, my plane ticket is purchased and I am Alaska bound! 
 This adventure does not come without its obvious costs, and I would like to go on a helicopter photo tour, but that will not be possible without your help!
As much as I'd love to be a full-time photographer going on a sponsored trip, this is simply an out-of-my-own-pocket passion adventure. 

Between missing my wages from my day job, lens rental fees, and travel expenses, the financial burden of the trip is adding up.  

   What We Need & What You Get Here are some more details:  Every level of your support receives a perk, no matter if my campaign gets fully funded or not!

Ideally I can recoup the cost of the trip, including travel expenses, meals, missed wages, and do slightly better than break even. If I reach my goal, I plan to book an helicopter photo tour!
 Depending on your level of support, I am offering everything from smartphone wallpapers, to canvas prints, to future workshops!
 If I do not reach my goal, I will still fulfill all perks and the excess funds will go to help off-set the costs of my trip.
    The Impact  Being able to photograph the Northern Lights is a great, obvious next step for me as an astrophotographer and teacher.
 As a fledgling photography business, photo trips can break the bank, but they can be crucial for sparking renewed creative energy.
 Photographing these new-to-me environments means fresh photos that I can share with all of you!
    Risks & Challenges    The plane ticket is already purchased, so I am committed.
 If my goal is not reached, the show will go on, but this is a significant financial setback for my business and my family, and each contribution means so much to me! 



Financial Breakdown (estimated)
 
Missed wages: $800
Travel expenses (plane/car/gas): $500
Food: $300
Lens Rental: $200
Aerial tour: $300
Total cost: $2,100

Note about lodging: fortunately I will be able to stay with family in Anchorage


    Other Ways You Can Help  If you are not able to financially contribute, I would be ecstatic if you shared my story!
